伟大 无需多言 整整两天废寝忘食 通宵达旦 除了吃饭就是善人死亡了 像是看完了一本很长的小说 结局相当震撼 叙诡的方式和999比起来完全不一样 999的震撼在于反转 而善人死亡的震撼在于本作宏大的世界观 不管999还是善死 打完结局再看开头都会有一种 哦哦哦！原来是这样的感叹 首尾呼应以及结尾对所有路程中的线索的回收实在是一大爽点 好玩！ 对中文补丁制作者表示感谢 谢谢你们让我不用啃生肉（哭） 记得刚开始没打补丁的时候 用着英语语音加日文字幕 连蒙带猜 虽然最基础的一些交流都能懂吧 但是遇见一些专业名词 什么药物或者理论不管日语英语都歇菜了 就算翻译成中文老实说都不一定看得懂  全靠对概念的一长串解释 草 所以非常感谢字幕组 阿里嘎多 
终于也是玩完了我心心念念的 一直拖 高一就想全部打完的 没想到过了五年才顺利把12都过了 颇为感慨 在现实的五年里 经历了这么多事 曾经一起说形态形成场的人 现在已经不怎么见得到了

I really liked the different routes and how you get to experience different outcomes based on your choices. The story can be confusing but it is a really good story once everything clicks for you. Some of the puzzles can be near impossible to solve without looking up a guide. The art style in the second game is much worse than the first one and the story does seem to drag out a bit too much.

999最后一题改得真可笑
vlr闪退还没自动存档

If nothing else, this pair of games really gives you something to talk to people about. The beat-to-beat writing is not very impressive, and in both games, for different reasons, it suffers from huge pacing issues. Scenes linger on overexplaining parts of the complex mystery plots, and both games waste a lot of opportunities for character development along the way. The plot itself, especially the premise of 999, is very interesting, and there are some really interesting structural ideas that play with the idea of ludonarrative. However, the payoff is very low, especially in VLR. There are multiple frustrating contrivances, end-of-game cliffhangers, and plot inconsistencies. I wouldn't recommend this over most other mystery games I know of, including Ghost Trick and Your Turn to Die (which is admittedly still in EA).
9小时9人9扇门， 完成了童年未完成的结局，游戏的剧情非比寻常，角色的创作也都很好，具体，独特，总的来说，是一款精心制作的作品。
what the fuck
Very good remake/remaster of the original duology. Has some issues running on steamdeck (VLR has some compatibility issues with certain versions of proton) but definitely worth playing.
Both VLR and 999 are amazing games. Neither of them are perfect games but they are both great experiences. I wish VLR moving on the map was easier haha, lot of repeating information

[h1] [b] 善人死亡！！！一坨狗屎！！！ [/b] [/h1]
[h2] [b] 打越钢太郎！！WCNM！！ [/b] [/h2]

-
剧透预警。
-
-
由于这是两部游戏的合集，一开始玩完999的时候就已经写过一次评测，当时打的好评。
但是，[b]善人死亡，真的太tm让人恶心了，所以这个差评不得不连坐了[/b]
-
-
[h2] [b] 【先说善人死亡】： [/b] [/h2]
[h3] [b]  【1】【低俗下头不合时宜且非常密集的黄段子】[/b] [/h3]
本以为999的感情线已经够让人恶心了。

但善人死亡中的打越钢太郎表示：
[spoiler] “我会在密室和文戏中，突然脱下我的裤子，进行一些短小下体的展示。” [/spoiler]

什么：想被青春美少女的大腿夹一下摸一下闻一下啦。
什么：刮开美女比基尼海报，拿到线索后想接着刮开衣服啦。
什么：老年淳平大谈特谈小色视频和大色视频，并且让小孙子都知道这些啦。
什么：回忆大人物的情人勾引喝醉酒的我啦……这一段意淫每条线都要重播一边。
什么：对法伊的胸部大小指指点点啦。
什么：密室中的种子播种成功后，让四叶不要说“播种”两个字啦。
什么：四叶穿防护服流汗，想到下流的事啦，想闻闻汗味啦。
什么：老头淳平说四叶也许会在AB房间里和主角进行某种交易啦。
什么：觉得钟表的时针和分针是乳头上的两根毛啦。
什么：在四叶爬着调查的时候幻想着后入的姿势啦。
什么：克服危机了就想看所有女角色的泳装啦。

……

不合时宜、低俗、下头、恶心、没品的无聊黄色段子，塞满了游戏的每一个角落。
本作中出现的所有女性，除了老年的茜之外，没有任何一个能逃过主角的意淫。

当然，所有的女性，也会在【外表是秃头老年人】的主角面前，脸红心跳，打情骂俏，说不符合人设的话，做不符合人设的事。

老年的淳平也是节操掉尽。没和四叶相认的时候，像个老变态一样，说什么“啊是我没有取得四叶的信任所以”——然后转头就和主角一起意淫曾经生死相依的队友。

[b]请问。这是打越的个人品味，还是本游戏所有受众群体的共同爱好？[/b]
[spoiler]真他妈完蛋，居然还有meta元素，隔着屏幕让我感觉被人猥亵了……[/spoiler]

唯一一处觉得还可以的，是最后拆所有炸弹的时候，主角说活下来就想看泳装。这种危机的时候俏皮一下，还挺好的——但是后来主角反反复复的提啊！和所有人都说一遍啊！！这时候我才发现什么叙事节奏感，什么剧情氛围，狗屁！！！这就他妈是打越又双叒叕在脱裤子！！！

[h3] [b] 【2】【九人游戏】[/b] [/h3]
比起999，这代的游戏我只能给出一个评价：低级。
这个规则，是怎么做到又复杂又没用的？
首先弄出单双人，其次分颜色，然后又弄什么协助和背叛，好像要开始勾心斗角算分了。
结果事实是：

 [b] （1）分数根本没有用，即使分数达到，武力值不够也出不去。[/b] 
你以为这已经足够恶心了？更恶心的是，几乎所有人都能踩着你的脸出去——只有玩家是小丑。

 [b] （2）作者可以随意掌控每个人在哪一轮进哪个门。[/b] 
在999里，每个人的数字至少是固定的。
但是在善人死亡，每一轮结束会重新更新腕表上的信息。
什么意思呢，在999，编剧需要掉头发算门，给不同的数字分配不同的剧情，最后整理出一套文理双全的流程来。
但在善人死亡，他只需要每次给不同的人更新不同的信息，就可以随意控制这个世界线的搭配。
太，不，优，雅，了。或者说，幽默。

 [b] （3）反复出现修改规则的情况。[/b] 
本来关于规则的设定就已经够复杂了，结果还反复补充规则，箱子里的物品一拿就是四五个……不觉得累赘吗？
最逆天的是，只有彩门第二门的绿门里才有AB游戏的补充规则。只要是DIO进入了绿门的世界线，他就会把这份规则藏起来，等以后糊你脸上。
还可以这样玩啊？打越钢太郎？这么有松弛感？

 [b] （4）可以作弊逃脱惩罚。[/b] 
这个先注射麻醉，过几分钟再下毒，让人窒息而死的惩罚方式，就是为了让各种人逃课而包的饺子。
1.主角的胳膊是假肢，斩断就可以不死。
2.玩家中有机器人，机器人本身就不会死。
3.密室的治疗仓可以冰冻，冰冻后腕表脱落，直接自由身。
4.用锡箔纸包住腕表，就能模拟心脏停跳，假死摘下腕表。
5.游戏中出现了解药，注射解药也可以不死。
——HELLO？请问一下，这里是八仙过海的拍摄现场吗？

 [b] （5）暴力可以解决一切问题。[/b] 
有人达到9分想偷跑——群起攻之
不想让对手参加AB投票——打晕
对搭档的投票方案不满意——揍一拳抢先手
青壮邪教分子拿着炸弹引爆器——不管是花季少女还是白发老头都能轻松夺走
……最逆天的是。
主角永远是挨揍的，跑不快的。反派永远是得逞的，跑出门的。
脸都给你摁水泥地上了两三回了，你还得接着玩，毕竟来都来了。

[h3] [b]【3】【游戏画面】[/b] [/h3]
3D建模丑的要死。你告诉我这代的爱丽丝，和上一代的那个ALL-ICE爱丽丝，和结尾中那个黑皮长腿艳后级别的大美人，这能是同一个人？？？

人物的模型丑到无法让人产生任何感情，在这样的情况下主角还能坚定不移地开黄腔，女角色的衣服还能一个比一个暴露，也是逆天。

密室的建模非常粗糙，角度非常猎奇，感觉像是背靠着一个球在移动，只能用鼠标蹭着屏幕去转圈。

视角控制极其不稳定，选择区域非常不明显。
类似书库的地方，可点击的区域不明确。
类似机械室的地方，很多复杂的机械是装饰性的贴图，实际上并点不了。
第一次在这种游戏里玩到晕3D。

医务室那个大屏幕，要插入记忆卡，结果插进去之后，在一个巨大的卡槽里，1%的面积中，出现了五个微不可查的像素点……你告诉我这是插进去的记忆卡？！！
想偷懒就别点这几个点上去，别建这个插进去的模了不行吗，我当时都气笑了。
要不咱没这个水平就老实一点，和上一代保持一致不行吗？？这画面看过去，到底谁是09年谁是12年啊？？这3D效果，和03年的仙剑奇侠传三也差不多啊？？

[h3] [b]【4】【游戏系统】[/b] [/h3]
（1）BE后的流程界面，按返回键就会自动回到那个闪瞎人眼睛的B开场动画。而且这个流程界面也非常容易误触，上下滚动很不方便。

（2）屎一样的物品选择。这代不能像上一代一样在外面用V键切换，非得进去让你一个个顺时针逆时针的点。类似调酒和种子那两个密室里，身上十几个东西，先要找到，然后再要找到组合物，调个酒操作繁琐的像是拆原子弹，地图上的东西一点就会直接拿到手上，然后你又要重新在手头十几个东西里翻找你刚刚手上拿的那个。这B密室还他妈要调六杯酒才能打出完美。最屎的是，你想调后三杯酒拿成就，还得把前三杯倒掉，还得在十几个物品栏里再找几遍。这六杯酒你要开机关，还得按顺序放好，这顺序还给你设置个谜题和坑，你试错的时候你就试吧，拿起放下拿起放下拿起放下拿起放下拿起放下，每一次都要点进物品界面点点点，我操你妈。

（3）屎一样的密室视角和移动。
直播玩了两条线，我朋友说我在密室里贴着墙蹭蹭蹭挪视角的样子好像贴着墙走的小偷。

（4）屎一样的重复播送动画。
特别是舱室，一个走廊里他妈的三个房间，每个房间开门放个动画，关门放个动画，然后你进门，出门开门放个动画，出门再放个动画。这谜题还要你在这几个房间里走好几次，打个密室光他妈在开关门了。
箱子里给你地图，然后在大厅里开个门，看地图上的小点走走走走走，然后切地图开个门，看地图的小点走走走走走，再放个ppt展示一下你路过或者进入的房间……
问题是这游戏他妈的二十几条线路结局，每一条线都有近十次这样的环节，进密室嘚嘚嘚放一遍动画，出密室嘚嘚嘚放一边动画，人走丢了嘚嘚嘚放一连串动画，三十个小时的流程至少五个小时在看动画，这一点时间拿起手机刷不了两下，不拿手机就只能搁哪干看着——这到底是哪个天才想出来的设计？？

[spoiler] 你可以在2012年的善人死亡里玩到星空。 [/spoiler]

[h3] [b] 【5】【密室】[/b] [/h3]
确实比一代做的用心，难度也更高一点。但是，他有，15个！！
在这种恶心人操作模式下的密室！！15个！！每个里面还有至少三个谜题！！
有人喜欢吗？反正我不是受众……

还有，为什么，明明面前就挂着好几件白大褂，我还是要去找块专门的布才能擦干净这片污渍？

[h3] [b] 【6】【人设】[/b] [/h3]
一坨翔啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊。
作为一个剧情游戏，每个人说的话都差不多，换另一个人来说毫无违和感。
人物没有自己的感情，全部为了打越脑中的“爱情”“正义”“拯救世界”而服务。
当机器人露娜是人群中最像人的一个的时候，打越，你才是最不是人的东西。

（1）露娜：
虽然说露娜是最像人的，但是在剧情方面，她完全就是个工具角色。
有人要治病：露娜。
有锅要背：露娜。
有大片无聊的剧情要反复解说：露娜。
然后你问露娜为什么，露娜：计划。
再问：不能说，反正就是计划。
全程扮演一个纯善的老好机器人角色，玩家对她有好感也是理所应当吧。
但她对主角的执着好莫名其妙。是主人的任务吗所以是？
最后在主角怀里掉皮的时候，我感觉编剧是想煽情一下的，但是当时我已经被这个游戏搞红温了，而且这么俗套的机器人故事也完全感动不了我。

（2）K：
同样是工具人角色。铠甲下是不是自己都不能决定。
需要他干坏事的时候就让他金蝉脱壳出来一下，需要BE的时候就让他给爱丽丝一拳BE一下，需要制服什么人的时候就让他出现武力担当一下。
背景故事无聊，且也是为醋包的饺子。
请问，玩完之后，谁能告诉我，K的性格特点是什么？

（3）DIO：
塑造出这种纯坏的、人物弧光为0的角色，也是够懒的。

（4）老年淳平：
小丑。

（5）夸克：
通过失踪和生病来推动主线的小学生角色，纯纯误入，与游戏的关系为0。

（6）四叶：
第一部的四叶：聪明、解谜王者、斧神。
第二部的四叶：干啥啥不行，卖色第一名。设定是特工，从来没成功。
而且，哥哥呢？？她哥在地球上死八百年了，编剧，你让她一句话都不说是吧？？

（7）爱丽丝：
被抓来的原因：数学好。衣服穿的少。

（8）女主：
一会儿高冷，一会儿假小子，同样是穿越者但戏份只有男主四分之一，感觉是为了印证男主穿越的事实才存在的角色，本来以为武力值很强，结果告诉我是因为月球上的重力才飞得那么高……
笔墨最多，但轮回者之间那种惺惺相惜的感觉，没有。

（9）男主：
[spoiler] （掌声）（掌声）（掌声）
全剧塑造最好的角色！！！
肾虚无能老色p的形象深入人心！！！！
（掌声）（掌声）（掌声） [/spoiler]

[h3] [b] 【7】【剧情】[/b] [/h3]
30个小时！30个小时！30个小时！
你告诉我，所谓的“神作剧情”，就是平行空间+穿越拯救世界？
除了这个还有什么？共用的铠甲马甲？和前作的无聊联动？主角其实是凶手，是个老头？密室不在地球上？

这些是有意思的剧情吗？

莫名其妙的给人物写一些小传，糊在玩家脸上。说夸克的故事，说爱丽丝的故事，说K的故事。然后呢？你的结局？
夸克0弧光0作用，爱丽丝的任务和执念呢？四叶的哥哥呢？

K更是直接：“意识体被弹飞了。”
飞了走了不见了，像是春光、像是火焰、像是热情！
最后再来一段神头鬼脸的彩蛋，感觉K好像要做什么大事一样。
但打完这个游戏我感觉：他只是在为第三部的饺子和面。

主角西格玛，灰暗的未来45年都要研究机器，拯救世界还失败失败失败再失败。
连一句：“为什么是我？”都没说，还挺有觉悟的。

死舔狗淳平，一代里死了多少次救下来的女人，根本没把他当回事。
茜甚至还：[spoiler]“（笑）……天明寺。我可以清楚地预见到你抓狂的样子。”[/spoiler]

哈？

DIO那个邪教是假的，茜才是真的邪教吧，妈的老妖婆害人不浅。

很难评。包了这么多饺子，就是为了这盘无聊透顶的馊醋。
到底是什么人在喜欢这个游戏？能在评论区告诉我它好玩在哪里吗？

哦，说个好笑的。K把茜当妈妈，把男主当爸爸。
这是否意味着，二代男主当面NTR了一代男主？——这下味儿就对了。
如果说为了拯救世界，做这些乱七八糟的剧情就很可笑。
但是如果是为了绿人，那我就完全可以理解了嘛！
毕竟一代也是为了一个女人、为了一个小玩偶，死来死去死来死去啊！

 [b] 打越钢太郎！！我操你妈！！ [/b]

[h2] [b] 【极限脱出999】： [/b] [/h2]
以下内容是善人死亡通关之前写的。
本来给999写了很长的评价，但善人死亡差评字数太多，放不下了……（绷不住了
所以是删减版。
-
不考虑淳平和茜在善死之中的小丑表现，单论999，可以给到8分，值得一玩。
……我很无语，真的，我现在很无语。
如果我也有时空穿越的能力，我绝对不会点开善人死亡.jpg
-
-
单看剧情，叙诡用的很娴熟，吐槽和各种理论交织在游戏过程中并不突兀，和nds结合的很好，张力很足，题材也很好——我是真的啃不动日常，这种杀人游戏剧情进展快很多。
再看数学，数字根虽然算起来不难，但是要想好各种排列组合就很难。而要让不同排列组合的人进入相应的门、发展出合适的剧情的话——难爆了好吗。
即使是站在上帝视角我也不懂到底是怎么做到的……
伪科学部分虽不明但觉厉，碎片化的分布在剧情里，还是挺自然的。
结局有些怪但还是圆上了，在剧本的角度看已经非常完美了，至少我写不出来……如果优化一下系统的话可能打的分会更高一些。暴力移植太影响这部的体验了。
-
-
（4）金库结局：
这里距离真相感觉一步之遥了，推理过程表现的很不错，尤其是14383421那里。
但是。
尼尔斯的部分，太让人失望了……
怎么说呢，对尼尔斯这个角色有着很高的预期。盲人、二进宫、听力、身手、智商，这些他都有。是一个很值得好好写一写的、能担很多戏的角色。
但是，这哥们最高光的部分就在金库结局了，剧情还是妹妹死了所以崩溃的拉一宫一起死……啊？
不是，啊？编剧？
还搞得一副好煽情的样子，但我脑子里：杀人书25层的慧在泉水挂机三天三夜，一睡醒就技能全空走男枪脸上被乱枪崩死，送1000赏金掉大龙。
……太失败了这段演出，太失败了尼尔斯的剧本，太失败了金库结局这最后一段。
尼尔斯在真结局里也全程划水，像一个路人甲一样，一会在9年前剧组当背景板，一会在9年后剧组当背景板。
换的衣服也很奇怪。这个故事和什么行星根本就没关系吧？怎么还换个星座袍子，还和木乃伊一样躺棺材里？寓意着什么呢？
总之，金库结局有种虎头蛇尾的感觉，明明前面很燃，到后面就拉裤里了……金裤结局……
尼尔斯，战斗力不如妹妹，解谜不如妹妹，终极技能是蛮王开大锁血几秒然后拉人下水，实在是让人挠头不已……
-
（5）真结局：
好难打，有flow我都觉得麻烦，不知道nds该怎么活。
补了一点nds的实况，确实pc缺少了表现力，最后的谜题也很水。
但是意思都表达到了，也还可以吧。
除了各种进制的部分都看懂了，前期铺垫也足够，但还是有些地方比较牵强。
比如，茜在主角选错了线的时候都还活着，只是会发烧。
找了一下茜几次发烧的时间，发现都是在红线故事里，也就是说，如果淳平不走真结局路线，茜就会发烧，九年前的那位就寄了（天哪，这不是余火状态的不死人吗！）
选错路线不立马死这一点看到很多人说了，但是我觉得也可以这样解释：要到9年前的那一刻才会消失。
说实话，真结局虽然串联了前面所有的科普和内容，也算是好结局。
但是坑填的还是不够完美。
一宫的动机很搞笑，就是为了治脸盲……？他的脸盲是完全分不清人的，但是想想就知道，不看清脸也可以通过身高、声音、衣服、饰品来分辨人吧。
他连白毛猴子和棕毛猴子都分不出来也太搞笑了。
木乃伊突然出来打车很莫名其妙，希望玩后两部的时候能看到答案。
有融会贯通的感觉，但不如金库部分的推理来的实在，而且我实在看不懂字母和数字转换的那个进制感觉像在听天书……
特别是，明明有15分钟解最后焚烧炉房间的谜题，小情侣非要隔空喊话喊到只剩6分钟，你两不能先把这答案算出来再说吗？非要拖到只剩一秒钟交卷的时候写名字吗？我真的快急死了。
还有，明明只是住在不同学区分到不同的初中了吧？这么喜欢为什么一直不联系啊？小学分到一个学校说明你两住的也不远啊……
-
八代的角色塑造很失败。
或者说，这一作里的女的没一个能逃掉。八代卖胸，紫卖骚话（点名批评第一次密室和电梯这两处），四叶的打扮看起来也很典——不是我说，你八代一个那么牛逼的程序员，想要搜集情报，你做的选择居然是四十岁了去当舞娘而不是黑人家电脑？啊？日本人的电脑技术不是很烂吗，感觉你随随便便啊？为什么下海了？啊？编剧，说话？虽然我偷看八代的胸也偷看的很爽，但是不得不说这种设定很低俗。八代还有女儿，我不认为一个这种脾气的、有女儿的妈妈会去做舞娘……
感觉就像，senta的妹妹死了，senta选择卖钩子给一宫，靠传播性病报仇一样离谱。
-
【其他】
【1】最关键的9号门和q号门，居然是谐音梗，因为日语的9读起来就是q……妈呀大姐，这种关键信息出现无法跨文化翻译的情况是很严重的失误吧。
【2】这么大一个项目，花这么多钱，你们把分组弄错了？？一共18个人，弄错了4个？？
【3】想知道尼尔斯的鼻子好不好使。有点地狱，但是我想着尼尔斯确定茜死了应该是靠闻味儿吧……或者是听酥皮的声音……好了，那么尼尔斯能不能对这段记忆发表一下看法，想知道他对死人复活怎么看。有种系统发给我一个智囊但是智囊是哑巴的无力感。
【4】斧子结局太偷工减料了，想看四叶哐哐杀人的cg。
【5】背刺和潜艇结局有些无聊和同质化。
【6】感情戏真的太遗憾了，一个是紫被塑造成了娇弱痴女，另一个是，回忆太过突兀。感情流降神不太合适吧，真的可以写得更好的，不然主角这样死去活来有点小丑。

我是真的觉得999整体还不错，为什么善人死亡会是这个样子。
把作者骟了的话会好一些吗？他真的一点都不会写感情戏，也不会写黄段子。

善死的爱丽丝说她不是ICE9的木乃伊，那这个铺垫了两部的重要信息用处在于……第三部？

这到底是个密室解谜游戏还是剧情向的游戏呢？
如果说剧情是密室送的，评价也许会高一些。

第二部，密室得到的信息量太少，线路之间重复度太高，多密室只是为了多一两轮来投票，为了多点时间来推动剧情（是的，夸克，就靠你失踪和生病了），意义真的不大。

或者说整个九人游戏都很没意义。
如果说【游戏的真相超脱于九人游戏之外】，可【玩家90%的时间都在玩这个游戏】。
在这种情况下，规则弄得如此儿戏，人物塑造的如此扁平，游戏的可玩性又在哪里呢？
打越的“炫技”？
要不直接把剧本拿去改成小说算了，不要做成游戏了，折磨人没意思。

Peak fiction from 999 alone

Edit halfway through the review, Edit 2 at the end for VLR first impressions.

Giving a first review after playing for about 8 hours in 999. The story and the characters are both intriguing, and I love the mystery behind everything. It keeps me wanting to guess what's the real deal of Zero and the Nonary Games.

However, with how much dialogue and narration there is, it's been rather disappointing how easy are the puzzles. The game gives you too many clues, and there are many moments I'd love to have guessed by myself that it was a total letdown having a character or a clue giving out the literal solution. I'm in the 6th escape, and I can't believe how easy the game still is.

I give a positive review for now, since it's interesting story-wise, and the puzzles are kinda fun, but I'm hoping other puzzles in 999 and VLR are actually harder than what I've seen so far.

Edit: I've beaten 999 with all the endings, and the experience ended up much better than I thought initially. Even though the game was overall easier than I hoped, there were definitely a couple of puzzles that I had to get think out of the box and get creative to solve them.

Another positive aspect of 999 is that getting all the endings doesn't get boring. You can fastforward anything that you've seen previously, and every new Novel/Escape piece you unlock brings so much insight about the situation and the characters that it kept me going, wishing for more.

I'll definitely miss the journey and getting to know the characters. Now, onto VLR!

EDIT 2: I played 2 hours of VLR and it's already way better gameplay wise. There's more agency to search the room, and the puzzles are definitely more challenging when playing on Hard (which means characters barely give any clues).

Overall, I can already say The Nonary Games pack is brilliant and a must-play for those looking for a high quality Visual Novel and Puzzle-Solving experience.

MIND*FCK: The Videogame
A surprisingly good combination of a visual novel and an escape room type game.
Like

If you're keen on solving puzzles with a death threat lingering at the corner then, well, this game is for you. Similar vibes to the Danganronpa series ( a bunch of people trapped in a confined space, a psychopath plushie, a killer on the loose) , but there are multiple endings (sort of) and puzzles are more about point-and-click rooms than about talking and looking for links. The best feature imo is the "story tree" (much like in "Detroit: Become Human") which allows you to jump between the story points and choose different paths without the need to juggle with saves or replay the whole game.
Absolute peak of storytelling - one of the best games where you'll wish you can go back and play them for the first time

I got into danganronpa and after I finished those games I wanted more. Saw all these weird older titles....read the reviews and dismissed them thinking they were the beta for what would become danganronpa. Long story short all that was wrong. These are just as good as danganronpa but in different almost experimental and rough yet extremely polished ways. It's hard to explain honestly. You should play these if you liked danganronpa.

I found 999 amazing yet VLR felt like a chore to finish... The story is great too but I couldn't take the 3D models seriously and it took a long time to play because many routes are very similar except for some deails and the endings. I actually liked how each route gave a few more clues for solving the mystery (and it canonically makes lots of sense) but actually playing the same story with a few changes over and over again felt very tiring. 
999 is more diverse with the routes and endings despite being shorter and I kinda found the whole "Nonary game system" more creative here than in VLR.
Overall I think both games have their advantages but I personally found 999 way easier to go through mentally (since it's less repetitive) and less predictable which made it more fun.

Saw for weebs

This game is 2 games wrapped into 1 and when it is on sale, it is a great deal. In both games, you are doing puzzles, learning about the characters, and gaining information that can be used in other timelines. 

The first game is rather short however it has a ton of character packed into it. Character conversations are typically a mix between dumb jokes or characters reciting a full Wikipedia article like it is common knowledge. It is really hard taking anything seriously in the story but going in with that in mind is a lot of fun since you get to just point out how ridiculous everything is. The puzzles aren't very complex but in this case I would say the story is the primary draw for the game.

The second game is much longer than the first due a drastic increase in the amount of timelines and decisions. There are parts that get very repetitive and certain things that slow the game down a lot and are unskipable (I wish I didn't have to watch characters walk along the map everywhere). This game has more complex puzzles than the first and a similarly ridiculous story. 

I think both games together are great value and a lot of fun if you enjoy visual novels, puzzles, and a ridiculous story. Personally, I would recommend streaming this for your friends as seeing how crazy stuff get is more fun when you have people to talk about it with.

For some reason they packaged the first 2 games in ZeroEscape into one for Steam so I'll review them both here.

999: Solid characters, fun puzzles, even if at times they felt a little flat or too out there for my tastes but I am also very bad at puzzles. The ending and the story themes and plot points are all great, never feeling silly to me and I really liked the ending in particular with how it wasn't spelt out for you.I really liked the story overall and its pacing being as good as you can really expect from a story of this nature with my only major complaint being its required back tracking for seeing the final few endings. Atleast in this remaster of it compared to the DS version, you have a flow chart for quickly travelling between timelines and keeping track of them all because in the original DS version you had to RESTART THE ENTIRE GAME FOR EACH TIMELINE which sounds completely awful and would likely kill a lot of enjoyment for the story. One of the best cases of a remaster I've seen and makes this the definitive way to play and experience 999.

ZLR: Urokoshi you have done it again. My favourite out of the 3 Zeroescape VN, opening the flowchart after 999 is a good way to jumpscare someone as well. I thoroughly enjoyed almost every puzzle in this one, finding very few confusing or really out there(FUCK THE TREATMENT CENTER MATH LOGIC PUZZLE). Voice acting just like the 1st was fantastic and just felt, natural to be there and I have no complaints on that front. The story for this one is far superior to the already solid story of the first entry and GOD I was fawning over how cool the entire last section of it was, fantastic plot twist and might be up there as one of my favourite and most insane plot twists I have ever seen. Only real negatives I could really think of is how due to some conversations being SLIGHTLY different you cant skip them when going through other timelines which was annoying but the ability to text skip fixed most of the timeline issues from 999.

Overall, 2 fantastic visual novels I highly recommend checking out if only to witness the absolute insanity of Kotaro Uchikoshi.

I just adore this types of visual novels. They pack in nearly every sci-fi and fiction trope imaginable: androids, AI, time travel, teleportation, memory and consciousness manipulation, 4th-dimensional beings, aliens, space stations, viruses, nanotech, simulations, augmentation - you name it. It’s not even a spoiler because I can’t remember which of these games had what, given how many themes they all always have. But this series in particular, is such great fun. The main writer for this series mentioned in an interview that they develop the stories by starting from the twists and working backward. And you can really tell that’s the case, as it’s a defining characteristic of all three games. You never know what will happen next, and you need to be ready for anything. Still, I recommend not thinking too hard about the stories and themes because you’ll quickly notice some plot holes and inconsistencies. So, treat them not as hard-thought-out sci-fi but as insane Japanese twist-filled rollercoasters, and you will definitely have a great time.
Still the best games ever. Worth it.
one of the best games i have ever played in my entire life. still waiting for junpei or seven to propose to me.

Firstly, let me say how happy I am I finally get to play this game. I remember reading about 999 in Nintendo Power some odd 15 years ago and thinking it sounded so interesting but never getting the chance to play the original release on the DS. So imagine my shock seeing the port of 999 packaged with its sequel on steam. Funny times we live in.

Soooo... let me say I am not the kind of person that gravitates towards the visual novel games. The concept just sounded so enticing. Escape rooms tied into a thriller narrative about escaping a game where you and 8 others are playing with your lives and your decisions affect the way the story plays out? I would say the concept mostly hits right on. I am sure glad I played through both 999 and VLR. I have a number of issues with the gameplay and the story which I will detail below but spoiling major points of the narrative. If the concept sounds interesting, highly recommend grabbing when it goes on sale because it's hard to go wrong for the sale price and you owe it to yourself to go into these games with as minimal knowledge as possible. 

Alrighty so, [spoiler] the biggest gripe I have with the games (but especially VLR) is the way the game handles the non-linear story telling. The best way to put it is going into this, I thought these games were more linear stories where your choices would influence the outcome (akin to Detroit Become Human or Heavy Rain). So for example, I thought my choices in 999 would mean that maybe Santa escapes but not Akane. The reality couldn't be more different. Not necessarily bad, probably better, just notably different. So each game has a "true" ending, but to get to the true ending you need to see the other endings because your character is able to retain information between branching paths because... morphogenetic fields (basically the ability to send or receive thoughts through an invisible medium, something like reading minds). The crux of my gripe here is in both games you can be playing through and based on the choices you made be heading towards a certain ending but if you haven't seen other endings at that point that contain information relevant to your chosen path, you are locked out of progressing that pathway and your game with end on a cliffhanger and give the message "to be continued..." So I get it. After finishing VLR and experiencing the true ending, it was worth going thru all the other endings and slowly being drip-fed information that allows you to piece everything together and lead into some great reveals. BUT, it was so frustrating having something intriguing happen only to be told "you aren't allowed to see this yet, come back later." I don't know that there is a good solution to this unfortunately, and I understand it's a necessary evil. But holy shit it happened to me like 3 or 4 times in a row in VLR. I only remember 1 or 2 times it happened in 999.

Also, the escape rooms kinda suck. In both games. Difficulty ranges from "put the key in the correct colored keyhole" to "ADFGX cypher on Mob of the Dead." I specifically remember the pantry in VLR and the cargo hold as two that seemed far more difficult compared to the other puzzles at their respective points in their stories. This is definitely a personal opinion and I can see most people disagreeing with this take but I just wanted to put it out there. For me, oddly enough, this wasn't even a deal breaker since I was really into this game for the story so the puzzles were secondary.

Finally, I just kinda got the ick with some of the dialog in VLR. There was some dialog that was... gross. I'm thinking of when Luna is on her hands and knees under the desk in the archives and Sigma comments on how he cant believe hes seeing someone in that position in real life and how he wants her to stay in that position as long as possible. I don't mind a good sexual innuendo but it came off as really out of place given the tone of the rest of the game. [/spoiler]

Overall, 2 great games with some quirks but are worth it if you want an interesting story.

相比于999，VLR的剧本就显得有些太过慢热了——这本不应该是这么明显的缺点，但在游戏中期，就会不可避免地遇到两件糟心事。
其一是爱丽丝线前后，在剧情没有太多进展地情况下，Sigma几乎被塑造成了逆天龟男，让人气不打一处来。
其二是游戏没有办法实时更换“跳过”功能，而在没有“全部跳过”的情况下，看那个b地图上玩家移动的点，和每次遇到都要开一遍的各种门，真的是血压飙升。
我在VLR中期一度有了不想打下去的欲望；我反而觉得999在人物塑造上更加讨喜一些，至少为了茜，淳平真的有拉下脸当坏人的果断；但Sigma真的是几乎从头龟到尾，很多时候在以伤害自己——也就是玩家经常带入的角色的方式来换取剧情的展开和情报，甚至对不起他在封面上那个拉风的立绘。
但剧本还是挺不错的，在糟心的爱丽丝线结束后，VLR就开始爆典展开了，在一二作总共40小时左右的时长里，我觉得有35个小时的体验都还是不错的。

从剧情来说，穿越时空的心灵感应，呼应了全篇一直在提及的伪科学猜想，有点《你的名字》的感觉，当然2011年的游戏绝对算得上是老前辈了。

Zero Escape: The Nonary Games是《极限脱出》系列的前两部作品的合集，编剧是负责过Ever 17等经典AVG游戏剧本的打越钢太郎，而这两作在剧情上的确也算得上精彩，属于值得一试的视觉小说作品

游戏以悬疑、密室逃脱见长，通过寻找藏在各个分支线中的线索来推进剧情，并融合了一点科幻、心理理论和一套还算能自圆其说的“伪科学”设定。其中提到的一些著名的观点/实验比如“薛定谔的猫”和“中文房间”也在剧情伏笔设置中起到了关键作用：[spoiler]前者为“K”铠甲背后真实身份的变更以及“茜”的存在死亡叠加态埋了伏笔，后者则在露娜END中讨论了人工智能的意识问题，整个实验设施或许就是一个巨大的“中文房间”，露娜关在其中，而其他人类参与者在房间之外。[/spoiler]
而贯穿第二部的AB游戏其实就是一个大型的囚徒困境。还有很多例子就不一一展开了，不过挺喜欢这种现实中提出过的观点/实验和游戏自设的概念融到一起的设定

密室逃脱部分，第一部因为存在较多计算内容，所以游戏贴心地给玩家附赠了一个可以随时拿出的“计算器”（数字根也是剧情核心之一）。第二部的密室的谜题难度有所升级，新增的隐藏文件机制作为发现逃脱钥匙后继续探寻的可选项，并且还添加了笔记本功能，可以直接在游戏内写写画画、记录自己的思路了。不过我游玩时都是旁边放了纸笔一边算一边解谜的orz...

[b]缺点：[/b]如果说第一部类似老生化的开门动画给游戏体验渲染了一丝惊悚的话，第二部不能跳过的跑图和开门动画则是完全冗余。动画本身较于前作更为耗时，且续作大量的剧情分支和略重复的情节使得游戏前中期的体验不尽人意（P.S. 如果没有按照推荐顺序攻克各条线路的话，那么遭遇的一个个剧情锁也会给这段糟糕体验火上浇油）

[i]“Tu fui, ego eris.” [/i]「我曾是你，你将是我。」放个游戏中出现的拉丁文句子作结（貌似寂静岭里也出现过），这句话基本上点明了两部游戏核心桥段的内容

[h2] Summary of Nonary Games [/h2]
Pros:
- Balance between story and puzzles
- Creative escape rooms
- Diverse cast
- Wonderful voice acting
- Mysterious and intriguing story
 
[h3] 999 Summary [/h3]
999 is a fantastic as a standalone game. It's the less complicated game in the series.

Cons:
- Due to the original DS game having two screens, the PC version will switch in/out ADV mode
- [spoiler] No further explanation about Alice [/spoiler]
- Less endings in comparison to VLR

[h3] VLR Summary [/h3]
Personally, I think VLR is the peak of the series. VLR has a story unlike 999.

Cons:
- [spoiler] The ending has more questions than answers [/spoiler]
- Clover's unsettling smile bug
- Repetitive gameplay
I am still waiting for swimsuit time.

[h3] 999 [/h3]

A classic point and click puzzle first person game.

It is also an interesting Visual Novel story. The characters have a lot of personality and ambience fits really well. Did 100% in 17 hours or so.

It's weak points: sometimes you get stuck because you can't find something important to the puzzle solution, rather than the puzzle itself. Like in the kitchen I needed something to sharpen and cut. I couldn't find the knife because it was on a small box in the shelf. Sorry, but it isn't really fun to keep clicking on everything until you get it. Luckly, it happened only a few times.

Another thing is that if you want to get all endings, be prepared to redo some puzzles. Yes, you can't simply go back and choose another 'answer' (you will understand once you are trying to do all endings).

[b]8.5 / 10[/b]

[h3] Virtue's Last Reward[/h3]

It's also a somewhat puzzle click game, except:

- The graphics are different, they tried to do it in 3d, but it isn't totally in 3d. I personally prefer the first one.

- I didn't found the issue where I couldn't find whatever I was looking for. So great.

- The weak point of having to redo and listen to the same history, even through different paths still stays, it becomes boring after a while.

The good is that the story is still top notch and it connects to the 999 game very well.

[b]8 / 10[/b]

[h3]If you get a bundle for cheap with 2 of those games, it's strongly recommended and worth of your time![/h3]
Amazing storytelling, and diversity in gameplay. Fun puzzles and very intriguing stories. Some of the best games for each genre. Very highly recommended.

[h1]Reseña del Videojuego: \Zero Escape: The Nonary Games\ – El Escape Room Virtual que Necesitabas[/h1]

[h2]Resumen[/h2]
Si alguna vez te has preguntado cómo se sentiría estar atrapado en un rompecabezas macabro donde cada decisión puede ser la última, ¡felicidades! \Zero Escape: The Nonary Games\ es tu boleto de oro hacia una montaña rusa emocional que combina el terror psicológico y puzzles que harán explotar tu cerebro. Y sí, es tan divertido como suena.

[h2]Aspectos importantes e interesantes[/h2]
Este juego viene con una historia que engancha más que un maratón de \La casa de papel\. Tienes a nueve personajes metidos en un barco, y cada uno tiene que descubrir cómo salvar su pellejo resolviendo rompecabezas. Cada elección importa, y puede significar la diferencia entre desentrañar un misterio o terminar como cena de peces. Los acertijos son de esos que te hacen sentir como un genio cuando los resuelves, y hay suficientes giros y vueltas en la historia como para mantenerte adivinando hasta el último minuto.

[h2]Aspectos por mejorar[/h2]
Aunque la historia es estelar, a veces te encuentras con que ciertas secciones del juego pueden sentirse un poco repetitivas. Y, claro, no podemos olvidar a los doblajes, que a veces dan más risa que miedo. Un poquito más de inversión en ese departamento, y este juego podría ser perfecto.

游玩观感贬高于褒，基于个人体验选择不推荐。
先说最令人不适的一点，与打越钢太郎前作惯见的手法一致，全篇充斥着女性不适的低级性别黄色笑话，泳装萝莉特工胸带贴馒头，建模与恶俗黄油无异，无法用时代局限性正名，与更早期发售的同类竞品逆裁相比，在游玩观感方面已经是天与地的差距。

文字游戏却bug繁多，在999进行期间无数次闪退以至于必须重过关卡，操作系统过时，UI厚重，且游玩时间较长有眩晕倾向，这是硬伤；剧本冗长，日常无趣，伪科学而无力拆解，离开对异性的有色审视不会开玩笑，这是软伤。

通篇的剧情观感是“为了一叠醋包了一盘饺子”。采用了与ever17核心基本相同的诡计，在现时代已经称不上新鲜，以至于忍受了无尽的性化、眩晕的不适与冗长的重复抵达结局，真相一环一环揭开，也并没有收获到与我的忍耐成正比的惊喜感。与写有秘密的笔记有类似体验，游戏本体便像是无意间捡起了一名宅男的幻想笔记，匮乏太多优化。对打越的评价是很有点子，可以作为提供创意的副手，而担不起制作的重责，更需要一个优秀的团队为他的剧本进行雕塑。

角色塑造非常失败。一个简单的小测试，令随机两名角色的日常台词对调，不会感受到人设突兀。得以证明剧本笔力的缺陷。
先说一代，官配恋爱谈得六亲不认毁天灭地人格全失，非黑即白的塑造理念，包装出除三名设计的“恶人”外全员“善人”的单一塑造——最终也达成了恶有恶报善有善报的童话故事。
遗憾剧本对人性的匮乏洞察与笔力不足，且受限于多选择多发展的机制要求，为此所有角色的塑造几乎都前后矛盾，动机与抉择无一立得住脚。
单举女主茜的塑造为例，以无数次轮回的选择包装出她的绝对善良，又将她安排成为拯救自我而绑架同伴赴死的幕后黑手——可以褒向解读成柔软而强大的角色吸引力，而实际游玩观感却碍于剧本实在有限的笔力，只读出了角色矛盾。

也有打动我的地方。二部里老年茜的英配非常性感，尽管天赋顶尖如爱丽丝，建模也不舍得给她多增一件衣服，而步入老年的茜的出现终于让我看到这部作品里的正常女性生态，娓娓道来的神韵自然得以骗取人身心放松，可以说纯靠配音拯救。另外，有些房间的解谜设计也算有趣，如Q室的创意让人耳目一新。

总体而言是一部风评吃到时代红利的神作，在过去看来时髦的诡叙，放在今天是食之无味弃之可惜的设计。深度解谜作品爱好者必玩，而如果只是追寻佳作，这些年新诞生的好游戏过多，确实不值当耗费几十个小时的耐心去品尝这么一叠饺子醋。
大量男性黄色笑话，恨不得不给女角色穿衣服。因为心疼钱强忍着恶心通关了999，第二部实在不想继续了。呕。

first hour or so of the game is rough, do not be dissuaded by the goofy voice acting though (as I was). These two games had me utterly hooked from start to finish in the 5 or 6 days it took to complete them, especially Virtue's Last Reward. Some of the twists are predictable, but I think all the especially important ones are not

Also an escape room pro-tip: If you're spending a lot of time *thinking* instead of doing, you've probably missed something.

The puzzles in these games are all about matching parts together and will not require you to do arithmetic or decryption or anything that is especially high concentration (except maybe memory, if you don't have the luxury of a screenshot tool). 
The exception to this rule is the mini-games, but those are really on the doing side of things

I love 999 but I unfortunately cannot recommend this port for people who have never played the DS original.

Basically, 999 was made to be played on the DS's two screens. It was formatted so that, during character interactions, dialog and character art was on one screen and prose was on the other. There is a reason for this format, but I won't get into it here.

This port's solution to this problem was to allow the player to manually switch between an all-dialog screen and a screenplay-like prose screen. The problem with that is that most players will not bother or even remember to switch and will just choose one. If they choose the dialog screen, which I think most will, then they will miss out on some really excellent prose since there is no indication of what you are missing on the other screen without manually switching. You could stay on the prose screen the whole time, but then you are essentially just reading a screenplay and missing out on the character art and animation.

I understand that this is a difficult game to port into a one-screen format, but there has to be a better solution than this. I highly recommend playing the DS original. Cartridges are not terribly rare or expensive.

[h3]999[/h3]
Story is mildly interesting, but is held down by mindless "puzzles" that are more about searching and finding things than actually figuring anything out.

[h3]Virtue's Last Reward[/h3]
Unfinished due to motion sickness caused by low FOV

So I'm someone who loved AI: The Somnium Files, and really enjoyed it. Nirvana Initiative was a step down but I still liked it. So, it was only a matter of time to go back and try Zero Escape.

999 I think is a good length and is well made. It's interesting, the art is nice, the music is great, but my only gripes is that some of the puzzles are really reaching and the ending felt kind of unsatisfying on its own. 

Virtue's Last Reward is longer, and I think the puzzles make more sense, but I honestly have more problems with this game than 999. For one, the story gets way too complicated. I'm just skipping through text in the end and kinda hoping I follow along while the characters get metaphysical on me. Another is the damn transitions between rooms. Due to being unable to click off the window and have it still run, you have to sit there and wait through the elevator and travel from floor 1 to floor 2 (and vice versa), and doors opening which is about 1-2 minutes. They clearly can just not do it, as there are some scenes that just jump from location to location. I sort of understand the purpose, and it's to portray the tension of waiting and running down the halls to the next destination. But god, is it incredibly annoying. I think most of my gripes with this game is due to the system, like the skip is hard to get working, and so many plot points and scenes get repeated over and over that I wanna skip, but can't. It feels padded and way longer than it needed to be.

I don't feel this collection is as good as the first Somnium Files game, but I think it's worth it's price.

먼저 한글화해주신 분께 감사드립니다.
IGN 같은 곳에서 닌텐도 DS 명작을 꼽을 때 항상 들어가있는 게임이라 내용이 궁금했는데, 10여 년이 지나 그 궁금증을 드디어 해결하게 됐습니다.

저는 카마이타치의 밤 GBA 버전을 엄청 재밌게했던 기억이 있습니다.
그래서 이 게임 또한 당시에 두근거리면서 했던 그 느낌을 줄까? 하는 호기심이 있었죠.
그런데.. 게임이 조금 낡았습니다.
어떤 점이냐면 약간 게임이 개발됐을 당시 최신 트렌드였던 것들일텐데 지금 보니 촌스러워 보이는 느낌이 좀 있어요.
역전재판의 경우 지금 다시 해도 큰 몰입감을 주는 것과 좀 다릅니다.

그 이유가 뭘까하고 생각해봤는데, 아무래도 주제의식이 좀 약해서 인상적이지 않았다는 느낌입니다.
게임을 하는 중간에는 진실과 트릭들에 대해서 소소하게 흥미를 느끼긴 합니다.
방탈출 파트도 억지는 없다고 보시면 됩니다. 좀 귀찮은 풀이가 있긴 하지만..
그렇게 열심히 마무리를 전부 본다면... 그래서 뭐 어쩌라는건데? 이런 느낌이 있어요.

물론 후속작이 있고 그걸 안해본 상태에서 내리는 평가긴 합니다만, 역전재판의 경우 오래 기억되는 이유는 매력적인 캐릭터와 감동적인 서사가 있어서 인상에 깊게 남는 것이라고 생각합니다.
이 게임의 경우는 수작이지만 그정도의 스토리텔링은 없습니다.

그런데 왜 IGN은 역전재판 소생하는 역전은 TOP 10에 안올려놓고 이 게임을 올려놨을까요...
참 미스터리합니다.

This remaster has pros and cons. The biggest pro is adding a flow chart and skip dialogue option to 999, as the original didn't have that, meaning you have to start all over again from the beginning of the game instead of just going to the most recent branching path and changing your choice. Another pro is 999 has English and Japanese dub now, the original didn't have any voice-overs. However, because we've downgraded to one screen instead of two like on the DS, Junpei is unnecessarily narrating stuff you wouldn't say out loud in such a stressful scenario. The lack of two screens changes the last puzzle of the game as well. I have no qualms with this as I never played the original DS version, however I see how fans of the series will be unhappy with that. I haven't played VLR in this remaster yet, but I played it on the 3DS, and this remaster now has English dub, as oppose to just the Japanese dub in the original. Apart from that I'm unaware of any other changes to VLR. It seems like 999 got the biggest overhaul, especially with its updated artwork. Would recommend if you don't have access to the DS/3DS versions, but you should try them out at some point to see the differences!

I had played some of the the "other" SC games before this; Danganronpa, AI, and Crystar; I knew what I was getting into: Weird back-ended VNs with a penchant for wack conceptual mechanics/references, jank game mechanics outside of the VN parts, massive exposition dumps, red herrings, inconsistent humor, unbalanced characterization, and Sequel-itis...

[u]999[/u] [i]~10-12 hours[/i]
Decent, somewhat janky divergent VN with a unique premise, with somewhat believable escape room stuff, and everything ties up with a nice little bow, even if there is definite nonsense thrown in. Good art and good VAs; overall I would give this a thumbs up...

[u]VLR[/u] [i]~20-25 hours (30+ if you don't use the skip read dialogue keys)[/i]
Its a long VN with divergent paths, its a slog, many of the characters are cutouts in front of another cutout; the dreaded sequel-itis strikes, it has to make explicit references to the past game, bending over itself to force them in; and it gives "hints" that are more like giant friggin flashing signs, giving away later plot details in the first few hours of the game and continues to do so... the back-ended nature did bring resolution, but it was hollow.

The puzzles have a huge range of difficulties (imo), but are ok for the most part... but the art wasn't as appealing to me, and somewhat inconsistent?

The biggest problem was that it makes you sit through transitions and dialogue that you cant skip unless already seen... even if its just minutely contextually different; i felt my time was being wasted.

--------------------------

All in all, even though 999 is decent, I'd recommend going and playing lighter VNs that respects your time or maybe some of the other SC games, maybe come to this one later, and on sale?

The Zero Escape games are great at three things: 1) fun, not overly challenging escape room puzzles; 2) soft sci-fi fluff; 3) plant and payoff references. Really good visual novel/puzzle games, especially if you like the wordy writing of games like Danganronpa, Raging Loop, etc. If you enjoy these games, also check out the AI (Somnium Files and Nirvana Initiative) from the same director. Similar games, but I would say much better pacing and character work. 

Heads up to anyone playing on Steam Deck: 999 works flawlessly, but VLR, the superior of the two games, crashes regularly. Use GE Proton for best results.

Il ne faut pas considérés zero escape comme un jeu à la danganronpa. Les jeux sont des lights novels mais plus centrés sur les choix et les énigmes. Il y cependant des similitudes qui sont : 

- un casting variés de personnages qui sont piégés dans un jeu mortel (meme si c'est un escape game géant)
- des éléments de sciences (surtout pour virtues last reward)

De plus le but des jeux est de collecter des informations dans les différentes temporalités afin d'obtenir LA bonne fin pour sauver tous le monde

Bref si vous préférées la parties enquêtes des danganronpa, joué plutôt à ace atorney ou l'autre séries de jeux des créateurs de zero escapes que son les ai somnium files.

Mais si vous êtes dans les jeux à multiples fins et les énigmes,  je ne peux que vous le conseiller !
J'ai pour ma part vraiment beaucoup aimés les puzzles, les personnages et comment les différentes fins s'emboites pour résoudre le mystères complets ( surtout pour le deuxièmes). Les animations sont vraiment biens faites en 2D et en 3D.
Si je devait cependant donner des défaut cela serait :

Pour 999:
- n'avoir que deux routes importantes pour avoir la bonne fin (sur les 5 possibles)
Pour VLR :
- des scènes avec les models 3D pas forcements au top
- (certaines énigmes vraiment trop durs pour moi)

Желательно проходить по порядку  и чуть ли не залпом всю трилогию, чтобы достаточно знать приколы по временным приключениям героев и не сойти с ума.

По [u]головоломкам[/u] интересно, сначала будет все изи-пизи и только под конец, когда уже все мозги сварились из-за разветвлений сюжета, вы не заметите очевидного их прохождения, что приведет к руководствам, но это не осуждается, для таких игр вполне нормально.

Все части [u]стилизованы[/u] по-разному, что может оттолкнуть, не стоит на этом акцентировать внимание, т.к. не теряет свой сеттинг и вполне неплохо реализовано. (Особенно VLR)

[u]Минус всей трилогии[/u] в ветках, т.к. пройдя одну ветку вы стопитесь на ответе, который есть в другой, и когда получаете ответ, нужно вернуться обратно и довольно долго скипать кат-сцену.
Также ранее отмечали про "симулятор открывания дверей", такое присутствует и придется активировать режим "терпилы-ждуна". 


В целом оно того стоит, если вы фанат временных парадоксов и каких-то примесей "Данганронпы", "Пилы".

I did the first game because everybody sais it's good and it was good BUT it's a DS game and the fact it's on PC is a way to keep it alive BUT this won't be the real experience just what is the closest to real experience if you can't get the DS game like me. Now there's something I think the game should explain, the fact you can get two screen one with a more VN experience and one with a more "dialogue, adventure" one is not a choice it's the full game. I mean doing the full game is gping from one screen to another, on DS one was on tp screen and one was on bottom screen so you can't ignore one of them. Now I just explained how the game was meant to be played and I think PC version could have done better on this point. So the game is great (999) but the PC version is not the real deal and I think you should do it anyway. Trust me on this point coz it's not really possible to explain until you are into it, you have to experience the game by yourself. BUT if you have any way to play on the original system DO THIS! It's like playing time crisis without the gun except it's still fun but even if it is still fun the gun was part of the experience. Too much explaination of the same thing with different word, sorry.

游戏存在大量伪科学的设定，不是那种传统的本格推理。
很多信息需要解锁树状图获取，这也是一个很契合游戏内容的设计，这点在玩2代会更清晰明了。
第一部999的诡计引人入胜，游戏过程中对这个诡计的铺垫有很多，最直白的一次就是收集9人卡片那，看得我汗流浃背，但是在一切真相豁然开朗的时候又是那么自然。
第一部的信息稍少，全程可能都蒙在鼓里，但这并不意味着到第二部你就会因为知道设定而感到乏味，我觉得第二部较诡计而言，最有意思的是其的人物关系，[spoiler] 因为谁都不会想到一个硬派猛汉怀抱童心坐摇摇车，下一秒居然会背叛你。谁也不会想到连续两次背叛你的敌人，却是最愿意向你敞开心扉的人 [/spoiler]。
两部都存在不少的黄色废料，包括但不限于“湿了”，“硬了”，999还好，第二部尤为明显。[spoiler] 但我很喜欢 [/spoiler]
玩第二部需要备一部手机看短视频以便于打发时间，因为其存在大量的垃圾时间，也是它备受诟病的原因之一。
该开始鏖战第3部了。
二十个小时，让我汗流浃背9次

This game has fucked up and played with my brain if it were a toy like no other game has ever done before.

The amount of plot-twists after plot-twists after plot-twists that it has, is to the point of so many plot-twists that I wouldn't think that so many are even possible to be fitted in such a small lapse of time ([spoiler]Zero Lost[/spoiler] ending specifically).
I'm having a blast with this game and I'm not even done with it; I've only seen so far 3 endings of 999 ([spoiler]Axe[/spoiler], [spoiler]Yellow Submarine[/spoiler] and [spoiler]Zero Lost[/spoiler]), I still have more 999 endings to witness and all of VLR to do.

Yes, I do recommend it. Will update this review when I progress more with the endings and such.

是為了9人9小時9扇門買這款遊戲的，雖然沒有中文是一大缺點，但基本上網路上可以找到人家製作的翻譯包，倒是可以加減玩

以前是在nds上玩這一代的，直到現在我還是認同這款遊戲的劇情跟解謎。可以說是不會過於困難，但也不是全都很輕易就可以解開的程度。

[spoiler] 身為喜歡鐵達尼號的人，如果玩9人9小時9扇門這一部分會有種會心一笑得感覺，因為很多的劇情、畫面、場景多少有跟鐵達尼號的傳說搭上邊，甚至是最關鍵的那個道具也跟鐵達尼號一樣放在綠色的保險箱這點，讓剛好重看鐵達尼號的人會感到一陣驚奇 [/spoiler]

The puzzles are okay, but the main reason to play these 2 games are the crazy plot twists.  The 1st is more highly praised, but I thought the 2nd was better in almost every way.  There's one specific moment in the 2nd game that hit many people right in the heart.  But like most VNs, you're going to have to sit through a lot of story setup and character building before the more interesting stuff happens.  And I guess I'm not a fan of escape-the-room puzzles, because they take place in constrained puzzle rooms, and it's impossible to "think outside the box" if the puzzles are always constrained to mutually-independent box-like rooms.

Also, if you ever want to replay these games, you can swap the language from English to Japanese or vice-versa.

The two games that this package comes with which are 999 and VLR are really good and although the graphics do change from 999 to VLR it was very easy to get used to it. The story was really good and contains a mix of funny and sad moments that I am sure a lot of people would enjoy. The puzzles in the game can be hard but are still really fun and interesting.

神！
999：由于改编自NDS，最后焚化炉部分，没有双屏导致反复强制切屏看着剧情演出有点搞笑，以及把数独换成一个可以直接逃课过的简单谜题，除此以外满分配音和高清重制立绘已经整体比NDS原版强了
善人死亡：前期剧情入戏太慢，如果不走两条无剧情锁的世界线，几乎前20个小时了解完人设以后就全是解谜部分了，会被剧情锁卡的很死。在下脑容量有限，感觉谜题比999的难。但是回收所有伏笔的最后3个小时的内容真的神中神，少有的让我觉得再回想过去还是觉得很nb的剧情
总之推荐每一个AVG爱好者来体验一下这个十几年前的经典故事，如果能接受的话可以去玩玩打越钢太郎先生剧本的其他游戏
——————————
以前打算写很多东西后来烂尾了，放在后面：
从NDS/3DS掌机平台移植过来的经典AVG作品，即便是2023年我还是推荐朋友们来游玩这部起于2009年，私以为原本可以和《逆转》《弹丸》并列，但是由于经费不足、日区本地热度有限以及游戏平台一换再换等原因而几经波折，最后如今名不见经传的时长30h量级的悬疑恐怖推理密室逃脱过时黄段子元素拉满的经典之作。
简单补充一下，steam上这作是系列前两作：《极限脱出：9小时9人9扇门》（通常简称为999）和《极限脱出：善人死亡》（英文Virtue’s Last Reward，通常简称为VLR，或者用台译“好人不长命”更合适？）的合集，目前steam只支持英文、日文，汉化补丁需要网上自行搜索，我个人用的是贴吧网友分享的版本，除了偶尔有一两句没翻译以外连剧情中人物为解释而手绘的图都有中文，质量还不错。
————————
偶然想起来玩VLR时候和哥们儿讨论的一些问题：
一是那个地图过场动画是真的der必要没有，ZE系列祖传的喜欢放一张大地图，其实解谜和叙事诡计完全用不到这个，你只需要知道系列传统艺能解谜完后会去同一个集中点汇合就行了。VLR嗯整个移动路线，还不让跳过，小半分钟看个没营养的东西，高度怀疑是当年纯属3DS炫技
二是哥们儿出于淳朴的同态复仇法，鉴于最后没狠狠给某人两拳，表示深有遗憾（这作反派塑造不差但是真不如999，999那反派形象真挺神的
三是哥们儿对法伊的泳装念念不忘（

很經典的密室逃脫＋解謎遊戲

打越喜欢通过伪科学来解释谜底，这就导致了第一部的推理缺少必要信息，对于推理类作品是致命的，单单当做剧情作还不错，作为推理解密类只能说令人大失所望，第二部也是不负众望的差，磨磨唧唧的动画，还强制观看那粗糙的3D建模与垃圾的表现力过场，浪费不少时间，而在其他线得到的密码在另一条线要手输，没有提示，你只能在回去看一遍密码，强制延长时间，令人恶心，操作奇葩，只能说第二部不负众望的低分不是没有道理的

Such an underrated game.

999 is probably the best visual novel I've played. VLR is pretty good as well but admittedly the graphics have aged like milk. I did get used to it over time but it felt like a downgrade compared to 999's timeless visuals. 

There's definitely some cringey/anime writing at times but it feels intentional enough to make it funny if you're willing to go along with it. 999 and VLR both do a good job at setting up grim and mysterious stories while still maintaining humor and likable characters... and [spoiler] Alice [/spoiler] . I also give both games credit for making the protagonist feel left out of the loop enough for the player to immerse themselves while also giving the player character a distinct personality (specifically Jumpy, but Sigma wasn't voice acted which contributed to him feeling more generic). All in all, great games.

A Spike chunsoft acertou em cheio nisso aqui. Que história e que jogo bom! Só perde pra danganronpa mesmo, mas aborda assuntos e temas muito complexos e concilia tudo que o jogo precisa muito bem.
Eu iria falar de cada jogo separadamente, mas um é o complemento do outro, é injusto eu avaliar eles isolados, o que eu posso garantir é que os dois são perfeitos!
O 1 aborda assuntos complexos e uma linearidade muito boa da história, o 2 complementa essa história e expande ainda mais a complexidade do universo e dos seus assuntos! É uma obra prima!
Sobre as escapes rooms: a maioria é de dificuldade extremamente justa, nenhuma achei tão fácil assim, mas umas tive sorte de ter o raciocínio certo de primeira, e outras eu achei impossíveis. Eu tive que pesquisar pra prosseguir na história pela ansiedade, pois suas resoluções eram realmente muito improváveis, mas não chega a ser injusto, pois os elementos constavam ali, só precisava de muito pensamento e imaginação mesmo. Me entreti muito com as salas,e depois voltei nas que deixei pela metade pra platinar. (platina é apenas fazer todas as rotas e salas).
média de 30 horas pra cada jogo, tempo limpo e bem gasto, aproveitem essa maravilha!

The first game, 999: 9 Hours, 9 Persons, 9 Doors, is the best of the series, and one of my favorite games ever. Play it on a Nintendo DS if you can, if not just play it wherever you can and enjoy the ride. A very colorful cast, incredibly written conversations which jump from philosophical head-scratchers to hilarious nonsense (the Funyarinpa...), and an ending that still haunts me to this day because of how good it is.

If you'd like to play more in this universe, the second game is pretty entertaining too - I also first played it on a 3DS, which I believe is the best experience. Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward has some "soul" left over from the first installment, and the story and cast are mostly good too. 

Sadly I can't comment on the third and final game, Zero Time Dilemma, which is so different from the first two (in a worse way, IMO) that I have yet to finish it. :(

The nonary games is a series of VN with a predefined set of escape room puzzles. Both the puzzles and the story are strongly influenced by references involving scientific topics and theoretical studies: Game theory, Quantum physics, Morphogenesis, Morphic fields, multiverses, etc. It also makes uses of known paradoxes such as the Theseus' ship or the Prisoners dilemma and Nash equilibrium.

If you played Danganronpa, and thought it was not too serious, this one is a mature alternative.
If you want a good story that combines different scientific concepts, while enjoy solving puzzles in escape rooms while the story unfolds, this is a pretty good one.  
If you aren't interested in science, the plot can become confusing most of the time, as it's stongly influenced by topics from different branches of science.

If you enjoy these games, I recommend checking out the third an last one of the series, called "Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma"

不太欣赏得来打越的诡计…………以及之前没意识到密室逃脱的占比会这么大（我个人不喜欢这种玩法），999一切都还能忍受，善人死亡真的是全程坐牢，除了世界观（也很迷幻）之外简直没有一丝系列作的痕迹，抛弃了999的所有优点，建模就不说了为什么UI能丑成这样啊？选物品那个界面不能直接平铺开给我选吗？一搜查就好几十个物品，选中非要一个个点一个个转到面前……每次移动都要播放那个没有人类能看明白的地图和开关门动画，全方位展示简陋房间的各个角落……解谜和剧情完全割裂，人物对话也很水，同一件事不同视角反复讲还不能跳过，可以说所有系统设计都在不遗余力地拉低玩家的游玩体验。除去这些就是一个普通的漏洞百出的悬疑故事，4022年了我觉得没有必要玩这个

I hear the DS version is the better version in terms of storytelling and overall experience, but those who try the Steam version first may have an enjoyable experience anyway! The characters and story seem a little silly at first, but when you get deeper into it, there is a rather complex and intriguing experience hiding beneath. There are descriptions of gore in the novel modes, and there is a lot of drama, betrayal, and death. It also tends to be on the fantastical and imaginative side, rather than going for pure realism. (Which works very well!)

I couldn't take the English voices that seriously and switched to Japanese later on, but it was still very fun and everyone seemed to have put a lot of passion into this. Both games have mystery and many interesting puzzles to solve. They were about average in difficulty, although there are quite a few that require math skills or heavy critical thinking.

There were also many more endings than I had expected! Some repetitiveness got rather tiring to trudge through, especially during the second game, and there are very long hallway sequences that feel like bare-bones loading pages, but other than that there are plenty of ways to skip around through this. Was able to clear all the content in full within 40 hours, around 15 for the first game, and 25 for the second.

Wonderful, memorable game and a great intro into escape room puzzles!
时空穿越类型的剧情很吸引我，善人死亡这一部更是能做到在剧情天马行空的同时有着逻辑的自洽，稍微引入基础的理论知识使得剧情保持沉浸感的同时不失深刻。身为“先知”一般的玩家和作为破局者的主角一同发掘事情的真相，剧里剧外身份的重叠让我喜爱不已，赞！
Frankly, Best ost ive heard in videogames. Story for 999 is 10/10 same For VLR. Would recommend

One of my favourite series of all time, especially since the cast shows competence in danger situations. The story is good, the puzzles are fun for the most part and the cast is colourful. Some people are less fond of the second game, since it departs from the feel of the first game in some areas, but I found it quite clever in how it builds on the concept from the first game without trodding down the same storybeats.
Definitely worth playing. It might be a bit slow to pick up in the first game, and some people might cringe at the way the female lead is introduced, but once you get a better idea of what the game is ACTUALLY trying to do, you're in for a hell of a ride.

And don't forget; There is a novel mode you can enter to gain more detail on character interactions than the visual novel format may allow at times.

A few notes from a fan;
- There's a lot of reading. If you're not much of a reader, this might not be the puzzle game for you.
- There will be a big emphasis on math. Don't worry most of the plot relavent math will be done for you by the characters. You'll be ok I promise.
- Don't read any extra files you pick up in the second game until you're well out of that chapter of the story. Some light spoilers in there.
- Games are split up into visual novel and gameplay portions. The gameplay portions are escape-room style and will combine point-and-click "how does this action enable something somewhere" puzzles with more traditional "solve this riddle box to access acquire plot item" style puzzles. During the VN portions you can enter a novel mode that's worth checking out once in a while. When in gameplay portions, it's usually worth investigating items and background elements multiple times for banter with your current party members. It's often very worth it.
- You will use a guide at some point. It's ok you're not a dumbass there's just so many different types of puzzles you'll eventually hit one of a type you're not good at. We've all done it you're fine I promise. Find a spoiler-free guide tho.
- Keep in mind that thi is the re-release version of the games. There's a few puzzles exchanged from the original and the community might refer to sprites and dual screen mechanics you won't relate to. It's fine you'll still get the same story out of it.
- Inflicting these games on an unsuspecting friend once you've completed them is extremely funny and I recommend having them stream it. Trust me bro. Just don't spoil nothing. It's even more fun if your friend is the type to theorize as you go along. I might have had even more fun going through the game a second time with my oblivious bestie trying to figure out wtf is going on.
- Pick the funyarinpa option.

The first game, 999, might just be one of the best visual novels out there.

The second game, VLR, is harder to approach due to very poorly aged 3DS 3d models (as opposed to the first game's ageless 2d sprites) but also much goofier character design across the board. The story gets a bit too wild to my taste, but is still overall quite enjoyable once used to the visuals.

These are two of the greatest visual novels ever made with some really creative sci-fi concepts. Some puzzle solutions were a bit too complex for my stupid little brain to come up with but it feels good when you figure them out on your own. Really impressive voice acting and localisation to top this all off. 

999 presents itself as a fun little death game that makes you do maths to solve puzzles along with a quirky cast of characters, and then it turns into something that makes you question the fabric of the universe.

Virtue's Last Reward is the same but in full 3D and with some slightly off-putting models that you adjust to after a little while. 

If you've got the cash for it, I would highly recommend this collection. Couldn't recommend this enough if you enjoy both visual novels and sci-fi stories.

História e personagens: Histórias muito interessantes e que se interligam, tudo no mesmo universo (relaxem, não vou dar spoiler). A narrativa é vasta, muitos personagens e rotas diferentes a se tomar e eu amo a dinamica de "pular no tempo" que eles tem. 

Me diverti demais com esse jogo e estou terminando o terceiro, o outro "Zero Escape". Enfim, vai ficar marcado como um dos meus jogos favoritos.

Чем меньше вы знаете, покупая эту игру, тем лучше. Одна из лучших серий детективных визуальных новелл, работающих с особенностями формы и жанра. Вторая часть ощущается немного затянутой, особенно если проходить ее сразу после первой, однако сюжет поддерживает интерес к дальнейшему прохождению. 

[b] Nonary Games как деконструкция визуальных новелл [/b]

[spoiler] Возможность совершать выбор ожидается от визуальных новелл большинства жанров. Однако логично предполагать, что совершая выбор мы отсекаем вторую линию возможностей. Некоторые сюжетные игры активно работают с этой проблемой, например первая Life is Strange позволяет отмотать время на несколько секунд назад и посмотреть на кратковременные последствия практически каждого выбора, однако в итоге игрок обязан выбрать что-то одно. Обе части Nonary Games используют на то, что все выборы могут быть совершены и существовать (хотя бы для главного героя) одновременно и одинаково справедливо. Сознание протагониста сохраняет память о всех предательствах, смертях и травмах, которые произошли при тех или иных выборах, хотя не все он помнит одинаково хорошо. Полученные знания он может использовать для того, чтобы найти выход из тупиковой ситуации, перехитрить преступников и прийти к единственной истинной концовке. В итоге для полноценного прохождения игры нужно посмотреть на все концовки, совершить все выборы, проявить альтруизм и трусость, чтобы узнать об окружающих все возможное.

Отдельно стоит отметить диалоги, чтение которых составляет примерно 70% хронометража игры. Да, они очень японские в плане количества объяснений и неожиданных пересказов научных теорий (о которых ниже), однако в них встречаются искренние и трогательные моменты. Часто диалоги (а иногда и черты характера героев) превращаются в попытку переосмыслить жанр. В первой части (999) неожиданное желание героев развернуто рассказать историю кристаллизации глицерина или то, как Курт Воннегут предвосхитил появление льда-9 можно воспринимать как сознательную пародию похожих неожиданных лекций в аниме/манге/играх, когда игроку необходимо дать некоторый важный для дальнейших событий контекст. То же справедливо для персонажа φ, которая часто путает не похожие слова, нарушая смысл произносимых фраз, что может быть развернутой шуткой над кривыми переводами японских игр на английский язык.

В итоге, игра представляет игроку незаурядную историю, которая использует множество научных, псевдонаучных и фантастических теорий. Это позволяет показать миллион неожиданных поворотов и спрятать скелета в шкафу каждого героя. Ну и эскейп-румы тоже интересные, хотя во второй части есть загадки, до решения которых очень сложно дойти естественным способом, без гайдов и перебора всех возможных вариантов
 [/spoiler]

Dive into Despair and Deception in Zero Escape: The Nonary Games
Zero Escape: The Nonary Games isn't your casual stroll through a park. It's a plunge into a mind-bending escape room saga that will grip you from the start. This collection combines 999: Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors and Virtue's Last Reward, two visual novels that weave a chilling narrative across two interconnected games.

Trapped in a Deadly Game

You find yourself thrust into a terrifying situation. In 999, nine strangers wake up on a sinking ship, each strapped with a mysterious bracelet that promises freedom... at a deadly cost.  Virtue's Last Reward presents a new cast facing a similar predicament, but with a different twist.  The mastermind behind it all? A cryptic figure known only as Zero.

Your Choices Shape the Story

The brilliance of The Nonary Games lies in its unique blend of visual novel storytelling and escape room puzzles. Stunning artwork and a captivating narrative come alive with your choices. Every decision you make - who to trust, who to betray - alters the story's course and leads you towards one of the game's multiple endings.  The weight of these choices hangs heavy, leaving you questioning the true nature of your fellow captives and the purpose behind these deadly games.

A Web of Conspiracy and Mind-Bending Twists

As you delve deeper, the seemingly simple premise unravels, revealing a complex web of conspiracy that connects both games. Prepare to be challenged by philosophical questions about human nature and grapple with mind-bending plot twists that will leave you gasping for air.  The characters, each with their own hidden pasts and motivations, become more than just pawns in Zero's twisted game. You'll find yourself emotionally invested in their fates, desperate to see them overcome the horrors they face.

A Must-Play for Visual Novel and Puzzle Fans

If you're looking for a visual novel that blends pulse-pounding suspense with brain-teasing puzzles, Zero Escape: The Nonary Games is a must-play.  With its high stakes, unforgettable characters, and a narrative that will stay with you long after the credits roll, this collection is a true gem for anyone who enjoys a thrilling escape room adventure.  Just remember, in Zero Escape, every decision matters, and survival comes at a cost.

One of the best couple  of narrative mystery/suspense/thriller/drama type of games. I've played danganronpa before and liked that series alot and saw that the same devs made these games so i gave it a shot. The first game (999) definitely feels a little dated but its understandable given its age. It's story still holds up extremely well though and it will have you constantly on your toes guessing who is behind it all. The games have a unique way of playing where to understand the whole story you have to replay it from certain points. Its not a super foreign concept but each decision you make in the game has a branching path with multiple different timelines. However you never have to completely restart from the beginning. Once you've gone through one of the paths, you can freely skip the dialogue and jump to whatever sections you want that you've played already, making it easy to go back to the other branch that you didn't choose the first time. The second game; VLR I think improves on the formula with it's puzzles and narrative elements but the ending is batsh!t crazy. Its very difficult to understand imo but that doesn't mean its bad at all. Overall I liked the mc of 999 (Junepei) more then the mc of VLR (Sigma) but they are both good characters in their own right.

If you don't like visual novel type games, you probably won't like these either since the only real gameplay is the escape rooms you go through and the puzzles inside of them. If you don't mind or DO like those games, you should absolutely pick these games up when you can. I think I got this collection for a couple of bucks on sale which is an absolute steal given how fun it is

Virtue's Last Reward é piiiiica. Em termos de história, ele compensa a falta de um plot twist tão maneiro quando a do 999 no DS com vários plot twists que não são tão fora da caixa como o do 999, mas que ainda assim geram muita surpresa. Novamente comparando com o 999, os puzzles não são taaao legais assim. Se baseiam muito em ficar olhando e tentando memorias os arquivos e aplicar eles no puzzle em si. E o final é meio longo demais e o final final final mesmo achei meio anticlimático, ainda mais novamente comparado a delicia que é o final do 999.
No fim das contas o Virtue's Last Reward ainda vive muito na sombra do original, mas a grande escala da historia e os novos plot twists sustentam muito bem

I just finished the 999 and am still playing the VLR. 999 already left me with a huge impression. The story is good and the plot twist keeps me hooked to continue playing to find the true ending. With each play, more information is gained and you will always wonder who the real culprit is. I recommend watching the gameplay of the DS version too, it is really different and gave you a whole new point of view.

目前只把999全结局通关，善人死亡还没开始，但还是强烈好评。
解密部分大部分都是靠数字根所以比较简单。虽然最后有点伪科学的意味，但凭借游戏里面的理论也能够让剧本显得更加有必然性。尤其最后真结局一幕茜和淳平的互动更加给人一种震撼的感觉。

I found both 999 and VLR to be very enjoyable visual mistery/sci-fi novels with puzzle elements. The story in both games is amazing, the characters are all quite interesting and the puzzle rooms are quite fun without being too difficult/easy.

pretty awesome sauce

第一部真的很棒，密室难度适中，操作简单合理（为什么这么说，因为和第二部一对比第一部真的好很多），剧情铺垫展开也很舒服，能从路线图跳节点真的帮大忙了，虽然没有分屏导致最后揭露真相时的震撼少了一些，但整体还是令人满意。

第二部玩不下去：
① 3D人设丑的无法直视，完全不如第一部的2D纸片人；
② 密室复杂度提升了，但是很多是提升在不必要的地方，组合的工具多了一大堆，我第一个进的是休息室，在里面调了半天的酒，纯粹为了互动而互动。明明可以直接在物品栏组合一下的东西，非得来这么几步：先把酒杯里的酒倒进垃圾桶，再把酒杯放在机器上，再插上两瓶酒，再按一下出酒键，再把装了酒的酒杯收回物品栏，再放到杯垫上。然后解一个迷要调三杯酒，更操蛋的是不止一个锁要通过调酒开，也就是要调6-9杯酒。这不是纯纯拖延游戏时长？没有任何意义，纯粹破坏游戏体验！
③ 兔子也很丑，比黑白熊丑多了。
第二部没玩多少，实在是被调酒恶心到了！（以后有耐心来玩了再看情况补充

首先我还没看剧情讲解，因为999的情感线我实在是有几个没理解的地方，但我很想看男女主发糖，[spoiler]打了几个坏结局之后开始怀疑女主是零的身份，但找不到动机，我甚至怀疑女主是男主幻想出来的或者男主就是女主，真结局的话，也算是平稳落地，我对伪科学题材还是很感兴趣，里面的逻辑也算是可以自洽，除了几个关键的bug，比如为什么男主在真结局已经接近最靠近女主复活的时间线了，女主仍然在焚化室中消失，为什么他们的世界观里并没有为多周目结局记忆串联做解释，仍然能让男主在其他结局想起左右密语和之前的线索，因为再次之前我没玩过几个类似的多周目avg，人狼村算一个，gnosia跟着视频云过，我觉得他们或多或少都会明确告诉你多周目设定的存在，就算拿出来当主要卖点也好，或者当做剧情的主要推手，相较而言我就不是很能接受999这个突然灵光一闪的念头，以及最后在车上一些似真似假的猜疑，比如7号到底有没有失忆，我真的很不喜欢这种处理方式，因为这个结局的演出方式也好还是说落地方式都已经很接近完美了，我没法忽视掉你故意为了填补剧情bug留下来的莫名其妙的地方，还有就是善人死亡我现在玩了一半，已经开始感觉有点恶心了，文案是真的不少低能文案，人物不讨喜，我想玩完纯粹是为了看淳茜的内容，还有那个司马物品选取逻辑和巨恶心的一捡一箩筐东西，一解密就要浪费好多时间，但是你的谜题设置都好低能啊我草，甚至跟密室都没什么关系了吧，[/spoiler]等我什么时候玩完善人死亡，你的好评什么时候就死掉，呵呵

Одна из лучших игр, в которые я играл.
По сути, это головоломка+новелла, где сюжет закручен вокруг игры на выживание в замкнутом пространстве.
Единственная игра, где сейвлоады обыграны таким образом, что приравниваются к способности главного героя перемещать свое сознание сквозь время. 
Т.е. по сути ты увидел в одной из плохих концовок какой-то код, пароль, набор цифр, убийцу - ты загружаешься в любой из других ответвлений, и твой герой обо всём об этом уже помнит и спешит сообщить другим (с кем он заперт).  
Так сказать спойлермен спешить на помощь :D
И, да, это временами ломает четвертую стену, но кому это мешает. Особенно в такой игре, когда это элегантно вписывается в повествование.
По поводу головоломок - они разнообразные и местами даже крайне сложные. Заставляют тебя поиграть и в танграмы, и в ту штуку с шариками, где нужно было в дырочку загнать его, арифметика, логика, даже 12 система счисления имеется. Задачки вполне решабельны, после чего тебе порционно дается сюжет с такими поворотами, после которых обычные фильмы становятся для тебя клишированными. Ну а что хотели, ведь сценаристом был Котаро Учикоси. Одна ронпа чего стоит.
Также очень много научных тематик и околонаучных, которые растопили мое математическое и химическое сердечко. И, если же первая часть была по большей части основана на теории морфогенетики, то во второй идут вовсю уже квантовые парадоксы и антиподы китайской комнаты.
С теплом на душе в скором времени пойду проходить третью часть.
The Hunter Exam in a video game. 10/10.

全体的には申し分ない脚本。
単純な思考回路では作れない相当な背景設計がされて
作られたのだと思うし、
様々なゲームで問題提起されている
時空間、タイムパラドックス、タイムスリップ、タイプリープものに比べ、
時代を先取りした作品となっている。

それもザッピングシステムそのものを
あえてメタいものとして位置付けておらず、
ストーリーの軸として理由付けしているシステムとなっていて
正直度肝を抜かれた。(意味が分からない人はプレイしてみるのが早い)

それもパックになっている2作品とも話を追っていくたび、
濃くなっていくので
ぜひともその線に興味がある人は
本ゲームプレイによって作者の考えを体感してほしい。

結果、本ゲームで述べられている文章と
他の多数のSF系、タイムトラベルミステリー系の作品と
並べて考察することによって
よりよいシンパシーを得られることに違いないと感じる。

ほめちぎったが、後述は敢えて気になった点をあげる。

■残念なところ
UIが古いせいか、ランチャーから起動したとき
つづきからしたいよー、で決定ボタン連打していると「はじめから」を選んでしまいがちで
コンティニューからやり直したいという場合、
その手段を「はじめから」を選んでしまったあとでは長い文章を読んでから
MENUから「ゲームを終了する」を選んでからタイトル画面に移行しないと
セーブからしかやりなおせない(善人シボウデス)
結果的に強制終了させて再起動したほうが早いという残念な仕様な点。

MENU項目から「セーブから」「つづきから」を選べるように改修すべき。

[h1] 评分：7/10，及格线以上，神作线以下的平庸之作。[/h1]  建议在开始游玩前不要抱有太高期望，否则通关后的你一定会很失望。对密室逃脱、勾心斗角等要素感兴趣的玩家可以考虑打折时再入手。
steam上的本作为极限脱出999与极限脱出：善人死亡的合集，该系列作品由日本知名制作人打越钢太郎所开发。作为一名AVG的知名制作人，打越最为人所称道的拿手好戏便是叙事诡计，我至今都还记得AI梦境档案的核心诡计被揭穿时所带给我的震撼。然而，令人遗憾的是，在极限脱出系列中，叙事诡计这一要素纵然不能说是完全没有，但也只能说是聊胜于无，在谜底与悬念被揭穿时，我的心中没有掀起一丝波澜，脑海中的唯一想法只有“就这？”
尤其是本系列的第二部作品善人死亡，该作甚至都不能被称为一部完整的作品。草草收场的结尾就像是文章中“起承转合”中的“合”只有一个to be continued，对于这种挖坑不填的做法，我只想说：RNM，把老子30多个小时的宝贵时间还给我！
PS：骂归骂，第三部还是要玩的，期待打越在第三部里能给我整点好活。
PPS：四叶和爱丽丝这两个角色是真的讨人嫌，为什么要塑造两个这么恶心人的角色啊！
--------------------------------------------

《极限脱出999》算得上是我第一次真正意义上接触试玩打越的泛infinity系列视觉小说游戏。
   作为一款经典IP《极限脱出》系列下的游戏。虽然现在是2024年，已经算得上晚入坑的一员了。我还是去试试看，是否名实相符。
[h1]富含吸引力的剧情[/h1]
游戏内容主线：游戏背景时间—2028 的圣诞节，“我”被神秘人绑架，剩余时间只有九个小时，主角被困豪华邮轮上，跟其他一起共计九个人，必须在限定时间内找到数字9的门，然后逃离这艘快要沉没的“泰坦尼克号”，

"So it's like flipping a coin."
"Half a chance."
"The chances of either outcome are equal."
这三句深沉且富含哲理的话在这游戏里真的是点睛之笔。

老套但是不俗套的剧情刻画，丰富的故事性进程，选择不同的门对应不同的故事线，9扇门的组合给玩家带来多样化的选择，和不同的游戏体验。

综合来说，游戏的剧情方面做得很Nice
[h1]具有年代感的画面[/h1]

开篇的豪华邮轮。。。加上雨雾天的背景刻画的非常细腻，加上背景音乐，很容易让人带入故事中。
但是游戏的开篇和主角睁开眼的目光所及之处。让我有种去那种路边没人维护打扫的公共厕所既视感。主打一手怀旧风.......

船舱里分布的上中下三层的硬卧床铺，有没有搞错-传说中的豪华邮轮呢？？？这是在坐绿皮火车吧。
整体游戏画面还算流畅，但大多数都是经典且传统的2D对话框对话模式，推动着剧情发展。
《极限脱出999》就游戏画面画质方面来说：勉勉强强，能玩，可玩一类的游戏   “对比发售日期”，毕竟它是在6年前上架Steam的一款产品了。
[h1]经典且有趣的玩法[/h1]

游戏玩法上大致归为文字冒险解谜类的，小说一般的叙事，让我们彷佛在读一本悬疑小说。
同时在游戏中加入了不少密室逃脱的剧情，让我们不只是在上帝视角玩这个游戏，而是能够在不经意之间就带入其中，融入到这个游戏里面。
游戏可以在小说和ADV两种模式之间切换，很人性化。
这样的游戏刻画和推进，才让我感觉是自己在玩游戏，自己在融入和了解这个游戏。

总的来说：游戏是一个不错且好玩的游戏，适合IP粉和悬疑小说，解密类游戏爱好者，一般的小伙伴也可以入，但是要斟酌一下，这款游戏没有汉化。是否能坚持玩下来。
[h1]欢迎关注或加入鉴赏家：游话好说。我们是一群游戏爱好者，希望能评测来帮助大家认识更多好游戏，期待您的同行！[/h1]

999 was great when I played it on my 3DS around 2014 so I did not play it on Steam.
VLR I discovered here on Steam and... Well, the game itself is nice, up to what I remember of 999.

But the crashes. OH GOD THE CRASHES!

This game is about two things : puzzles and immersion. But with the random and frequent crashes you cannot concentrate on the puzzles and cannot immerse in the story because you have to save every ten minutes in case the damn thing crash or you will spend the next hour destroying your mouse/spacebar to skip the never ending line of texts you already read to get back to where you were before the game crashed.

It is simple : I never finished a single play session by my own volition. It has always been ended by the game crashing. So nice base idea but impossible to really appreciate.

An it seems the Vita version has also issues. So I guess if you want to play the game, you will need the original 3DS version, if that still exists. In the meantime, personaly, I am going to try and get that broken sick joke refunded.

Just play first game (999) and ignore rest of the series. 999 is great vn with great story, characters and escape room puzzles. Virtue Last Reward is just a set up for Zero Time Dilemma(which is sold separately and is piece of shit), therefor has no ending, and awful 3d sprites instead drawn.

I would absolutely recommend 999. I loved the story line, the art style is REALLY nice, and the plot actually keeps you guessing and has fun twists and surprises. There are six endings (or 7 if you accidentally get the main ending the first playthrough), and the game does a good job of telling you where the branches are so that you can go back to certain points and alter your choices in order to get different routes and endings. Really well-done.
On the other hand, the second game, Virtue's Last Reward. It probably isn't a bad game, but compared to the first game, I can't stand it. I don't like the artstyle, the pacing is slow and there are so few choices that you can make. The characters talk way too much instead of letting you get on with the escape rooms, and there is literally a 13 second black screen every single time the game makes you take the lift/elevator lol. I'm far enough in that I'm somewhat invested, so I plan to eventually get all of the endings. But compared to 999, which had only six endings, which were all quite unique, and required longer routes to get to, VLR has weirdly short routes where you get to make very few choices, BUT THERE ARE LIKE 18 OF THEM. I feel like I'm living the same hellish parts of my life over and over and want to pull my hair out as I am forced to replay the same scenes over again with the same information being delivered by different characters, but on the off chance that something new comes up, you can't really put it on the skip setting, and just have to sit there in agony.

Over-all I loved 999 enough that I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this game. I got it when it was really cheap too, so I don't mind that I only really loved one of the two games so far.

而且在投票搜索等环节也埋了很多细节，（比如一路做好人和一路做坏人对应结局的人物）伏笔解释的总体上还是让人满意的。总之剧情构造就很不错。不过如果从单个极限脱出的叙述来看会觉得有几段赘余

если мне еще раз будут пытаться пояснять сюжет, происходящий в разных вариаций вселенной, каждые две минуты приводя часовые аналогии с котами шредингера или дорожным трафиком байкеров, я сойду с ума. 

Играть в это очень душно: загадки сперва кажутся в меру интересными, но уже после 5 хочется по-быстрее их скипнуть (а их 16, на минуточку :), сюжет пытаются завуалировать под псевдофилософию уровня начальных классов, да и к тому же постоянно разворачивая часовые монологи/диалоги с бесконечными аналогиями, будто несколько раз разъясняя ребенку, чтобы он точно понял (при этом, до многих других ключевых моментов, этот же ребенок должен добраться сам). Были ли у вас ситуации, когда вы хотите получить конкретную информацию о том или ином событии/объекте, а вас просто оконными путями водят к ответу, агрессивно подталкивая в неуместные рассуждения в стиле "а вот есть у нас в коробе плюшевый "живой" лев, мертв ли или жив ли он, если короб закрыт?" или "а вот слыхал о дилемме заключенных?)))))". Так вот, диалоги в игре более, чем в половину состоят из этого. Хотите понять, почему главный сюжетный твист с главным героем такой глупый, и почему он этого всю игру, все таймлайны не замечал, а вот обойдетесь, мы вам лучше будем затирать, что ради спасения мира наши "экстрасенсы" должны прыгать строго по вот этим сумасшедшим временным диапазонам, а иначе не получится!

Ce bundle rassemble les deux premiers opus de la saga Zero Escape qui gagnerait à être beaucoup plus connue ! Je n'ai jamais été exposée à une œuvre qui joue aussi bien avec les concepts de diégèse et d'extradiégèse.

L'histoire aux accents de Battle Royale joue avec la réalité et la fiction, nous faisant sans arrêt nous arrêter dans notre aventure pour penser "et si c'était vrai ?". Ce n'est même plus de la suspension d'incrédulité, c'est une délicieuse paranoïa qui nous transporte et nous fait relativiser tout ce que nous savons...ou pensons être la réalité. Attention, un tel discours métaphysique, entièrement en anglais comme le jeu n'a pas été traduit, peut vite être rébarbatif. Mais si on aime les jeux bavards, on ne peut qu'être happés par la richesse du scénario.

Si le jeu ne se joue pas en temps réel et que le timer ne nous met jamais réellement en danger, les musiques aux accents industriels arrivent à faire monter en nous le stress essentiel pour être en empathie avec ces personnages forcés de concourir dans ce redoutable jeu de la mort.

Les personnages arrivent tous à posséder une personnalité propre, même Junpei, archétype du héro normal, se retrouve attachant dans ses réactions de jeune adulte paumé dans un complot qui le dépasse. Ces personnages sont servis par une direction artistique façon anime au poil, même si on regrettera quelques facilités un poil sexistes (coucou Personnage féminin à gros seins très animés, très peu vêtue mais superbement intelligente ! Bonjour Loli en uniforme scolaire !) et surtout le passage aux sprites 3D dans Virtue Last Reward. 

Les énigmes sont variées et dans l'ensemble logique même si certaines énigmes appelant au cryptage peuvent être difficile d'accès. Dans l'ensemble on s'amuse bien sans trop de temps morts. L'ajout du Flowchart dans cette version pc rendant la progression beaucoup plus fluide qu'elle ne l'a été sur DS.

En tout cas, pour vu que vous parliez bien anglais, 999 et VLR vous proposent une plongée haletante dans un thriller de science fiction comme le jeu vidéo n'en a jamais connu ! Un incontournable pour les aficionado de jeux narratifs.
