[h1] 《极限脱出 9小时9人9扇门》 [/h1]
失望。这是最能概括通关完999后我的内心感受的两个字。虽然已经被提前剧透到999的核心诡计和ever17类似以及犯人的名字，不过我认为这种程度的剧透还不至于影响游戏体验，再加上网上对999这部作品的评价普遍偏高，我心里就擅自得出了999应该是打越在之后出的一部不亚于ever17的作品这个结论。结果游玩999的体验非常让人失望，只能让我看出打越比起创新来说更愿意选择吃老本。

[b] 以下完全剧透。 [/b]

先说说999的上限。

有人说这游戏可惜就可惜在比ever17晚出，如果先出的是这部作品就怎样怎样。可是事实是这部作品根本就不是和ever17一个级别的，完全没有可比性。Ever17成功就成功在它的叙诡和Meta结合得天衣无缝，少了任何一个要素，就不可能让玩家有如此强烈的代入感和情感体验。反过来看999也是一个道理，999本身确实做了一个优秀的叙诡，利用NDS的机体来完成的诡计，但也就仅仅局限于此了。玩家也许会有一瞬间的震惊和感叹，但接下来并不会有更多的感情。整体的meta与其说稀少，倒不如说根本就没有。同时本篇也并没有清楚解释这个信息传递的具体意义，这个什么形态场理论比第三视点差的远了，最后要不是打越自己提一句，怕是连时空悖论都圆不回来。还有一点虽然是我个人倾向不过还是说一说吧，999里什么复仇，男女主之间的约定这些儿女情长和ever17里对生命的赞美一比味道差太多了。

在具体的游戏体验方面，虽然999比起ever17来说剧情紧凑了很多，没有冗长的日常剧情，悬疑的氛围也不错，但并不意味着999是不存在缺点的，相反，999本身也是有着很多的问题，质量上是有明显硬伤的。

首先我认为这游戏最大的缺点就是密室本身。密室过于简单，密室的解题部分没有难度导致没有挑战，玩家本应有的紧张刺激消失得荡然无存。同时，密室的解谜过程中还经常会进入剧情部分，强迫玩家中断解谜，看一大段剧情。特别是游戏的二周目之后，你会发现这个游戏很大一部分文本都是淳平在密室里听某个角色说着一大段话，而且有不少重复内容，形成场理论相关的例子还讲了四个，完全没有了当初ever17略微提及第三只眼的美感，只会让人感到不耐烦。虽然在最后的叙诡部分来看解密室的过程有它独特的意义，但由于密室本身的流程问题导致了密室最终和剧情完全割裂开来，可谓是999的最大失败之处。

其次反派本乡塑造也是一个大问题。这个角色在剧情中似乎就代表着绝对的“恶”，可谓是所有矛盾的对立点。然而这个角色本身并没有任何魅力，随意就中了陷阱，随意就被男主下了套，然后承认了罪行就开始长篇发言，讲自己具体手法和动机了……所以我觉得龙7在海猫里说的没错，很多推理作品根本就不注重角色的“心”。战胜这样一个单纯的恶役，是不能让我有什么激动和喜悦之情的。至于男主和茜的感情，也因为用了叙诡导致基本没有对男主的心理描写，男主对话中所展露的性格还有点前后不一，导致我很难去体会男主和茜之间存在的那一份羁绊与联系。

最后就是故事的严谨性也比前面几部作品差多了，可能的时空悖论就在最后一笔带过，爱丽丝感觉也是圆不回来就强行登场。然后“零”本身的计划也是经不起推敲的，有时间不多做点保护措施，没有保险导致会出现全员被本乡反杀、四叶暴走等悲剧结局，而且这些结局和“5-8-6”结局不一样，不能成为通往HE道路的垫脚石，所以并没有任何意义。

不过虽然吐槽了这么多，999本身的质量还可以，叙诡虽然和ever17差不多但是也利用到了新的东西。下面就说说优点部分吧。

可谓成也密室，败也密室，如果把999本身的实验场所——“船”，看作一个巨大的密室的话，这个密室毫无疑问是设计得非常不错的。玩家刚刚从5号小房间出来第一次试图去认识整个“船”的面貌时，会发现起始的大楼梯之处有很多个不同的入口，能开的却只有4,5两扇数字门，内心就会对门后面的东西有所期待。在一步一步解开密室的谜，获得了钥匙后，发现很多路都是互相连通的，对照地图，你就能发现整个“船”的密室设计非常巧妙，中间几个开近路和电梯颇有黑魂1的味道。最为可惜的是，游戏在船上的行动全以文本形式，没有自由移动部分再怎么精妙的设计也无法亲身体验了。

除此之外，虽然本乡这个反派塑造的很失败，但也有不少角色描写得不错。我认为最成功的是八代这个角色。八代这个角色形象是在游戏推动的过程中经过多次反转的，最初的二等船舱谈起心灵感应实验让她有一种神秘感；在厨房的见死不救似乎又有点无情；大病房里让人看到她丑陋和自私的一面；实验室内的黑客能力似乎又能窥视到她的隐情；监禁室里主动承担风险可以确定她有不能让步的东西；礼拜堂里第一个说出不愿抛弃赛文能明白我们其实看错了她，她很重视伙伴；到最后焚化炉愿意牺牲自己这里这个角色的形象已经彻底地丰满起来。

然后是赛文这个角色。似乎是这个游戏中唯一的良心，全程帮着主角，关键时刻也愿意放弃自己的生命，同时热血又有行动力，潜藏的记忆里拥有关于这个事件的关键线索。然而正是这么一个老大哥的形象，在最后的最后可能又反转了？就有点细思极恐了。（虽然我感觉是打越在强行圆，不然尼奥斯也说不通）

核心的叙诡以及打越擅长的字谜我也就不多谈了。

总体来说，我个人是不怎么满意999的，打越依然在吃他的老本，玩着用了很多次的时空诡计，但又没有新的突破或者建起一个有深度的主题。

不过999的叙诡比较优秀也是客观事实，要玩的话建议玩NDS版，不然最大的看点叙诡的乐趣也会削减很多。

总评：82分。

[h1] 《极限脱出 善人死亡》 [/h1]
比起前作999来说进步了太多，甚至可以说和999不是一个类型的游戏了。999只是单纯的密室+文字ADV+多线路，密室和多线路选择只是延长玩家的游戏时间，就算去掉也不影响游戏本身的剧情。而本作善人死亡不仅在999的基础上加入了AB游戏，同时作品中的密室和流程图系统都和剧情有着紧紧的联系，从叙事结构来说，善人死亡比起999高了一个层次。

和999不一样，本次善人死亡没有去模仿Ever17，再次以叙诡为核心构造故事。善人死亡更像是96年的作品YU-NO，玩家需要在不同的路线里体验故事和悬疑，收集各种情报，找到每条路线之间的联系，最终解开谜题，这和YU-NO现代篇如出一辙，同时毫无疑问也是这部作品的最大优点。当然，本作采用了和999一样的流程图系统，而不是YU-NO的ADMS，分歧也只是选择不同的房间，在AB游戏中作出不同的选择，对于玩家来说更加友好，毕竟像YU-NO这样的系统，不看攻略通关实在太难了。YU-NO由于设定问题只能选择获得不同的物品来推进剧情，而本作则改成了“情报”，获得特定的“情报”或者密码，可以让原本上锁的剧情继续推进下去。先不说有没有BUG，但这直观上比YU-NO更加容易理解。特别是故事接近尾声时跳跃到过去的AB房间，直接输入密码解开房间，可谓是对这种流程图系统叙事的一份完美答卷。

采用这样特定的系统叙事的优点还不仅如此。像悬疑氛围非常优秀，也是我认为善人死亡中最出色的两条路线——露娜线+K线也是在这样的叙事结构下才能写出来的。比起另外两条大线的主要危机"病毒”和“炸弹”来说，露娜线、K线的无人生还更加能吸引读者，这两条线正是做到了相互交织、互为谜题和谜底。这种效果在先玩露娜线时体验最好，死去的老太太，消失的夸克，连环的杀人事件，其中的一部分能在K线得到解答，而K线最后也有K的真实身份这样有意思的悬疑，同时通关K线获得的密码也是解开露娜线剧情锁的钥匙之一。注意的是此时露娜线并没有结束，当玩家通关西格玛线，得到部分真相和另一个钥匙时，就可以继续进行露娜线，而露娜线的最后也对连环杀人案件有着完整的解答，联想一下K线的一些谜团也自然而然同时解出了。这样互相交织的悬疑与解谜体验可谓相当好。露娜线收尾也很不错，露娜的塑造，青鸟的寓意，以及最后动人的CG演出，特别是打越擅长的字谜“MILKEVOLI”在事后也值得一番回味。

当然，也有写得较一般的线，比如天明寺线最后通关的差别也仅仅是夸克给西格玛一封信，实际上和剧情的谜题几乎毫无关系。四叶线是表面上很惊人的Minagoroshi，其实知道病毒的那一刻就没什么意思了，而且和后面别的路线的剧情也有冲突。爱丽丝线其实一开始还是不错的，消失的老太太尸体、别的路线的记忆、不同的选择、炸弹、紫色芯片，在第二轮AB游戏全员以及爱丽丝的背叛达到最高潮。可惜的是，游戏并没有对此进行过多的诠释，仅仅简单归结于爱丽丝的想法，并且还以此为契写了爱丽丝的过去，这里就很不恰当了，悬疑和解答的过大落差把前面一切都毁了。同时爱丽丝线解出的密码只是三个“completed‘，从这个密码推出迪奥非常的不自然，处理太随意。

最终线法伊线的BE只能说设想是好的，玩家作出不同的选择让剧情发生了改变，加大了代入感，但实际做出来的效果很一般。如果玩家先选择的是”协力“，那就失去了”自己作决定导致恶果“的反馈感，同样，如果玩家先选择的是”背叛“，那剧情就这么进行下去了，也同样感受不到”恶果“。实际上只有”协力vs背叛“”背叛vs协力“两种情况，玩家的选择还是没有真正改变什么。

故事的终盘会揭露两大叙诡，一个是地点，一个是人物，但我觉得叙诡在这作算是被玩烂了，月球的1/6重力以及男主是老人的事实根本就不能简简单单被0.4的思考速度和机械臂掩盖吧，本作的叙诡基本上还不如12R。最后的meta部分更是不行，说着”你一定想知道真相吧“来骗你去买下一作让这个meta非常掉价。

说到这个，善人死亡根本就没写完，只是把这个设施和AB计划的真相交代了罢了，法伊的身份，以及所有人最后的结局，要在下部作品才能揭晓。对于玩家来说，这当然也是非常影响体验的一件事，毕竟我通关完游戏也不敢看游戏的评价，生怕被玩过零时困境的玩家剧透。这一点肯定也是要扣分的。

最后说一说密室。就密室的游玩体验方面，依然是和999差不多，完全没难度，而新增的黄金文件密码分两种，第一种比通关的密码还要简单，第二种就像是电梯里的”3“，格雷姆房间的闭上眼睛这样完全没提示的密码，纯粹看玩家能不能想到，体验相当差，唯一算得上比较好的也只有治疗室的谜题了。当然，这些并不重要，本作总共只有16个密室，平均1条线都不到2个，再加上新增的AB游戏，密室在游戏流程中占的比重相当少。但是和999恰恰相反的是，本作的密室和剧情有相当多的联系，密室的设备以及通关保险箱获得的道具都和剧情息息相关，不同的路线获得的不同的设备和道具往往决定了该条线的结局，这一点对于999就是很大的进步了。

总评：85分。以YU-NO式的流程图胜出。

另外，希望打越以后不要再吃Ever17老本了，说实话Ever17开创是第一遍，R11进行了反方向的思考和诠释是第二遍，事不过三，这个手法可以到这里结束了。你打越不思进取的第三遍、第四遍、第五遍的模仿是没法让人有正面评价的。

Esse jogo é MARAVILHOSO! (os dois) 
É uma OBRA DE ARTE!
A história, os personagens, plot twists, a trilha sonora, os puzzles (alguns de arrancar os cabelos)! 
Vale cada centavo e o tempo investido.
Confesso que me deu até vontade de esquecer tudo só pra poder jogar de novo, e de novo, e de novo.
Kotaro Uchikoshi é um gênio!
Great game, highly recommended for puzzle lovers.

The story and mystery in this game are very well executed. Love the characters and writing, even the comedy is straight up my alley! The puzzles are interesting and really wrack your brains. 10/10 recommend it to anybody that's into mystery or thriller.

I found the story and the overall theme/vibe of the first game much more charming and interesting, in the 2nd game I was less than thrilled to see that the gorgeous 2D animation was replaced by low-poly 3D models, but the gameplay/puzzles are much more difficult and interesting than the first one. The first one's puzzles though, all had a certain "theme" while the 2nd game's themes were a bit all over the place, but it makes sense for the contexts and rooms they're in. The story of the 2nd game is a lot more complicated than the first one and its SO MUCH LONGER! The plot twists are hit much harder as well. The characters are still as well written, but I think I still prefer the first one simply for its charm and simplicity.

Moving on to the 3rd game with high hopes.
such a headf***, i love it

我觉得比 e17 牛，可惜知名度不高。
庆幸当时自己不知道哪根筋搭错了突然想玩密室逃脱类游戏，然后误打误撞遇上了 999，从此成为打越粉，steam 版一出就赶紧补票了

Обе игры в этом сборнике могут показаться визуальной новеллой триллером-детективом, где вы решаете головоломки и попутно вникаете в сюжет про незнакомых друг-другу людей запертых в одном месте и играющих в игру на выживание, но на деле это просто обертка для полноценного научно-фантастического рассказа с всего лишь каплей детектива, причем эта обертка исчезает как только вы достигаете пары концовок и понимаете что на самом деле это линейная история, а все остальные ветки развития сюжета существуют только для сбора информации и являются тупиками, что полностью уничтожает задел на какую-либо драму, так как эти игры (особенно вторая часть) заставят обойти все эти тупики и сделать все возможные выборы, чтобы получить адекватную концовку, так что они ничего не значат и очень большую долю игры вы просто пережевываете одну и ту же информацию по десять раз, что по-настоящему утомляет. Если говорить про сюжет то он действительно цепляет интересными диалогами, каплей юмора, интригой и размышлениями на темы квантовой физики и философии, причем развивается он таким образом что сравнив начало истории и ее конец, вы не поверите что это одна история. Про головоломки сказать особо нечего, они не очень сложные, иногда требуют наличие карандаша и бумаги и являются просто препятствием перед очередной порцией сюжета. В целом игру рекомендую всем поклонникам научной-фантастики, которых не напрягают головоломки, те же кто ищет тут триллер с предательствами и личной драмой, как мне кажется останутся разочарованными.
I'm about to play this game but my gal says it's sick so u know

9人・・・の方だけ終わったのでレビュー。
一応お勧めの範囲に入る（セールなら）が、いろいろと細かいところが目に付く。

・主人公とヒロインがバカっぽい。

　何というか声優が演技過剰。というか、もともとのキャラクターデザインがブレまくってるので、
まじめにそれに沿ってみたらそうなってしまったということか。
特に主人公がやばい。とんでもない自己中。自分が正義なら他人にいくら乱暴にしてもいいと思っているタイプ。
イベントの度に異常なほど騒ぐ。そして寒いギャグを挟む。どうでもいい場面ですぐに切れる。
総じてバカっぽい。感情移入しにくい。
脇役？も味はあるのだが、命がかかってて時間もない中で、臨場感たっぷりな回想シーンを入れてしまう
バカっぷりに萎える。

・脱出系＆推理物の割にSF盛り込み過ぎ

「ある科学者が実験した事だが・・・」みたいなのが異常なほど出てくる。
あまりに多すぎて、どこまでが実話（SF）なのか、どこからがこのゲーム用に作った話なのかわからないレベル。
SFだからこそ、その辺ははっきりさせてほしい。

・伏線（謎）のつくりがチープ。

割と序盤からすぐに気づくトリックが満載だが、どのキャラもスルーしてしまうので、大変ストレス。
その割に、後半になると大した記載もなく、いつの間にか気づいていた、みたいな展開になっていたりする。
また、前半ではどの脇役もすごいスピードで数字根を暗算する。子供も大人も関係なし。
なのに、最終局面で数字根の問題が出ると、案山子になって主人公の太鼓持ちになってしまう。
総じてキャラが安定していない。

・システム面がいまいち。

モバイルからの移植だから仕方ないのかもしれないが、痒いところに手が届かないシステム。
割と重要なflow画面も、理解するまでにしばらくかかった。

総じてもったいないつくり。
結構疲れたので、善人・・・は気力が回復してからやることにします。

SFサスペンス系ノベルゲームと脱出ゲームを融合させたZERO ESCAPE（極限脱出）シリーズ三部作のうち、第一作『極限脱出 9時間9人9の扉』と第二作『極限脱出ADV 善人シボウデス』を一本にまとめた作品。ストーリー的にもつながりがありますので、必ず『9時間9人9の扉』→『善人シボウデス』の順番でプレイするようにしましょう。

第一作『9時間9人9の扉』は、ノベルパートも脱出パートも比較的シンプルな内容。背景が2Dなので、脱出パートで自分がどこにいてどちらを向いているのか把握しづらいのが困りましたが、背景を調べたときに対象範囲を枠で示してくれる機能はありがたかったです（『善人シボウデス』以降に受け継がれていないのが残念）。ストーリーは、真相の核心部分については納得と感動がありましたが、その周辺の要素となると「結局どういうことだったの？」という消化不良感が残りました（それらの一部は『善人シボウデス』でフォローされています）。

第二作『善人シボウデス』では、脱出パートの歯ごたえが増した印象。背景が3D化されたため、室内を自由に見回せるようになったのがよかったです。背景と同じく3D化されたキャラクターは、残念ながらチープさが否めませんでしたが。同じく悪評の多いマップ上の移動シーンについては、オプションで未読スキップをONにすればテンポよく飛ばすことができます。ストーリー面は、前作と比べて分岐こそ多いものの、大半のルートがあまり変わり映えのしない展開で少し中だるみ感があったのですが、終盤に差し掛かってからの怒涛の伏線回収＆力業の大トリックには唸らされました。

ちなみに『善人シボウデス』のエンディングについて、一部に「完結していない」という評がありますが、実際は作中の謎に（おおむね）解答を出してプレイヤーにカタルシスを与えたうえで、新たな謎を提示する結末であって、決して謎解きを完全に放棄して続編に丸投げしているわけではありません。

もちろん、この新たな謎が気になる方は、ぜひ第三作 [url=store.steampowered.com/app/311240/]Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma[/url]（『ZERO ESCAPE 刻のジレンマ』）へと進んでほしいのですが、仮に『善人シボウデス』でプレイを終えたとしても、物語としては十分に完結したつくりになっていると思います。三部作だからといって構えることなく、まずは遊んでみてください。

Zero Escape: The Nonary Games is comprised of two separate games, Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors, and Virtue's Last Reward. They both are visual novel games that consist of escape style rooms. The novel part of both games are excellent in their own rights, however they do have minor problems but it shouldn't detract much. The puzzle sections are fun and exciting when you piece together how to solve it, however some puzzles in 1 room are just painfully harder compared to the rest. The voice acting in both of the games are excellent and adds to the experience a ton, especially more in the first game at certain parts. Overall both of these games are really fun and most people who are interested in this game should buy it.
Si te gustan los escape rooms, una buena historia, las aventuras gráficas y los finales múltiples, este es tu juego.

好游戏！好剧本！9/10！
由于999是在几年前玩的，所以着重说一下刚刚通关的善人死亡。（没有汉化的情况下硬是啃着英语通了关，要去读懂SECRETS里大量的文字确实耗时不少，但每一个词汇都有充实游戏世界观的价值，喜欢剧情类游戏的朋友还是值得看一下的）
[b] 画面7/10 [/b].原作诞生于2012年，画质要求确实不能太高。但是善死中的立绘与CG真的不好看，反而是09年999的立绘看起来更舒服好看，只有CLOVER在善死独自美丽，LUNA和PHI本来可以更好看的，所以遗憾扣了点分。[spoiler] 不过2028年的茜还挺好看的 [/spoiler]
[b] 剧情9/10 [/b].打越老师不愧是永远滴神，关于时间线的剧本能翻着花写。剧情很好的对接了999，也为下一作埋了很多点，人物刻画比较饱满，[spoiler] 虽然有的AB game里选背叛感觉有点强行，不过LUNA始终ally的行为有戳到我，小天使！ [/spoiler]可惜几个死线结局感觉有点局促，重头全部埋在了真结局上，个人觉得稍显美中不足。
[b] 游戏性10/10 [/b].密室+文字类ADV很符合本人胃口，很可惜在快节奏的现在这两类游戏的受众面在不断的缩小，像我一样的爱好者能打出满分，反之庞大的文字只会让不爱好者昏昏欲睡，谜题与大量世界观内容都不如一个剧透来的直接，确实很遗憾。
[b] 音乐8/10 [/b]大体流程中的音乐还算流畅，但长篇文字叙述时有时会出现中断，小瑕疵。

总结，对于密室类游戏与剧情类爱好者是一定要体验的一款游戏，不爱好者也建议看看直播或是看一下剧透，游戏内有涉及到假象科学和科学悖论元素，图一乐或是打发时间也是挺好的选择。
If you like mistery visual novels with great puzzles and incredibly stories, you owe it to yourself to play the Nonary Games.

9時間9人9の扉のみ全ルートクリア（13時間程度）。善人シボウデスメインルートのみ全クリア（放置分あり実際は35時間程度）。

【クリア後感想】
SF・オカルト・考察が好きな人ならおすすめ。全3部作で不満があっても続きが気になってしまうので、はじめるときは覚悟したほうがいい。
シナリオライターの癖が強く、はまる人ははまると思うけど、個人的には前時代エロゲ的な悪さを感じてしまった。（何でもない箇所で唐突に下ネタ、主人公がふざけちゃいけないシーンでふざけてイライラする）

【追記】999はおすすめしませんが、シボウデスはおすすめ。
下記に書いた不満点がほぼ解消されていました。
脱出ゲームの難易度・バリエーションも999と比べて幅広く楽しいです。
また、他レビューにある移動時間ですが、オプションで未読スキップをオンにすれば高速にできます。
※シボウデスには999のネタバレが多いです。シボウデスのみの場合は戻らない覚悟で。
ただ999の2D立ち絵はできがよくて可愛いので見てほしい。

シボウデス単体ならおすすめレビューにするので悩みましたが、
999の不満が長いレビューなので評価おすすめしないのままにしておきます。






↓以下、999クリア時点で気になった点（ネタバレなし）↓












■ストーリーに対する補足が必須レベル
全ルートをクリアしても、疑問点が多く残るストーリー。
自身で考察をするか、ネタバレ覚悟で検索して先人の知恵を得るしかない。
2020年現在、続編も出ている状況で999のみの考察を読むのは大変だった。
販売当時ならば問題にならなかった点。

■事前情報がないとついていけない超展開
ライターの癖を知らないとついていけない可能性がある。
シュタゲの未来ガジェット、ダンガンロンパの超高校級の才能のような、
ストーリーの根幹に関わる設定が中盤まで隠されていて、かつ超常的な内容なので受け入れづらい。

■ニンテンドーDS版の状態を完全に再現していない。
オチに関する箇所なので、具体的には記述しないが、DSならではの感動が（おそらく）あった。
その大オチを不完全な状態で経験するため、不満点をひっくり返すほどの感動がなかった。
また、同じ理由でストーリーの理解がゲームのみでは難しくなっている。
※ボイス、フローチャート、周回が楽など、DS版よりも良くなっている点は多いです。

■キャラクターの個性が掴みづらい。
具体的には、（続編で解消される可能性があるが）見た目とプロフィールが一致しないキャラクターがいる。魅力的を通り越して謎。特徴的な服装が設定に関わることがなく、終わってみると全員コスプレイヤーに見える。時期的に逆転裁判の影響だと思うが噛み合ってない印象。

また、個々人のパーソナリティが見えづらいため、キャラ萌えもしづらい。
オカルトめいた話をヒロインがしてくるので、「そういうのが好きな子なんだなぁ」と思ってると、別のキャラもオカルト話をする。
「あー、このおじさんはダジャレが好きなのかな？」と思っていると、別のキャラもダジャレを言う。なんなら全員言ってる。
キャラが9人いるのに、最終的なパーソナリティはシナリオライターの1人に収束する。たぶんオカルト・SF・ダジャレ好き。
ただ、作中で「誰かの経験が無意識化で別の人間に伝播する」という思考実験の説明があるので、もしかしたら意図的な演出かもしれない。



全体的に気になる箇所が多いが、「このもやもやが続編ですっきり解決するのでは？」という気もして１作でもクリアすると途中で降りる決心がつかないのでおすすめしません。

シナリオライターの過去作では、謎を謎のまま丸投げしている作品もあるらしいけど、ネット上の優れた考察を読むと「自分の理解不足かもしれない」とインタビューや考察を探し回ってしまうやばい沼です。脱出したい。
my disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined
This game is a masterpiece.

脱出ゲー + ノベルゲー

ストーリーはトンデモ設定ありのライトなSFといった感じで個人的には良かった。
シチュエーションがサスペンスなので、断片が少しずつ繋がっていってクリアするときに真相がわかるように作られていて、推理小説のような感じ。

キーボード+マウスで操作したけど操作感は悪くなかった。
善人の方は左右のスクロールが遅いのが地味にストレスだったけどもしかして続編の刻のジレンマのようにドラッグできたのかな？
割と直感的なので困らなかったが、操作についての説明はあんまり親切ではないと思う。

脱出ゲームの難易度はスマホアプリの脱出ゲームをやる人なら簡単すぎるくらい。
次何すればいいかが結構あからさまで、分かりづらいところにキーアイテムが隠されていたりはしないので単に謎解きができれば苦労せずクリアできると思う。

2つ合わせてクリアまで50時間くらいでした。
3部作で刻のジレンマまでやらないと完結しないので3つセットのバンドルが安くなってるときに買うことをおすすめします。
probly the best game

You know those actual escape rooms you can go to, where you solve puzzles to escape a room with a group of people? Playing these games is like going to one of those and the person you get stuck with is a weeb who is high as a kite and way too into pseudoscience. 

999: The characters are pretty good when they aren't regularly bringing the plot to a screeching halt to tell you about some conspiracy theory they read on wikipedia last night. If you really like converting base 10 to hexidecimals and calculating digital roots, you'll love the puzzles! Otherwise, no. The plot is pretty ridiculous but it's not nearly as bad as later games.

VLR: The characters are awful, with one exception. Yeah, even the ones that return from the first game. My favorite endings were the ones were everyone died. This game has far more endings than the first one and getting them all will drive you nuts because you'll see the same scene over and over but the game will count it as slightly different enough for the "skip read text" section to not work. And even then you can't skip the BEEP... BEEP... BEEP... as your character's dot traverses the map each time you move around. VLR does, however, have the best puzzles of the whole series, so there's that I guess. The plot is completely ridiculous and took months off my total lifespan.

You should buy these games for someone if you want to attempt to kill them with psychic damage.
MANO MUITO BOM HISTÓRIA SENSACIONAL
Virtue's Last Reward is still one of the best adventure/puzzle games out there. It's very much worth playing.

両作品クリアしたので投稿

ストーリーの随所に脱出要素があり
そこそこな難易度で結構クリアまで時間がかかった。

9人の方のストーリーやパズル要素にそこまで不満はないが
他の人も言及している通り全体的にストーリーの分岐や戻し作業がだるく、
善人の方のテンポの悪さにはうんざりした。
（もう以下うんざりポイント）
プレイ時間の1/3近くは移動を眺めてるんじゃないかと思うほど。
ただA室からB室に移動したって説明で済むものを
ドアを表示→ドアが開く（無駄に遅い）→MAPを移動する描写→ドア．．．をひたすら目的地につくまでやる。
ストーリーに関係しないし全くいらない。
それを移動するたびやる。もちろん脱出部屋に行くときも移動するし、探索でもする。
普通では？と思う人もいるだろうが、（私もやる前はレビュー見て思ったが）
これは繰り返しクリアを前提としたゲームなので
繰り返すたびにこの流れを毎回やる。どうでもいいドアのゆっくり開くシーンを１００回近く見る。
毎回ワクワクしながら車庫のシャッターの上下を眺められる人はおすすめ。
もちろんスキップ機能もあるにはあるが移動スキップと同時にストーリーもスキップしてくれる。
飛ばせないくどい演出も多く、耐えた先には同じような展開を延々と繰り返されたりする。
味がたまにしかしないガムを延々噛まされているような感覚を覚え、
まったく終わっていないバッドエンドで飛ばせないスタッフロールを見せられたときに途中でやめて1ヶ月ほど放置した。
そして買ったからには、9人の方はやったからと苦痛に耐えて終えた先には次回に続くと終わる。
脱出部分だけやりたいのであれば全く問題ない。
ストーリーはネットで見ればおそらく10分ぐらいでわかる。
既読スキップ機能で演出までスキップする修正がされれば普通におすすめできる。

あくまで個人的な感想だが
現状2作合わせてやろうと思うと苦痛を味わうことになるためおすすめしません。

Zero Escape: The Nornary Games ist nicht nur eine, sondern gleich zwei Visual Novels aus dem Hause Spike Chunsoft, die ende März 2017 auf Steam veröffentlicht wurden. Beide Titel sind direkte Umsetzungen der Konsolen-Version der Titel Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors und Virtue's Last Reward. Das Original des Ersteren erschien ende 2009 für Nintendo DS und des Zweiteres im Jahr 2012 für den Nintendo 3DS.

In Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (fortan kurz 999) schlüpft man in die Rolle des jungen Junpei, der eines Nachts aus seinem Eigenheim entführt wird, um mit acht anderen Personen an einem Bizarren Spiel um Leben und Tod teilzunehmen.
In Virtue's Last Reward, das Zeitlich nach 999 spielt, folgt man dem jungen Sigma in ein ähnliches Schicksal. Auch er wird an einem ruhigen Abend entführt und sieht sich gezwungen in einem irrsinnigen Spiel mit einer Hand voll Leuten um sein Leben zu spielen.

Auch wenn sich technisch beide Teile in vielerlei Hinsicht unterscheiden, sind beide Spiele im Grunde genommen Visual Novels, die ihre Geschichte mit gerenderten Charakteren, vielen Texten, Bildern und größtenteils vertonten Dialogen erzählen. Nach ein paar aufgeworfenen Fragen wird der Erzählstrang jedoch von Rätzel-Räumen unterbrochen, aus denen die Charaktere entkommen müssen. Kurz gesagt also handelt es sich hierbei um Visual Novels mit Escape Room Einlagen. Die Räume sind dabei hervorragend in die Handlung eingebunden und dienen nicht nur als Mittel zum Zweck. Im Gegensatz zu vielen anderen Escape Room Spielen steckt hinter den Zero Escape Spielen jede Menge Handlung, die teils offen und teils nur sehr versteckt durch Hinweise erzählt wird.

Gesteuert werden beide Teile entweder konsolen-typisch mit dem Controller oder mit Maus und Tastatur. Beide Steuerungen funktionieren sehr gut und sind nicht wirklich kompliziert.

Grafisch unterscheiden sich die beiden Titel dieses Doppelpacks ziemlich. Während Virtues Last Reward auf 3D Grafik mit 3D Modellen und Umgebungen setzt, greift 999 auf ein eher klassisches System mit 2D-Sprites vor 2D Hintergründen zurück. Beide Optiken haben ihre Vor- und Nachteile. Während bei Virtue's Last Reward die 3D Kamera in den Escape Rooms für ein besseres Raumverständnis sorgt, sind die Charaktere mit ihren teils verwaschenen Texturen kein vergleich zu den liebevoll und detailreich animierten 2D Charakteren. Dies fällt vor allem bei 999 auf, da es sich hierbei um die neu aufgelegte Konsolen-Variante handelt.

Der Sound des Spiels ist generell sehr atmosphärisch, auch wenn generell Soundeffekte meist nur kurz eingespielt werden. Die zum Sound gehörende Vertonung der Charaktere ist jedoch hervorragend. Sowohl die japanische Sprachausgabe als auch die englische sind sehr gut, da sich die Synchronsprecher große Mühe mit ihren Rollen gegeben haben. Das gilt alles für beide Titel.

Ebenfalls für beide Titel gilt, dass der Soundtrack den Glanz noch weiter erhellt. Er besteht nicht nur aus hervorragenden Stücken, sondern die Qualität wurde im Vergleich zu den Originalversionen auf den Handhelds noch einmal gründlich erhöht. Jeder einzelne Titel bietet seine eigenen Nuancen und heben die Atmosphäre der Szenen noch einmal dramatisch an.

Alles in Allem ist Zero Escape: The Nornary Games ein hervorragendes Paket für Liebhaber von Visual Novels und auch für Einsteiger, da die Puzzle-Szenen in beiden Spielen eine hervorragende Abwechslung zum längeren Lesen bietet. Die Stories sind packend, voll mit Mysterien und warten trotz ihrer Länge bis zum Ende mit neuen Überraschungen auf.
Zwei Dinge muss ich an dieser Stelle jedoch auf den Weg geben:

1. Es ist zwingend erforderlich die Teile in chronologischer Reihenfolge zu lesen und auch Kenner des Originals von 999 sollten den Teil noch einmal lesen, ehe sie mit Virtue's Last Reward anfangen. (Vor allem, wenn es schon 11 Jahre her ist...)

2. Kann ich nur wärmstens empfehlen die "Zero Escape Trilogy" bei einem Steam Sale günstig zu schießen. Das lohnt sich am meisten.

Fantastic Games. 999 is a great story and good pacing with overall ok puzzles, whereas VLR was a much more ambitious story and game, with much better puzzles and twists in its ending, with only a slight issue I think in the pacing.

This game is worth way more than the price.

The original DS release of 999 is one of my favorite games of all time. Other than the absurd decision to omit narration in the default "adventure" mode and some strange dialogue tweaks, this port is excellent! Just make sure you stick to "Novel mode" outside of conversations if you're interested in the storytelling that made this game so well received.

For anyone that has beaten the original release or any of the ports, [spoiler]this version obviously can't replicate the storyline details requiring the two screens. Of course, they couldn't keep the original twist, but this also means that some overarching narrative and revelations associated with the true endings are lacking somewhat. I worry that newcomers will miss out on some very impactful storytelling[/spoiler], but there's really not much the developers could have done to remedy this.

That said, the addition of the voice acting makes many scenes far more brutal than in the original and the graphics remaster / quality of life improvements are a big win. All in all, I definitely recommend it!
Story is intriguing, well made. Plus had a really fun multiple choice element.

if youre a vn or puzzle fan, buy this game!!! the puzzles are pretty difficult (especially in vlr) but the story is so interesting and rewarding that it's hard to stop, especially after finishing 999.

Love the story and characters of 999, the references to things like scientific theories, conspiracy theories and philosophical discussions made a incredibly interesting story that stretched across multiple timelines and playthroughs. I'd purely recommend buying this just for this game.

Virtues Last Reward is a bit iffy for me, I did greatly enjoy it's story, but there's quite a large amount of backtracking present in the story in order to get to proper endings. I'm also not too much of a fan of the main characters overt provocative nature. It's not overwhelming, but it does come up once every hour or so and it hurts my soul.

The only issue I would properly give these games collectively is the graphical quality, both are ports from handheld consoles and they both have (in particular 999) astoundingly bad quality assets. It seems specifically character sprites were improved and redone during the port, but it left certain escape room sprites looking like they were made out of clay. I didn't experience any crashes playing either game, though I dont know how to use multiple save files in 999 as anywhere I click, including the switch save file button just overwrites the current save.

It's hard to talk up these games as what truly made them so interesting to me was going through them completely blind. The best I can say is to expect very story driven games where the majority of the enjoyment comes from the vast amount of dialogue present in the game. Don't expect it to be a purely puzzle-escape kind of game.

This is easily one of my favorite games of all time. I own this game on every platform that it exists on, and I never get tired of playing it! The game is part visual novel and part room escape. The story is incredible (and pays off in amazing ways once you get through all three games), and the characters are very well written and voiced.

kinda a real mind F**k, but i love chunsoft for that reason ex: Dangaronpa series. im only to the second game but i have already put 10 hours into VLR and that means it took me 36 hours to get all the achievments in 999. if you like horror, VNs that have routes that change as you make diff choices. i only got 1 true ending so far but i cant wait to play the third one (which i own) Brilliant story and keeps you guessing whats bout to happen and looking back and wondering if you made the choices in a diff way then it wouldve played out diff :D 10/10

Regardless, I still recommend these games for people that enjoy puzzle and dark mysteries!

The nonary games es una colección de dos juegos, los dos primeros de la trilogía Zero Escape. El primero fue lanzado por primera vez para Nintendo DS (el famoso 999) y el segundo salió años después en 3ds.

En este port en inglés encontraréis detalles bastante chulos, como un nuevo doblaje completo (salvo el protagonista en el 2 por razones argumentales) y con una calidad bastante alta. También tenéis un nuevo gráfico de flujo en el 999, que antes no existía, y que hace el juego muchísimo más cómodo y agradable de jugar. 

También han añadido soporte al control, ofreciendo distintas posibilidades. A pesar de todo, el control original táctil de las consolas de Nintendo PESA al juego. Donde normalmente usarías el dedo para pasar la pantalla, aquí has de usar cursores repetidas veces, y debido a su sensibilidad, sobre todo en el 2, acabarás abriendo menús  haciendo zooms varias veces cuando no querías. Es molesto pero tampoco te destroza la experiencia. Aparte de eso, me parecen muy buenas versiones de los originales, probablemente la mejor forma de jugarlos.

"Vale pero llevas tres parrafazos y todavía no sé de qué va esta cosa". Cierto. Son novelas visuales, llenas de puzles de tipo escape room, que tan de moda se han puesto. Básicamente es encontrar la forma de salir de la habitación. Acertijos, matemáticas, colores, hay un poco de todo. Algunos son realmente buenos. La parte de la novela es una historia de ciencia ficción que implica traslaciones espaciotemporales y transdimensionales... vamos, unas idas de olla de la leche :D

Aunque técnicamente están desfasados, los fans del género ni lo notaréis. Las mejores novelas visuales que existen casi ni tienen apartado gráfico, es casi figurado. Ni siquiera las de moda son potentes técnicamente. Cosas como danganronpa, steins gate, fate stay night o phoenix wright... pues más o menos ese nivel podéis esperar aquí. Algo mejor que algunas de esas, algo peor que otras. Dicho eso, la música funciona muy bien en algunas escenas.

La dificultad se ajusta al jugador, dando pistas conforme te golpeas la cabeza contra las paredes. En el 2 tienes el modo difícil, donde apenas te dan pistas. Recomiendo jugarlo así, y además, si no lo hacéis no podréis ver los finales buenos. 

En este juego hay muchos finales pero están todos enlazados. Necesitas verlos todos para tener una imagen completa. Pensad en Nier autómata si queréis entender lo que quiero decir. No basta con pasarte el juego una vez para entender lo que sucede. Eso sí, el resto de veces podréis ir directamente a las elecciones importantes...

En fin, voy a ir cerrando. Es un pack estupendo. Recomiendo pillar la trilogía completa, que tampoco sube mucho el precio. EL nivel del tercer juego no es tan alto como de los dos primeros pero sigue siendo satisfactorio. A LOS FANS DEL GÉNERO: NO OS LO PERDÁIS.

Что ж, вот я и прошел все части данной серии и готов высказать свое мнение о каждой игре. Начнем по порядку. Поскольку конкретно Zero Escape: The Nonary Games содержит в себе две части (999 и VLR) соответственно, то я пройдусь по обеим.
Nine Hours Nine Persons Nine Doors (2009):
Начинаясь, как типичный слешер по типу "Пилы" новелла грамотно обманывает своего читателя. Мы подсознательно готовимся к чему-то заезженному и неинтересному, однако 999 в этом плане приятно удивляет. Мало ли что мы имеем отличный и закрученный сюжет, так еще и интересные головоломки. Они не особо сложные и я бы не сказал что игра по геймплею чем то выделяется. Наоборот, она представляет из себя классический квест по поиску ключей и кодов в комнате. Однако, мне все равно понравились эти секции побега. Дело в том что каждая комната обоснованна сюжетно и в состоянии рассказать немного о самом сюжете. В общем, часть игры, в которой мы сбегаем из различных комнат выступает довольно неплохой зарядкой для мозга. Это еще притом что данная часть полностью завязана на числах и математике. (То чувство когда считал в голове вместе с Джунпеем). Короче говоря, обе секции в этой новелле сделаны на должном уровне. Новелла рассказывает отличную и необычную историю, а квест дает неплохую разрядку и позволяет игроку подумать над десятком различных задачек. Автор, можно сказать, перевернул мое представление о Point And Click квестах с ног на голову. С персонажами здесь так же все в порядке. Они все живые, у них есть характеры. К сожалению, на русский переведены лишь эта часть и Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma. Если хотите ознакомиться с данной серией, то лучше всего начать именно с 999. Она не так сильно связана в сюжетном плане со следующими двумя частями, так что если вам вдруг не понравится, вы со спокойной душой можете не играть в другие игры. Они по наполнению и геймплею примерно похожи. Напоследок еще хотел бы выделить отличную механику в виде древа событий. Эта специальная схема, которая показывает игроку на каком он сейчас находится моменте сюжета и сколько всего развилок существует. Впервые увидел подобную штуку в новеллах и сказать, что она мне очень зашла это значит ничего не сказать. Хотел бы чтобы другие авторы добавляли эту систему в свои игры. Я понимаю, что в случае с Zero Escape это обоснованно еще и сюжетом, но все равно добавление подобных систем в новеллу даже просто так очень сильно помогло бы. Вместо того чтобы перематывать весь раннее прочитанный текст, можно было бы просто нажать одну кнопочку и переместиться к нужному выбору. Разве это не прекрасно?
Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward (2012):
Вот мы и перешли к моей любимой части. Почему любимая? Да потому что здесь взяли все хорошее, что было в 999 и возвели в куб. Огромная история с большим количеством развилок? Есть. (серьезно, тут просто каждая сюжетная линия разделяется на две). Отличный сюжет, выносящий мозг своим финальным твистом? В наличии. (я после этого поворота еще дня два-три отходил). Интересные секции побега, выросшие в количестве и бросающие более серьезный вызов? На месте. Касательно них я хотел бы поговорить отдельно. По сравнению с первой частью они эволюционировали и стали гораздо сложнее. Хотя, может быть это из-за того что играл я на английском языке с переводчиком и мне было сложновато понять некоторые из них. Я думаю что ответ где-то посередине. Для искушенных любителей квестов здесь так же добавили по секретному паролю в каждую комнату. Он разблокирует документы с некоторыми подробностями сюжета. Конечно, эту информацию и так раскроют дальше по ходу сюжета, однако у игрока есть возможность прочитать об этом заранее. Так же я хотел бы отметить, собственно, саму игру. Правила претерпели кардинальные изменения и ничего общего с игрой из первой части она уже не имеет. Однако, именно эта игра понравилась мне больше всего. Ее правила позволяют проверить человеческие узы и их степень доверия друг к другу. Серьезно, сколько раз я огорчался когда жал эту злополучную кнопку "Ally", а мне плевали в лицо и жали "Betray". После пару таких раз я уже ко всем персонажам относился к подозрением. Помимо этого здесь появился свой аналог Монокумы из серии Danganronpa. Жалко конечно, что за всю игру он появлялся не так много раз. Не успел он раскрыть свою харизму. Единственное за что я хотел бы поругать эту часть, так это 3D модельки и 3D CG. Ну это просто ужас, ребят. Неужели нельзя было оставить те симпатичнейшие 2D спрайты из первой части? Мне вообще не нравится как серия эволюционировала в плане графики. Это скорее деградация чем эволюция. Ну, об этом мы еще поговорим в обзоре на Zero Time Dilemma. А про эту часть я же могу сказать одно - этим просто можно брать и обмазываться. Вот, реально. Эта игра явно стоит потраченного на него времени с переводчиком. Да и вообще, вся серия. Спасибо тебе, Котаро Учикоши за эту прекрасную историю. И не только за эту. Remember11 для меня до сих остается самой любимой и необычной новеллой. Написать такую мозговыносящую историю просто надо уметь. Всем, кто уже прошел Zero Escape настоятельно рекомендую ознакомиться с R11. Вы не пожалеете уж точно. А на этом я с вами прощаюсь. Надеюсь что я смог подтолкнуть людей к покупке. Всем добра!

I bought this game since its marked as similar to Danganronpa. I feel satisfied with my purchase.

As the name suggests, the main mechanic of this game, is about solving escape rooms. The puzzles have a mild difficulty most of the time, with some hard ones from time to time that do make you spend some time looking around the whole room twice or trice in order to find the proper clues.

Since these are visual novels, you do need to replay the game and select different choices in order to get full story, but of course that’s part of the enchant these games have.

This is a must buy if you enjoy mystery novels

Pros:
- Reasonably fun escape room puzzles
- Storyline that could have been fun and interesting given a good editor

Cons:
- Brutally long-winded dialogue that extends the gameplay many hours beyond what it should have been
- Underdeveloped characters
- Puzzles don't tie into the story particularly well
- Too much repetition required to achieve the "true" endings

Zero Escape: The Nonary Games aslında Zero Escape üçlemesinin ilk iki oyunu olan 999 ve Virtue's Last Reward'u içeriyor. İki oyunun da bitiş süresi sizin okuma ve bulmaca çözme hızınıza bağlı olarak değişse de, ben ilk oyunu yaklaşık 15 saat, ikinci oyunu ise yaklaşık 20 saatte bitirdim, iki oyunu da %100 bitirdiğimi de hesaba katın. Seri "Room Escape" tarzı bir oyun, her odadaki bulmacaları çözerek o odadan çıkmaya çalışıyorsunuz ancak bunun yanında akıp giden bir hikâye de mevcut. Aldığınız kararlara göre elde ettiğiniz sonlar değişiyor, ilk oyunda 6, ikinci oyunda ise 22 son var.

İlk oyun olan 999 (evet sırayla oynamanız lazım), hikâyesel olarak benim daha çok sevdiğim bir konuya sahip fakat bulmacaları biraz basit kalıyor olabilir sizin için. İlk oyunda görmek zorunda olduğunuz 2 son olsa da ben 6 sonu da görmeniz gerektiğini düşünüyorum. True END'i elde edebilmek için öncesinde başka bir sonu görmüş olmanız lazım ve bunun olayı da hikâyenin temelinde açıklanıyor, spoiler yememek için sebebini araştırmamanız en iyisi.

İkinci oyun olan Virtue's Last Reward ise hikâyesel olarak da gayet iyi olsa da ilk oyunun hikâyesi daha fazla bana hitap ediyordu. Ancak ikinci oyundaki hikâye anlatımı (story telling) ilk oyundan çok çok daha iyi. Hikâyesi karışık olsa da sona geldiğinizde hepsi oturuyor neredeyse. Bu oyunda önceki oyundan farklı olarak her sonu almanız gerekiyor yoksa True END'e ulaşamıyorsunuz. Ayrıca deyinmem lazım, VLR içerisindeki bulmacalar 999'daki bulmacalardan çok daha kafa yormayı gerektiren bulmacalar. Yani en büyük isteğiniz bulmaca ise bunu karşılıyor, eğer en büyük isteğiniz hikâye ise yine bunu karşılıyor. Bitirdikten sonra memnun olmamanız çok düşük bir ihtimal.

"Bu kadar son almak fazla uzun sürmez mi?" derseniz, şaşırtıcı biçimde hayır sürmüyor. Menüdeki "Flow" sekmesinden istediğiniz sahneye zıplayabiliyorsunuz, yani en baştan oynamak zorunda değilsiniz. Benzer doğrultuda giden seçimlerde diyaloglar aşırı fark etmediği için oraları hızlı hızlı geçebilirsiniz.

A puzzle based visual novel game series where you're faced with life or death situations, trying to escape several rooms on limited time restrictions, while your friends spend the next 20 minutes talking about the crystallization of glycerin, metaphysics, alternative timeline theories, Schrödinger's cat, and ice that melts at 96 degrees. Genuinely a 10 / 10 game.
This story had a very developed and interesting line that gets you deep into this game.

Im split about this game .... well because its two games.
The first one is pretty good. Interesting set up with the split narratives where the paths split and at times go back together each providing slightly different information.
the second does the same.. the narrative splits depending on what decissions you make BUT in the first you could just skip all the information youve already seen. In the second you can technically do the same BUT the paths dont go back together. therefor basically the same things happen and you get basically the same information BUT the people who are present are different or the game deems the things that happened before as so different that it doesn´t let you skip the information you already know just becuase it has a SLIGHTLY little nuance differently this time. That makes the second game HELL of a lot more tedious. And dont get me started on the overuse of the friggin "Keys" (story points that are locked until you saw something in another story path) in the narratives of which there were only like 3-4 in the first game and in the second are in every friggin path. 
And another thing. The god damn walking from point A to point B animations which consists of a dot moving over a map and doors opening. OVER AND OVER AGAIN and its god damn long and you cant skip it (as far as I can tell). What the hell man ... whats the point?! 
Still recommend this for the first game. Maybe just skip the second. (there is a separate third ... i dont know if you should have played the second for the third...)
999 and VLR are both amazing games worth your time.

Great game

I'll be one of the many people to recommend this game. Well, it actually packs two games. Anyway, I'm not leaving a simple like because there are problems with this gamepack.

First game: 999
This game is absolutely splendid. The puzzles are generally not too difficult, and if you get into trouble, you'll usually get enough hints to continue. The story is very well build. After finishing my first route, I was doubting the whole game's story, it seemed to progress slowly despite a cool start. I was also surprised how quickly I managed to get an end. However, this quickly faded away, as each route did add its own accents, and there were plenty of escape rooms. I don't particularly like ending a story where all questions aren't answered. Some think it's cool to fill the holes with their own imagination, but to me, this usually points to problems in how the story is build. 999 did a good job at explaining most stuff, but not all unfortunately. Another thing that amazed me, is that this game was first a DS game. There is one important warning I have to give: you will have to replay segments again. Not a lot, but still some. It didn't bother me too much.
I think the best way to rate this game, is with a value number: to me, it was worth about 16 €

Second game: Virtue's Last Reward (VLR)
Almost immediately in the game, I got annoyed. Instead of using well-made sprites for characters, you get 3D characters that are too bright and too cheap. They were meant to run on a DS... I had a hard time adapting to this, and was always in the way to take a character serious. The only thing that made we continue playing, was the rabbit. The escape rooms in this game were quite a bit harder than in 999, and had the tendency to overrely on mini-games.
The story of this game is also godawful. It tries to make suspense, but fails in it. The story itself also doesn't show much progress until very late into the game. While 999 does a good job building up everything, this game absolutely fails in it. The last 10 of the 40 hours I spend on this game were suddenly full of story etc. Even worse, the characters show the exact same progress. While in 999 the bracelets and numbered doors were masterfully designed with the story, in VLR it all got conveniently adapted to the plot.
And now, the biggest problem. The flow chart. It is way too large for a game that handles its story so badly. There is way too much repetition, I had to use the skip function while in 999 I didn't. There are way too many "too be continued", making you forget what happened there. Oh, and did I say the story is godawful? Yeah, doesn't make things better. The ending worsened things only. My recommendation: play this for the escape rooms.
Value: 5€

Wait, 16+5 is lower than than the 25 € this is worth? Damn, I should've hit not recommended. But that first game was so good.

I definitely recommend this game if you are interested in the series and like visual novels and puzzles.  I enjoyed the puzzles for the most part, and solved most of them myself (not that they are super difficult), opting in my final gameplay hours to just look up the final puzzle and how to get the bad ending just so I could stop.  I told myself I would push through and finish it but it was TOUGH.  The dialogue drags, with the characters talking about every little action or thing they do and the dreaded (...).  I wish they just had everyone sigh at the same time!!!  It may seem silly that I'm pointing this out but with how many times you have to drudge through the game to get all the endings, it becomes unbearable.  

The pacing leaves some to be desired, the explanations of the many [spoiler]experiments[/spoiler] that have gone on are explained in an extremely elementary way and are much longer than they should be.  Also there should be a better way to fast forward if you are going to have to repeat areas.

The characters are nothing special, the big breasted scantily clad woman is actually very intelligent (wow, really) and there is the larger than life big dude who isn't.  I found myself not caring about the connection between them.  I did enjoy [spoiler] Snake.  I thought he was the only one who was kind of unique and likable, though we could see from a mile away the fact that he had heightened abilities.[/spoiler] 

All in all, I wouldn't not recommend the game, but I wouldn't play it all over a few days like I did.  Try to space it out and enjoy it.  The ending is interesting and I did like how the story ended up even if I didn't enjoy how it got there.

Excellent story and interesting characters. To enjoy fully the several of the endings need experienced. Graphics were quite decent, but not top tier. Puzzles were maybe a bit too easy and it would have been nice to have a few more of the ones, which really give a sense of accomplishment of solving with the "A-HA". The only real minus for me was the background music which became quite tedious after a while (it felt there were like 3-4 BGM circulated throughout none of which was really that good).

Overall rating 8+ so a solid game, that shines with it's interesting story and characters. If you are looking for puzzles or lot of things to do (choices, doing something) rather then reading, then this might not be your game.

This title encompasses the first two games of the Nonary Games trilogy. This got recommend to me plenty of times and now that I have played it I recommend it strongly for anyone out there looking for a story-driven game with puzzle elements.
 Both stories keep you hooked and wanting to play until you are able to see the full picture of each game. With each decision that ask you to make the story is different and new information is told (sometimes it's even for the better to have a pen and paper on your side to take notes of some extremely important things). This information will help you further along on the story development and give you some guidance amidst the confusion that sets in everytime a new storyline is shown. Brace yourselves for a lot of exposition and people talking in great length. But it's all worth it in the end because that makes the story engaging and might even get your mind blown!
Overall great story-telling, fun but at times a little frustrating puzzles (in the sense that they turn out all to be rather simple in essence but overthinking can get in the way and complicate it) and a great gaming experience

I thought I wouldn't enjoy this, as it has both visual novels and Escape Room content and I have my own reasons for not liking those, but damn... I got so into the story, with it's cryptic insanity it had lurking under the sleeves.

If you didn't know, this is a collection of 2 games: 999 being the first game and Virtue's Last Reward being the 2nd. They both have alternate endings with how you proceed the story with your options given to you, and both have great, WTF storytelling. You do however need to get all endings in order to get the true ending and understand what's going on as it can get a bit cryptic with revealing the answers until much later into the games.

Voice acting is phenomenal and all characters have their own personality and are very memorable.
music is fitting with it's weird electronic, glitchy, emotional tunes.
Gameplay wise, If you're not reading through the novel parts, you're in an escape room solving puzzles, tinkering with your brainspace. There isn't really much repetitive gameplay as all rooms are different with it's own creative puzzles. If you get stuck with something, the game will try and help you with some hints.

These are one of those games where if you say too much you'll spoil the experience, so I urge you to go check it out if you can :3

7/10

3未プレイ時点での感想

1.「9時間9人9の扉」
・ストーリー構成が非常に良かった。全体としてのオチはプレイ中は全く予想がつかず、たいへん楽しめた。
・シリーズ通してだが、システムとストーリーの親和性がすごい。うまく考えられていると思った。
・２までで回収しきれていない伏線や、この話必要だったの？ということがいくつかあり、そこは３で回収されるのかどうかに期待。単なるミスリード目的の可能性ありか。
・DSゲームの異色なので、システム的に不便な部分は多々あったが、本家にはDSならではのギミックがあるらしく、可能ならそちらでプレイするべきかと思う。

2.「善人シボウデス」
・ストーリーは変わらず素晴らしかった。最後のどんでん返しのラッシュはどれも予想できず、まじか！と驚くばかりだった。
・システム面は１よりは少し改善されたが、こちらも同じく携帯機からの異色なので不便な部分はまだあった。
・グラフィックは昔のゲームというのもあるが、かなりひどく最初は全く親近感が得られなかった。時間に応じて最後は少し好きになったが。
・シナリオ上仕方ないが、分岐が多すぎで、かつどれも似たような展開になるため、END回収が作業のようになっていた。それぞれの分岐で話をもう少し変動させてほしかった。
・結末は３に持ち越しになるが、２終了！という感じがなく、あ、終わったの？となってしまったので、達成感が少し薄れた。次作に期待。

ダンロン、シュタゲあたりが好きな人には間違いなくはまるので、おすすめ。

Honestly, I don't know why I hadn't thought to play these games earlier. They're right up my alley.
All in all, my vote is [strike]ally[/strike] recommend.

Pros:

- The storyline was wacky, but compelling.
- I found many of the puzzles to be intuitive.
- The animation in 999 is really well-done and communicates character well.
- They don't overdo it with gore for the sake of gore.
- With the branching paths, every major character gets their backstory explored.
- Some of the plot twists are really satisfying.
- Nothing is timed; although the characters may be facing deadlines (literally), you can take as long as you like.

Cons:

- Some of the "jokes" are fat-shaming, homophobic/transphobic, or misogynist. (One exchange in 999 manages to get all three in two lines of dialogue!)
- The dialogue timing in both games and the lip flaps in VLR don't match up. Some lines have weird pauses at the end. (I assume it's unavoidable from the dubbing.)
- Auto advance feels slightly slower than it needs to be.
- The 3D character models in VLR are cartoonish in a way that I feel detracts from the game. The animations don't have nearly the satisfying impact, either. It's clearest when you compare the appearances of the recurring character (999 true ending spoiler) [spoiler]Clover[/spoiler]; 999's version is more emotional and proportional, while VLR's version struggles to clearly emote.
- The UI is different for each game, but both are a little clunky.
- The true ending of one ([spoiler]VLR[/spoiler]) is much less satisfying than the other ([spoiler]999[/spoiler]).
- Some of the plot twists feel like they were pulled out of thin air at the last minute.

Depends on what you want:
- These games talk a [i]lot[/i]. It's less a puzzle game with story segments and more a slow animated movie that occasionally gives you an escape room.
- This series will lecture you, at length, and it can get kinda fake deep. Don't expect the concepts it explains to be properly applied in the story.
- So many puns.

By far the greatest game achieved by mankind. The Nonary Games is one hell of a game, with multiple endings, addicting storyline, massive plot twists, great OST and mechanics never seen before. Having played 999 before on the Nintendo DS, this remake is a solid one, being better with voice acting, but worse, due to it missing the second screen, which has been replaced by ADV and NOVEL mode (which is also an important part of the game, always play on NOVEL). In total, 999 has 6 endings. VLR on the other hand has 22, and was designed with one screen in mind. It also comes with a more advanced system, and a character cast, similarly loveable to those in 999. This game is worth more than it currently is. Get it. You have to. Experience something you have never seen before. Seek the way out.

Genuinely the best video game series of ALL TIME.  I've watched three playthroughs of the entire series and played through the series with my friend recently.  I just wish I could forget this series so I can replay it and experience it for the first time again.

The Nonary Games is the first two games of the Zero Escape series: Nine Hours Nine Persons, Nine Doors (999) and Virtue's Last Reward (VLR). I bought this as a bundle along with Zero Time Dilemma (ZTD). These games are visual novels based around "escape room" puzzle situations.

999 is a great game. Short and sweet with lovable characters. I recommend this just for 999, pretty worth it.

VLR has a lot more fluff and deep pulls but admittedly the overall story was still fun. It had a TON of slow moments though, and a lot of the puzzles were kind of whatever. Some of my initial gripes with VLR exist for story reasons - while I don't think the payoff was worth the gripe, there was a reason for it.

999 is standalone, but VLR retcons some of it and makes it into a series. VLR also leaves room for another game, which I assume is what ZTD is supposed to be.

Okay so I basically played 999 in one sitting, because it caught my attention in a way no other game ever has.
Just for 999 you should grab it in a sale, because in my honest opinion, Virtue's Last Reward isn't really worth it. You have to rewind so, so much in VLR, it just takes forever. It's frankly just not that good, I also don't really like the 3D animated characters compared to the 2D 999 ones.
VLR is still decent, but summa summarum to me, it wasn't worth the time. 
Grab this collection on sale just for 999.

These games have been a WILD ride for me, I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing through them both. I was constantly surprised by plot twists and I loved the learning new information from playing through each different decision. The games are formatted so you can easily go back and play through each of the decisions without needing to constantly making saves at every choice made, which personally made playing through not feel tedious at all. The 'flow diagrams' were very handy to keep track of everything at the same time as well. The characters in each game develop so much that I was constantly going between liking and disliking them until finally finding out all of their stories to tell. The room escape puzzles are incredibly fun, and designed in such a way that you don't have to complete them the long way if you've already been through it before in another route. 

I highly recommend getting Zero Escape: The Nonary Games if you're a fan of games such as Ace Attorney, Danganronpa, or Your Turn To Die.

Its a branching path visual novel that uses escape room puzzles for its mechanics. If you enjoy escape room puzzles i would highly recommend it. The story is convoluted but engaging, I was constantly trying to piece together the mysteries as i played.

999 is actually pretty good. Great art style, good character, decent story and pacing. 

Where as VLR is just complete trash. The 3D character model are ugly AF. The new flowchart is way more repetitive than 999 even if you keep skipping. There are dozens of endings yet most of them are trash that offer little to no reward. The so called twist is so predictable. I hate to compare ZE to Danganronpa. But whether you like Dangonronpa's story or not, you can still have fun playing it. But this is just miserable. The puzzle itself has nothing to do with the plot, unless you believe the bullshit explanation the game offers. The only way VLR tell its story is info dump you for the last two hours. Trust me, the reward definitely does not worth the 20 hour+ slog of a game.

I honestly don't understand why anyone would think VLR is the best of the series.

He jugado a otros survival antes, pero este es a mi parecer uno de los más completos, tanto en historia como en desarrollo del juego. Es un juego muy bien ilustrado, con animaciones bien construidas y giros de argumento a mi parecer inesperados. Sin duda desde el minuto uno se ha convertido en uno de mis juegos favoritos no solo por la historia, sino por los diversos finales que tiene y los puzzles, los cuales son tan distintos que no te da tiempo a mantenerte un minuto tranquilo. Es un juego tan interesante que una vez que te atrapa no te das cuenta de las horas que has invertido en el mismo. En mi opinión es un juego 100% recomendadísimo a todas esas personas que les gusten los survival con puzzles que ponen en constante prueba al jugador, con giros argumentales constantes, intrigas y una variedad infinita de finales y opciones según las decisiones que se tomen o no. 

Tras haber finalizado la primera parte del juego simplemente puedo decir que ha valido cada moneda que me ha costado. La historia está muy bien narrada sin llegar a ser todo diálogo, amenizando con puzzles y con personajes a los que acabas simpatizando. Creo que ahora puedo decir con total seguridad desde mi punto de vista que es uno de mis juegos favoritos y lo seguirá siendo durante mucho tiempo.

Playing 999 for the first time is suspenseful and fun, and VLR adds so much on top of it but imo isn't as impactful of an experience as the first. Most of the twists in the second game are easy to guess because of its connection to the first. Still, it was fun to play through. I've only played a couple hours each of 999 and ZTD. They feel like they were written by, and for, teeny-bopper weeboos. I enjoy older anime (Ninja Scroll, Akira, Vampire Hunter D), but I just couldn't get into these. Just be ready for 15-20 minutes of long, drawn out conversations between the characters that do very little to engage you in the story in between either simplistic escape rooms (999) or just making a single decision (ZTD). I didn't even try VLR, I just jumped from 999 to ZTD to see if it got any better. meh. Refunding.

Oh, and the fact that the characters in 999 immediately mispronounce Nonary (meaning they pronounce it differently from the antagonist, Zero) when they have never before heard of the Nonary Games, or seen the word written, is super annoying,
This trilogy of games has some of the best story elements in them that I have ever experienced. I would highly recommend going in to the experience blind. Well worth it!

This collection has a pair of amazing games. The gameplay section which is just puzzles, are very well done. On the other side the deep story is really amazing. The music sets the tone of the games, kind of repetitive in 999 though. The choice based system is genius and it is a wonder to play throughout the game and choose every possible path. There's a really stupid plot hole in the large hospital room, that leads to a ton of drama, and a chance for people to get all angsty -- and it's a total waste. There's a simple solution to the contrived "problem" that involves both teams using the same door. It's the same solution that would, presumably, get all 8 of them out in the end, but the game won't let you use it. 

Really frustrating, so much artificial drama and pseudo-science. Got this on sale, and still wasted my money. Why make it a maths problem and then ignore obvious solutions? If you wanted to write an angsty drama about "we've got no choice" then at least make the problem unsolvable. #RassinFrassinBadWritingRailroadedGrump

So... I've finally completed my Zero Escape journey. 

What a wild ride! The first game had me hooked, and even though it's kinda hard to get all of the endings of 999 on your own, it's definitely worth it. I fell in love with everything Zero Escape has to offer. The way the story unfolds is AMAZING, and from my perspective it's essential to play these games if you consider yourself a mystery lover.

I see people comparing it to Danganronpa, but I think it's a bit different. Yes, there are bits of 'whodunit' and sometimes you'll make assupmtions about how the pieces of the story will fall into their respective places, yet you should play the entire game (meaning getting all the endings) to finally realise what's actually going on.

The actual escape part of ZE series is always great. I loved-loved-loved different puzzles and head-scratchers, except maybe for the [spoiler]freaking dice[/spoiler] in VLR. 

It's worth it's full price and if you're a 'story first gameplay second' person like me, you'll enjoy it thoroughly.

Welcome to the Nonary Game.
The Zero Escape Trilogy is one of those easily missed gems of video game storytelling. An interesting blend of Visual Novel and Escape Room with a plot that rewards the player for theorizing and trying to piece everything together. A sci-fi mystery story with aspects of horror, mistrust and conspiracy. 999 and VLR quickly became some of my favourite video games and even some of my favourite stories, thanks to their unique storytelling mechanics.
These games might not be perfect, but I recommend them just for the story and interesting aspects how they bring you as part of the narrative, planting you in their protagotanists' shoes. There will be a lot of reading ahead, but with stellar voice acting on the both games, with Japanese and English audio, you'll be able to enjoy the story even more. The graphics might not be perfect, but considering these are port of an DS game and 3DS game, they do their job in admirable manner. I especially found 999's sprite work enduring and affable in its style.
Speaking of the style, this series is full of it. From 999's interesting and evocative location to VLR's chilling and haunting atmosphere. If you are not in the anime, you might not like everything in this, but I'd suggest you even giving it a try, just to see how the story unfolds.
I heartily recommend this game and give it my "Seal of approval" as one of the most unique storylines in gaming.

The Zero Escape series contains the best story I've ever experienced in any medium. It takes full advantage of being a video game to tell its story and play with your expectations in ways I've never seen before or since. It isn't perfect, by any means, but the trilogy leaves no loose ends (although one or two are debateably unsatisfying later on). 

There are two games in "Zero Escape: The Nonary Games," with a third game; "Zero Time Dilemma" rounding out the trilogy.

First is 9 Hours 9 Persons 9 Doors (999). As the title suggests, your character and eight other people are trapped on a ship. They must get through 9 doors to escape or die after their 9 hour time limit passes. This is very important: get multiple endings. Do not just stop when the credits roll the first time. Part of the uniqueness 999 has to offer is slowly giving the player information depending on their choices, and only giving them a whole understanding after multiple playthroughs.

Similarly, Virtue's Last Reward (VLR) also expects many playthroughs for a full understanding of why you and everyone else are trapped here. I highly recommend playing 999 first, as there is a recurring character, as well as the themes are ideas created in the first game being used as a springboard. VLR is a much longer and meatier game as well. Where 999 enjoys being concise and getting information to you quickly, VLR enjoys letting you really feel out the place you are trapped in, and the eight people you share it with. 

Finally, if you got that far and thoroughly enjoyed your time, play Zero Time Dilemma. Many fans see it as the weakest game in the series, but if you enjoy the other two and do not expect it to be exactly the same, go for it! There are many returning characters, and it is a great game in its own right.

One thing to warn about. In every game, there is a token "sexy woman," outfitted with huge breasts that really shouldn't be supported the way they are. On thing to take comfort in, if you're like me and that makes you uncomfortable, is that each of these women are adults, and really have much more to their character than their looks. In fact, I would argue there isn't a single character in all three games without some hidden depth to explore that reformats how you see them. Another to be wary of is gore, but take heart in the fact that every game has a "good" ending where most good people make it out and safe in the end.

All in all, I can't recommend this series enough. The story alone is enough to make it a classic for me, but the clever puzzles and deep character writing really make it impossible for me to not gush about to all my friends all the time.

Possibly the best VN experience I've had so far. If you like VNs, and can dedicate a pretty decent chunk of time to these two games (most of my time played is in VLR), it will reward you for that with an insane story, and some pretty solid puzzles. The only reason why I said pretty solid is because I ended up overthinking some of the solutions to a point where it wasn't intended. 

A word of caution, specifically for VLR. It is a VERY good VN, but the start is very, very slow. I personally started the game and failed to get to a single ending before giving up, and then starting over again a few months or so later. 
Most of the time you see I've played is spent in VLR. 999 took (funnily enough) 9 hours for me to beat, and the save file where i actually finished reading all endings (including all the bad ones) was around 24 hours. 
VLR is a marathon and not a race. Take your time with it and try to read a little bit everyday, even if it seems like things are going nowhere in the story and nothing is getting answered. Eventually all will be revealed.

It is like an onion that just peels off layer after layer to get to the core of, not just the story, but the reason why any of it exists to begin with. [h1]Una novela visual con una historia increíble[/h1]

[i]La saga de zero scape es una novela visual con mecánicas de puzles estilo “scape room”, pero lo que realmente resalta en el juego es su historia de misterio que resulta realmente inmersiva . [/i]

[u] Los Personajes [/u] tienen personalidades muy definidas y bien construidas. Todos son personajes entrañables con una historia que contar y una razón para hacer o ser como son.

[u] La Trama [/u] de ambos juegos es muy profunda e intrincada y con grandes giros argumentales y múltiples finales. Si la historia del primero te parece buena, la del segundo sigue la del primero, pero elevada a la décima potencia. 

[u] Los gráficos [/u] no son muy buenos. Tanto los del uno que están dibujados, como los del 2 que son 3D son realmente toscos y sin duda algo a mejorar. Hay escenas bien dibujadas, pero también hay otras pobres en cuanto a gráficos.

[u] La jugabilidad [/u] como en toda novela visual es escaza, pudiendo únicamente tomar decisiones mayormente de diálogos con clics. La parte de mayor jugabilidad es la de los puzles en donde el juego se transforma en una especie de aventura gráfica donde hay que buscar, agarrar objetos y combinarlos, para formar herramientas para jugar un minijuego y/o desvelar un código con el objetivo de lograr salir de la sala.

[b] Cabe destacar que el “zero scape:999” tienen una durabilidad de alrededor de entre 12 y 15 horas mientras que su secuela el “zero scape: virtues last reward” tiene una durabilidad de entre 45 y 50 horas. [/b]

[i] Aconsejo comprarlo a su precio original, es decir 330$ (argentinos), ya que realmente me parece una buena saga y un juego al que se le pueden sacar muchas horas de juego buenas y relevantes. [/i]

「9時間9人9の扉」を12時間、「善人シボウデス」を18時間程度で完走したレビューになります。

はじめに
このゲームにはZERO ESCAPEシリーズの第一作「9時間9人9の扉」と第二作「善人シボウデス」が同梱されています。
話や設定が繋がっていますので、「9時間9人9の扉」を先にプレイすることをお勧めします。

脱出パート
極めて普通の脱出ゲームです。だがそれがいい。
第一作、第二作を通して不満もなく、納得のいく出来でした。
第一作はかなりユーザフレンドリで、行き詰ったらキャラクターがヒントを出してくれることもあり脱出ゲーム初心者でも答えを見ずに進められると思います。
第二作のほうは少し難しくなっており、ヒント数もおそらく減っています。
ただし理不尽な問題はそうそう無いので、こちらもある程度はスムーズに進行できると思います。
また、特徴として仕掛けを調べたり解いていくごとにキャラクターが掛け合いをして、ちょっとした豆知識な小ボケをかましてくれます。
第二作はこれが少ししつこいかな、とも思いましたが個人差の範疇でしょう。

ADVパート
どちらのタイトルも「ゼロ」と名乗る謎の黒幕により、登場人物は「ノナリーゲーム」という脱出を賭けた駆け引きに参加させられる…という内容となっています。
主役となるキャラクターはそれぞれ９人おり、誰を相棒に選ぶか等でシナリオが分岐します。
つまり、いわゆる一本道でなく、いくつかの選択肢によって枝分かれするマルチエンド形式です。
このゲームを真の意味で楽しむには周回プレイをする必要があるのですが…なんと、ゲーム中にシナリオマップを開けばいつでも好きな分岐地点へと移動することができます。（もちろん一回見た場所しか行けません）
このシステムのおかげでセーブデータを複数持つ必要もなく、二作通してぶっ続けでクリアしてしまいました。
私は複数のエンドを見るのが億劫になってしまうタイプでADVゲームはあまりやってこなかったのですが、このゲームに関してはその心配は無用でした。
いい意味で予想を裏切られる展開の多いシナリオですので、ぜひプレイしていただければと思います。

不満点
一作目に関しては全くありません。
完走してから「つまりどういうことか」を整理するのに少しかかりましたし、設定に粗がないわけではありませんが。
それでも良いと思えるくらいには好きな作品でした。

二作目に関しては一作目の終わり方がよかったこともあって序盤の雰囲気には慣れないものもありましたが、
終盤に行くにつれて期待を大幅に超えていきました。
雰囲気としては一作目のほうが好きですが、納得度は二作目のほうが高い印象です。
ただ、謎のマップ移動演出に関してはあまり褒められたものではないと思います。
あれに意味があれば話は別でしたが、特に何もなく作品全体のテンポを落としただけでした。

総括
買いましょう。
脱出ゲームをやったことない方でも問題なく楽しめます。
買って二作目が終わったころには、三作目の「刻のジレンマ」が欲しくなっていると思います。
私はそうでした。
そして三作目が終わったら他のもあるかな、と「AI＿ソムニウムファイル」をカートに入れてしまうかもしれません。
私です。
このゲームを機に脱出・推理ゲーム沼にハマりましょう！

[h1] The Most Confusing and Awesome Game I've Played In a Long Time [/h1]

The Nonary Games are games that hinge on 9 and the choices made. The story is amazingly well thought out and executed even though it's so complicated. It involves conspiracy, sci-fi and the human condition amongst other things. I feel like the first game's puzzles are more numbers based while Virtue's last reward is more logic based. Either way though they for the most part don't hold your hand at all unless you want them to. So I'd think it's good for any level of skill. I don't want to put too much so I don't spoil it though.

There were no glitches, translation/dialog issues or anything. It ran smooth and was wonderful to stream to my friends while I played. I used my xbox controller the whole time which felt very natural honestly, but for short spurts I'd switch to the keyboard/mouse for one reason or another non game related and the transition was seamless, I loved it. It’s also worth noting that unlike other games with multiple endings they put all the timelines on a flowchart kind of formatted like a family tree. You can use that flow chart to hop around and continue from where you’d like to instead of having to start from the beginning every time. (Which is actually cannon to the story which is cool to tie a mechanic in like that)

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
+Thorough and well thought out story with methodical planning
+Everything is relevant
+The puzzles are intelligent, yet thinking too hard can be your downfall
+Can skip previously read dialogue
+leaves me hungry for the next entry even after putting so much time into these

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
-Recaps can make it feel repetitive in some parts
-Can't skip similar dialogue or recaps since you haven't technically seen it yet
-The story in Virtue's last reward gets pretty extra, almost to soap opera levels and extremely complicated

999: I didn't expect this game to be as good as it was, since it's often overshadowed by VLR, but wow the story of this game is so intricate, well planned and so full of twists and turns you'll be kept second-guessing yourself until the very end. Honestly the number of times I was convinced I figured something out and tried to predict certain things, the game completely subverts those expectations and really makes it so you can't trust anyone. The game has a really great way of giving you so many questions and possible outcomes, yet always manages to give answers that always surprised and impressed me. The escape room gameplay is also quite fun. Overall 8/10, as even though it was super well written, the actual events in the game weren't as stupid crazy (although they were still pretty crazy) as I would've hoped. Hopefully VLR is gonna be even better.

VLR: Holy moly, what a game. I don't know where to start so I'll start with the best part of the game: the number of twists and turns in this story is honestly insane, and each and every one of them I didn't see coming until it was too late. If you thought 999s twists were crazy, VLR is on a whole other level. The game, like 999, has an amazing way of feeding you bits of information to keep you constantly guessing, which at times leaves you with a mountain of ridiculous questions and no answers. This is also a downside of the game, most of the time, each ending only gives you one or two bits of information, often times just leaving you even more confused than before. While this does do a great job of keeping you invested in the mysteries, it offsets that by making a huge chunk of the story feel incredibly slow. In fact, it's only when you get to the last couple endings that questions start being answered. As for the answers themselves, they were seriously crazy, but I felt the actual ending of the story was quite underwhelming, an area in which I thought 999 did better. VLR sets up this amazing premise near the end, where even more questions arise, yet the game just ends like that. Maybe it's just setting up for ZTD and everything is explained there, but I would've liked VLR to have it's own solid ending like in 999. This leads me into the characters, I really loved them in this game, I won't list them all but I will mention how much I loved Phi in this game, however, due to the ending, I never felt like we got any closure on her character and even now she is still such a mystery to me. Maybe this all gets resolved in ZTD but it does dampen VLRs overall experience. One last thing, the escape room gameplay is basically the same as in 999, but perhaps this is just my experience but I always got motion sickness from the camera moving about, the actual puzzles were great though. Overall, I preferred VLR over 999 mostly due to the crazy twists and really good ally/betray system, but felt anticlimactic at the end. 8/10.

I have been playing this game on the original NDS / 3DS releases, and this remake is well done.
Of course, a few dramaturgy aspects were better executed on the original platforms [spoiler] especially the ending on 999 [/spoiler] (for obvious reasons, they were produced for that specific platform).
Nevertheless:
This is one of those games that just consumes your time - you don't want to stop. Even when I replayed it after such a long time, the soundtrack with the great story and characters are just that good. 
You will see the sunrise and question your life choices, but you won't regret playing this game - if you are into visual novels and puzzles, then this game is a MUST PLAY. It's basically the reason why I play visual novels, and I'm eternally grateful for that. 

It's been 9 Years since I first played 999 - and it felt good playing it again.

善人死亡无汉化，啃英文生肉流程近40小时，相较第一部999，善死体量多了不少，9条个人线相同事件有不同的对话彩蛋，且都揭露了部分真相，真结局的时间流程图比较复杂，需要时间消化。
也许是已经玩过了打越的ever17，所以善死里的trick都比较熟悉，通关后没有第一次打通ever17可可线的震撼。极限脱出前两部毫无疑问是悬疑avg里最拔尖的一批，全价一百多绝对不亏，打折只要几十血赚，如果喜欢玩文字avg的务必尝试。

Just like Danganronpa, these two games, tell such interesting stories that most other forms of media can never come close to touching. Spike Chunsoft now might be one of my favorite video game developers of all time, they have a genius team making these games. 999 and Virtue's Last reward both provide amazing soundtracks, that really sink you into the world & story.

999 alone has very little issues, and is damn near perfect. Atmospherically, this game is flawless. The 'true' ending almost had me in tears as you're solving the last puzzle, as you learn the truth of The Nonary Game, and with the track Morphogenetic Sorrow playing in the background made it a whole lot more emotional. The ending to this game was easily one of the most shocking things I've seen in a game, right up there with a lot of Danganronpa moments.

Virtue's Last Reward is amazing too, but with a few issues that really bugged me. The first being forced to watch the animations of Sigma's dumb dot traveling from room to room, with the same door opening animations, it drove me nuts. The game also dragged on for a bit too long, and I felt there was some pointless dialogue here and there. Also, there are specific paths that you must take on the flowchart to get the plot REALLY going, or else you are met with an abrupt ending that leaves you confused. On top of that, the 'true' ending is A LOT to digest, at surface level it may be easy to understand, but the deeper I think about it, the more confused I get. 999's ending was a lot more comprehensible in my opinion. Odd enough, this game strays away from 999's 2d player models, and makes them 3d. Keep in mind this game was originally for the DS, but man the models look incredibly stupid at some points. Lastly, the puzzles in this game are a bit too devious, and make you REALLY go outside the box, but I can't say that they weren't fun. I may look like I trashed on VLR, but in reality I truly did enjoy it, and 100% completed it. 

Easily one of the best VNs out there and I feel it is a must own for any fan of the genre.
I'm excited to see what the last game, Zero Time Dilemma brings to the table.

loop系adv神作，推理比较简单，还有轻微meta要素。
总之如果你喜欢科幻、剧情向游戏，入就对了。

因为是1代+2代合集，所以一起评测了：

+ 打越的剧本真的很牛，作为剧情非常丰富的loop系作品，剧情设定上没什么硬伤，体量很大，玩起来很爽；
+ 游戏系统很棒，一次次死亡没什么挫败感，也不用重复打相同的关卡；
+ Phi真的很可爱( ˘͈ ᵕ ˘͈ )

- 1代的情节设置不是很合理，大量剧情、设定堆积在true end线上，其他线比较单薄，玩起来体验不好；
- 2代几乎没有立绘，全是辣眼睛的3d模型，属于是宣传欺诈了。

本人使用后归纳的常见问题:

1.游戏本体要下日文版还是英文版？
答:建议下日文版，999英文版转中文后无法转回英文,善人死亡仅日文版可用补丁。
2.打补丁后成就为什么不解锁？
答:通关后重过一遍结局就能达成全成就
3.为什么打补丁后无法运行？
答:请确定补丁安装在正确的位置，如仍无法运行可下载模拟器版本游玩，本补丁仅能作用于steam正版
4.为什么汉化后有错字/漏字现象？
答:极限脱出系列文本量大，汉化组人数精力有限难免错字 ，不影响正常游戏
