[h1]Au panthéon du jeu d'aventure japonais... et du jeu d'aventure tout court![/h1]

[i]/i\ Résumé/Points négatifs-positifs en bas![/i]

Cette compilation est un remake PC de 2 jeux DS à l'origine, qui font partis de la [b]trilogie dite "Zero Escape"[/b] ou "The Nonary Games". Trilogie culte mais assez peu connue au japon et outre atlantique... et vu qu'ils n'ont jamais été traduits en Français, complètement inconnue chez nous(en tout cas, j'ai l'impression qu'à part une élite de barbus qui passe son temps à République, ça parle à personne...).

Et hélas, vu que les jeux sont toujours pas traduits dans la langue de Molière et de Jean Roucas, j'ai l'impression qu'ils le resteront, et c'est au delà du regrettable...

Bon, déjà si vous lisez cette review, vous êtes à un pas de la délivrance, c'est bien :).
Mais on va pas se mentir: tout est en anglais/jap, et va falloir un très bon niveau, les Zero Escape sont des jeux textuelles avec une intrigue extrêmement développée et qui partent dans des concepts méta-physique et des délires assez poussés.
Si ça vous a pas découragé alors on va pouvoir rentrer dans les détails:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Premier volume: 999[/h1](pour 9 heures, 9 personnes, 9 portes).

Une sorte de [b]jeu de la mort[/b](type Saw mais rien à voir dans la forme); le jeune Jumpei se réveille dans une cabine d'un cargo, légèrement amnésique. Tout ce dont il se souvient, c'est d'avoir été enlevé chez lui par un étrange individu avec un masque.
Rapidement, Jumpei va découvrir le nom du cerveau derrière cette opération, un psychopathe du nom de "Zéro" et rapidement, il va découvrir que:
-8 autre personnes sont dans la même situation(9 personnes)
-que tous ont un bracelet autour du poignet chacun numérotés de 1 à 9

C'est là que le jeu de la mort créer par Zéro va se dévoiler: les 9 victimes vont devoir coopérer pour sortir de ce labyrinthe.
Il y a deux moyens de se débarrasser de leur bracelet:
-trouver la porte numéro 9
-ou mourir
Si il y a une porte numéro 9, il y a donc des portes numérotées de 1 à 8(9 portes) et leur mécanisme d'ouverture est aussi tordu que machiavélique: chaque porte s'ouvre avec au moins 3 personnes/bracelet sous peu que leur racine numérique corresponde au numéro de la porte.

Explications: les bracelets 1,8 et 3 ont une racine numérique de 
1 + 8 + 3 = 12 => 12 = 1 + 2 = 3...
Donc cette combinaison ouvre la porte 3.

Si par malheur la combinaison est fausse ou si moins de 3 personnes franchissent une porte, et bien les gens vont découvrir qu'ils vont tout simplement explosés!
Oui y a une petite bombe à l'intérieur de chacun, ça rajoute un peu de piment au tout...

Ha oui! Et ils ont tous 9 heures pour sortir de ce merdier, sinon... boom.

Sur ce pitch extrêmement sadique, je vous l'annonce direct: les personnes sur le bateau ne sont pas là par hasard...
J'en dirais pas plus, mais [b]vous n'êtes pas au bout de vos surprises[/b] avec 999(et cette série d'ailleurs!):
-le pitch de base étant ce qu'il est
-le background des personnages étant extrêmement développé
-et comme si ça suffisait pas, le jeu rajoute une couche méta-physique à un scénario déjà complexe...

Comme toute VN, vous allez avoir des embranchements scénaristiques à foison, ce qui va amener moultes fins différentes...
et la grande réussite de 999 et de cette série, c'est que chaque fins vous donnera une clef de l'intrigue, mais jamais son intégralité!
Vous n'aurez la compréhension qu'en regardant la vrai(fin) qui se débloque avec un certains nombres de prérequis.
Certains trouveront çà complètement con en trouvant que ça rajoute inutilement de la durée de vie... mais je peux pas argumenter sans spoiler, donc je vais pas le faire.
Croyez moi: rien n'est fait au hasard dans 999; voyez son histoire comme une toile d'araignée finement tissée sur laquelle vous allez devoir passer sur chaque fils pour arriver au centre.
De toute façon, si vous adhérer au pitch de base, ne vous en faites pas pour çà, la magie va opérer et vous aurez du mal à décrocher.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[u]Gameplay[/u]: on va faire court: une partie Visual Novel + des passages puzzle.
Pour la partie Visual Novel, je note que ce portage est très complet et permet d'avoir plusieurs vitesses de défilement pour les textes(Par clique, Auto et total), et plusieurs modes de lecture(RAS à ce niveau).
Un point important: pas la peine de tout refaire depuis le début pour tout voir: l'intrigue est présentée sous forme d'un arbre, et vous pouvez revenir à un nœud en amont pour prendre une autre direction à tout moment.

[b]Sur la partie puzzle, on est dans un Point&Click simplifié[/b](déplacement, réticule pour identifier les objets, inventaire etc...), vous n'aurez jamais les mêmes, ils sont ni trop difficiles, ni trop faciles... parfois complexes mais toujours logique.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[u]Graphismes[/u]: RAS au niveau des options... évidemment un portage d'un jeu DS, même retravaillé ne va pas mettre votre carte graphique à plat. J'adore le chara design de 999. Le style plus que la technique... j'espère que ça ne vous freinera pas.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Virtue's Last Reward(VLR)[/h1]

Suite directe de 999. Les règles du jeu ont changés(ici on s'inspire du dilemme du prisonnier, bien connu en théorie du jeu), les victimes aussi...
Je vois pas l'intérêt de spoiler plus.
Si vous avez accroché à 999, vous êtes pas au bout de vos surprises pour VLR.

J'aime moins le chara design full 3D de VLR: certains persos sont un peu trop typés japoniais à mon goût... mais ça reste que mon avis^^

La structure reste la même, mais toujours plus de fins différentes, toujours plus de mécaniques supplémentaires dans les puzzles, un scénario toujours aussi tordu etc... bref, inutile de s'étaler, [b]si vous avez été contaminé par 999, le virus continuera pour VLR[/b] et même le troisième opus de la série "Time Dilema" que vous pouvez trouver ici:

http://store.steampowered.com/app/311240/Zero_Escape_Zero_Time_Dilemma/?snr=1_5_9__300
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Seek A Way Out![/h1]

J'étais totalement passer à côté de ce chef d’œuvre. Je me suis sentis un peu con sur le coup, une impression d'être passer à côté de quelque chose à force de perdre de l'intérêt pour le jeu vidéo japonais... mais là, entre çà et « Nier Automata », 2017 est presque une prise de conscience du retard perdu!

[i]Fun fact: la racine numérique de la date de sortie est le 24 Mars... 24/03... 2 + 4 + 3 = 9
Coincidence? Je ne crois pas...[/i]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]

+ un pitch de base diabolique...
+ ... et un des meilleurs scénario de JV ever!
+ plein de fins différentes et toujours l'envie d'en faire une autre...
+ ...donc une bonne durée de vie au final!
+ puzzles intéressants, ni trop durs, ni trop simples
+ Portage PC très complet: LA definitive edition
+ bourré de secrets et de bonus en tout genre
+ doublage anglais vraiment très bon dans les 2 cas(999 comme VLR)

+- pas ouf graphiquement(même si un certain style)

- tout en anglais/jap et bon niveau nécessaire!
- Extrêmement bavard, et des fois pour pas grand chose.

999 is a masterpiece.
VLR is great.
Buy it, buy 10 copies of it, make 10 steam accounts and play through it on all of them. It's that amazing.

虽然是三月末的游戏，但是因为一些事情还是拖到了现在才通关，发一下安利

[h1]简介[/h1]
Zero Escape（极限逃脱）: The Nonary Games包含ZE的前两作Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (999)和Virtue’s Last Reward (VLR)，虽然登陆比第三作要晚，但实际上是前作……游戏方式可以分为密室逃脱部分和视觉小说部分，游戏特色是必须打通多个结局来达到真结局TE。因为两个作品都是同样类型的，以下分点评价一下。

[h1]特点[/h1]
[h1]画质 [i]6/10[/i][/h1]
毕竟是掌机移植，可以想象效果很有限，其中999是立绘高清化，简单说是没有很大问题（但不是没有问题）。而VLR是……把3D模型放大了？评测也随处可见对VLR的移植吐槽，当初做3DS版不知道是省画师的钱还是想突出3DS的机能做成了3D场景角色，移植到大荧幕可以说是……很挫。[spoiler]直接导致我Luna酱的头发看上去是细节全无的一团不明物体[/spoiler]。但这毕竟是个剧情向游戏就不要计较了

[h1]音乐 [i]6.5/10[/i][/h1]
适当的悬疑感和紧张感，不过没有什么突出的地方，2作大部分沿用前作。

[h1]解谜 [i]7.5/10（999） 8.5/10（VLR）[/i][/h1]
解谜部分，这个游戏只有密室解谜，我接触密室解谜最早是在4399（拨号上网的童年），我想不到还会有一个剧情向游戏由头到尾都是由密室解谜组成的，个人觉得在999中的解谜其实都比较简单，而在VLR中的密室谜题无论是量上还是质上都有提升，而且还有可选难度和额外题（金银文档），不过也不会非常难，肯花时间全通hard没多大问题。
值得一说的是，这些谜题跟剧情其实没多大关系，所以这是纯粹的解谜，然后解谜奖励是推进剧情，所以不喜欢密室解谜的玩家，可能会觉得这样的设计很打乱剧情节奏……（想起了雷顿，不过雷顿更加纯粹……）

[h1]+CV[/h1]
DS的999是没有CV的，这次加上了，好评好评。CV阵容也不错

[h1]+角色描写[/h1]
个人比较喜欢的角色是四叶（999）和Luna（VLR），而至于两作女主角，毫不客气的说，给人感觉更像个跟在主角身边的花瓶和聊天对象……但这并不意味我不喜欢这两个角色，只是给人印象反而没有前面两位更让人印象深刻。VLR里面因为不同角色都有各自的结局，给人的印象也更加丰满一点。

[h1]+Flow[/h1]
太方便了，方便到让人觉得在开挂。[spoiler]想想好像也没什么错[/spoiler]

[h1]·剧情评价[strike]吐槽[/strike][/h1]
毫无疑问，这个游戏的长处确实是剧情。不过玩过ever17的话其实对这个剧情模式会有一定的熟悉感吧，同时为了解释这个剧情模式，给玩家灌输了一大堆科学普及（这个过程很无聊，但是游戏里面很多，在2里面尤其多[spoiler]可以说是越吹越大的结果[/spoiler]）。同时为了给这些科普对白腾空间，让人相对觉得剧情部分弱了。

同时由于VLR的故事（30小时±）大概有999（18小时±）的两倍长度，所以游玩VLR的玩家假如也不是对密室解谜很感兴趣的话，容易在中后期感到疲倦，因为不同ending实际上没有给出很多有用的信息，很多只是铺垫。然后在最后的TE中给出大部分解答[strike]以及烦人科普[/strike]，个人在游玩的前期觉得VLR的剧本在质上确实有所上升，但是同时量的上升导致消耗了玩家的耐心，最后的结局也感觉不如999.不过一样是没完没了，续作骗钱。

这两个作品在游戏（指剧情里面的游戏）方式上很有意思，像999的数字根和VLR里面的AB房，但是这个游戏要求的不断重复也消耗了玩家的新鲜感。后期大多数都是为了选择不同的选项而选择，并不是什么真的思考背叛问题。


当然可圈可点的地方也有很多，ZE作为一个多结局AVG，在不同结局的衔接比较流畅，悬疑气氛也保持得不错，个别的角色给我留下了深刻的印象，情节也给我带来了不少的思考，我认为这就足够了。
[h1][i]8.5/10[/i][/h1]（结果吐槽了半天还是给高分吗！）

[h1]总评[/h1]
ZE:TNG有着悬疑游戏里独树一帜的风格，假如你喜欢密室解谜和带有科幻色彩的悬疑故事，这款游戏一定能够满足你。价格也不贵，一份游戏的价格，双份游戏的快乐（我投降别打我
[h1]推荐程度：[i]8.5/10[/i][/h1]

[h1]一些注意[/h1]
1、虽然这个游戏有悬疑也有解谜，甚至有命案，但是跟推理关系不大，至少并不是你在推理，你只是在选走什么路线和负责密室解谜，而已。所以想扮演侦探尤其是本格派的就不要玩这个游戏了。
2、金文档除了一些neta出处完全没用，但为了全成就还是得打出来……
3、剧情涉及超自然现象……

[h1]推荐人群[/h1]
剧情向玩家、轻度科幻爱好者、打越粉丝、悬疑故事爱好者、密室解谜爱好者、日式VN爱好者、壕+1

[h1]不推荐人群[/h1]
重复剧情不耐受玩家、文字不耐受玩家、外貌协会玩家、反超自然玩家

Культовая серия визуальных новелл тире адвенчур наконец-то в полном составе вышла на ПК!
The Nonary Games включила в себя первые две игры: римейк Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (ака 999) и слегка улучшенный порт Virtue’s Last Reward (в основном просто баги поправили).

[h1]Сюжет[/h1]

Спойлерить не буду, просто скажу в общих словах. Игры серии Zero Escape славятся своей мрачностью, замысловатостью сюжета и неожиданными развязками. За что их часто сравнивают c фильмами из серии Пила (Saw). Вы и ещё 8 таких же "счастливчиков" оказываетесь в смертельной ловушке, выбраться из которой можно только решая хитроумные головоломки. Кто вас похитил? Для чего? И что тут, чёрт возьми, происходит? Чтобы ответить на эти вопросы одного прохождения недостаточно. У игр несколько концовок и чтобы узнать всю правду вы должны получить их все.

[h1]Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors[/h1]

999 пришла к нам в сильно изменённом виде:

- Графика. Графика не просто получила более высокое разрешение, задние планы были дорисованы (а местами и перерисованы) до широкого формата. Не улучшились разве что трёхмерные модели подбираемых предметов (их можно разглядывать со всех сторон), но это на самом деле мелочь.

- Озвучка. В оригинальной версии озвучки не было, но для римейка авторы озвучили всех персонажей, не озвученными остались только реплики во время решения головоломок.

- Сюжетное дерево. Одной из неприятных особенностей оригинальной игры была невозможность быстро пропустить все ранее прочитанные диалоги. В римейке же есть не только кнопка пропуска уже прочитанного, но и появилась возможность прыгать по сюжетному дереву в нужную вам точку.

- Одноэкранность. Оригинальная версия делалась под двухэкранную консоль, и в полной мере использовала эту фичу. Для ПК же было найдено простое, но элегантное решение - нам дали возможность прыгать между ADV и NOVEL экранами. В NOVEL мы получаем больше информации за счёт "слов автора", а ADV экран даёт нам более разговорный формат, ну и в нём, собственно, решаются все головоломки. Иногда игра принудительно перекидывает нас из одного экрана в другой.

- Головоломки. В основном головоломки остались теми же, но парочку из них всё-таки заменили. Видимо, в целях адаптации под ПК. Кстати, одной из новинок римейка стал встроенный калькулятор. Большинство головоломок в игре завязаны на математику, так что он может пригодиться.

[h1]Virtue’s Last Reward[/h1]

Игра практически в неизменном виде перекочевала к нам с PS Vita. Так что сравнивать с ней нет смысла, но можно сравнить с 999:

- Модели персонажей. Герои теперь не спрайтовые, а трёхмерные, а вместо плоских задников теперь полноценные трёхмерные комнаты. Графика, конечно, выглядит устаревшей, но выглядит игра вполне симпатично.

- Озвучка. Как и римейк 999, игра практически полностью озвучена. Неозвученными остались реплики во время решения головоломок и главный герой. Вместо этого он "попискивает" как в изначальной версии 999.

- Сюжетное дерево. Собственно, такое дерево впервые появилось именно в этой игре и потом перекочевало в римейк 999. Оно вообще является довольно заметной фишкой в игре, так как для продвижения по сценарию вам периодически придётся перепрыгивать в другие ветки.

- Головоломки. В VLR головоломки стали более разнообразными и более сложными. Вместо калькулятора нам в этот раз выдали прозрачный "планшет", на котором можно рисовать и делать пометки. Очень, надо сказать, полезная штука - сильно упрощает решение некоторых головоломок. Кроме того на нём же можно записывать всякие пароли.

[h1]Кому будут интересны эти игры?[/h1]

Игры стоят на грани между визуальными новеллами и адвенчурами, но в первую очередь они будут интересны любителям визуальных новелл. Если вы не знакомы с жанром, но вам нравятся игры в духе The Walking Dead от Telltale, то вам стоит попробовать. Игры достаточно похожи. Если же вы просто любите решать головоломки, но не любите читать, то эти игры вам, скорее всего, не понравятся. Вы просто замучаетесь листать/пропускать тонны текста.

买两个剧情超棒的科幻小说还附赠密室逃脱游戏还不快买！？

如果你是科幻小说爱好者，极限脱出必玩。
如果你是平行世界理论爱好者，极限脱出必玩。
如果你是命运轮回类剧情爱好者，极限脱出必玩。
如果你是AVG爱好者，极限脱出必玩。
如果你是密室逃脱类型游戏爱好者，极限脱出必玩。
如果你喜欢体验各种游戏，极限脱出作为AVG类型和密室脱出类型中的佼佼者，必玩！

如果你准备入极限脱出的坑，强烈建议你要从第一代开始玩起，不要看任何PV，以及任何剧情攻略，在查故事流程的时候也要时刻注意，一不小心就会被剧透得干干净净。[strike] 对，我说的就是零时困境的PV[/strike] 

===

这款「极限脱出·九人游戏」包含了极限脱出系列第一代作品「9人9时间9扇门」和第二代作品「善人死亡」的高清重置版。
从游戏系统本身来看，999是重制了贴图，加入了配音,加入了流程图机能；善人死亡基本上是把原本的东西搬到了PC上而已。剧情部分两作都一样，展现任务立绘对话；解密部分，999固定视角，其实就是只绘制了那几张贴图，善人死亡的密室是三维建模的，部分固定视角，大多数时候玩家都可以自由操纵视角。
从解密难度看，善人死亡难度大于999，善人死亡的密室数量也大于999，总体来讲极限脱出的解密是非常值得一玩的，用心程度大于很多密室游戏。

但是，密室部分只是极限脱出系列的附赠小点心而已，剧情才是极限脱出值得安利的部分。
首先难得的是，极限脱出在剧情和系统上没有原始bug，比如上古卷轴你走到哪儿客栈都一个价，还有那种世界都快毁灭了某个NPC非要你去帮他做件事他才把关键道具给你，或是一些密室逃脱游戏莫名其妙开始莫名其妙结束，主角为啥跑到密室去了完全不交代。极限脱出你一开始也许也会觉得设定莫名其妙，为啥九个人要被关起来，为啥要带个腕表等等，不过之后一本正经胡说八道的剧情都可以把你的疑惑圆回来。
极限脱出的剧情完美配合游戏过程，因为剧情和设定的缘故，主角需要来回于不同世界线不停穿越（在999中不明显，在善人死亡与3作零时困境中被用烂，莫名其妙自己就被锁剧情，叫你去其他世界线寻找关键线索，通关之后又惊叹设定的超神），不停地做出艰难抉择，加上999在NDS上利用NDS机身特点做出来的一个惊天剧情设定，善人死亡又针对的游戏机的视角所采用的叙事诡计，都使得极限脱出的剧情职能在游戏中才能展现，在电影和小说中，都无法体验极限脱出剧情所带来的震撼。
极限脱出的剧情是联系非常紧密的，这也是为什么我在之前强烈建议新入坑玩家一定按照顺序来玩的原因。看见九人游戏的宣传图，你有没有两作里貌似都有同一个人？对，TA就是[spoiler]四叶[/spoiler]，而二作也有三个人会加入到三作的剧情，而有一个人，竟从一作出现到三作。当系列全通关，零时困境最终的结局曲响起的时候，我真心叹服系列剧情联系紧密，逻辑通顺，又为剧情中展现的跨越一百多年的命运轮回而无奈叹息。

然而就是这么优秀的游戏，当初却陷入叫好不叫座的困局，之前的制作公司chunsoft还陷入财务困难，跟spike合并形成新的spike chunsoft公司，三作零时困境都是在粉丝强烈请愿和资助下才得以面世。所以，希望玩家们不要因为觉得只是个AVG不值这么多钱或是没有中文而去玩盗版，买一个正版让制作人和公司能够带来更好的新作吧！

999/999

I wrote this review after playing the entirely of both 999 and VLR.

A hallmark of excellence, Zero Escape: The Nonary Games is a bundle which includes the remastered edition of Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (2009) and a port of Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward (2012).

Both game feature the same gameplay features: It is split into two gameplay parts known as Escape the room puzzles and Novel sections. 

The escape the room puzzles put you in an enclosed area where you have to look for clues and solve puzzles etc. to find your way out of the room. These are of course important elements of the story which you are required to solve to continue the story.

Which brings me to the next gameplay element of the game: The novel sections. 999 and VLR presents them in visual novel, where characters will appear on screen as they tell the story, with dialogue included. 

The unique story-telling is what absorbed me into the storyline, which took me around 18 hours to complete 999 and about 35 hours to complete VLR. You will hear people telling you to play these two games 999 and VLR before Zero Time Dilemma because you will be spoiled by the story that is told in Zero Time Dilemma. 

This happened to me before so when the games were released i was compelled to play them to fully understand the entire story of the Zero Escape series.

That aside, i strongly recommend this game to anyone who wishes to experience a unique way of story-telling.

Like good puzzles that require you to think out of the box? Buy this game.
Like a good story and varied well developed characters? Buy this game.
Like both? Then this might also be your next best game ever.

방탈출+사운드노벨 형식의 게임입니다.
제가 가장 좋아하는 게임 중 하나인데, 이번 노나리 게임즈와 제로타임딜레마 두 게임을 하시면 극한탈출 트릴로지를 즐기실 수 있습니다.진짜 갓겜인데 뭐가 갓겜이냐면 스포일러입니다 하지만 정말 갓겜입니다...

Played 999 on the Ds just before this came out. Didn't play it in this pack, but the game is phenomonal - the best in the series. Amazing plot with a slow reveal that remains unbeaten to this day from anything I have experienced.

As for Virtues last Reward, it's also pretty great. The central characters are more enjoyable and engaging than they are in 999, but the overall story is worse, albiet still very intriguing. The puzzles are fun, though they do drag on a bit towards the end. Rather than play through the entire game 3-4 times, you have more than ten endings, but you can swap to certain points along each timeline whenever you want. This sounds good, but then you realise that many of the endings are far less substantial than they are in 999.

Overall, this is worth getting for the story, even if you don't like puzzles. Amazing as a visual novel, good as a video game.

Zero Escape: The Nonary Games Review. 
Zero Escape: The Nonary Games is a game that is part of a three game series that includes 3 games Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (999) and its sequel, Virtues Last Reward (VLR) and finally Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma.  
1  you get two games remastered for PC for the price of one you get Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (999) and Virtues Last Reward (VLR) for 50$ the PC port of this game is great I have had no real issues getting the game to run and it ran beautifully for me. The game is not graphically demanding but I suggest having high sound quality because the game will take advantage of that as the game sounds amazing. 
2  the story of this game is amazing, this game is not one that you want to have spoiled for you and fortunately the story is quite complex so it is difficult to spoil entirely. This game truly pushes the limits of what video game stories can do and yes choices do matter in this game. 
3 the soundtrack, the sound effects, the voice acting in many languages and the music direction in this game is amazing. This is one of those games that I would not only suggest you buy but you should buy it with the soundtrack. The music can truly scare you at times make you feel anger sadness and many other emotions. 
4 the gameplay is an escape the room puzzle game but at the same time a adventure visual novel. You will make multiple choices that matter then you will be stuck in a room and you must solve difficult puzzles to escape. If you do not like puzzles or you find them too hard VLR has a easy setting and hard setting for the puzzles while 999 does not. The puzzles are very difficult and I do not suggest solving them unless you have an education in various things.
5 a few mechanics are a bit of a bother such as the flow chart, redoing the puzzles and a few unskippable cutscenes and once you finish all the routes in the game and once you finish with the story there is little replay value but you do get many hours worth of content for two games. 
To Conclude VLR is the best in the Nonary games series and for that game alone it is well worth 50$ but you also get 999 VLR remastered and you can get a soundtrack for that much. That is well worth the price. I would only suggest not getting the game if you hate games with more story than gameplay, you don't like puzzle games and your not interesting in something new. I would suggest this game to someone looking for a brand new video game, someone who cares about story, and someone who just wants an amazing soundtrack.   
Do I recommend you get this game? Yes absolutely VLR alone is one of my favorite games.

I love this game, It has a really interesting story with really great plot twists. This is not a new Zero Escape game it's a remake of the first 2 games in the series (999 and Virtue's last reward) I recommend if you wanna get into the series start from this game if you didn't got the chance to play either of the 2 games on DS. Some things they improved in this remake is the graphics and they added voice acting to 999 Japanese and English and in VLR for the players in europe added English voice acting, They also added a flowchart in 999 which you can use to jump to any point in the story instead of having to replay the game again and again to get all the endings.

Zero Escape: the Nonary Games is a 2-for-1 type of set that includes the first two games in the Zero Escape series (999 and Virtue's Last Reward). I have played both games to 100% completion, and I will give each game their own review. Now, on to the review.

999 REVIEW: In this game, you play as Junpei, a man who wakes up on a ship with 8 other people and together they discover they are going to be playing a terrible game. A mysterious person named Zero is forcing them to get through 9 doors within 9 hours. If they don't, the ship will sink and they will die. There are more complications but it's best if you learn how the "game" for the characters works. A major things I enjoyed about this game were the puzzles and the mystery. To learn more about the mysterious things going on, you had to get through the puzzles in the rooms you search. The puzzles are fairly easy, some of them make you really think on how to do them and some are quite difficult. Another thing about the game is that to experience it at its fullest, you have to play through it repeatively to get through different endings and to learn different storylines. Thankfully, there is a flowchart in-game so you can move through the scenes you've already played and there's a text-skip option as well.
I found this game very rewarding and very addictive. I kept playing the week I bought it and I now have almost 24 hours worth of gameplay. And I haven't even started the second game yet. I can't wait to see how VLR connects to 999.
If anything, I thought the save function was a little confusing. At one point, I had accidentally started over, which deleted all of my data and my flow chart was resetted so I had to start over. So that part sucked. I also felt like the ending to 999 was a bit vague in some details and I wish they would have elaberated a bit.
Other than that, I quite enjoyed this game and definitely think it goes to my top list of my favorite Visual Novel/Story-Rich games.

VIRTUE'S LAST REWARD REVIEW (note: I won't go too into depth of the game's mechanics as it's quite similar to the mechanics of 999): In this game - which is the sequel to 999 - you play as Sigma, a man that wakes up in a creepy warehouse type building. Instead of being alone, he is in a room with a woman he doesn't know. They soon find out that they aren't alone, and they're forced to play a game. Similar to 999, it's still the "Nonary Game" (a game of the number 9) as they need to escape through the number 9 door. But this is a bit different, as they will have to betray each other to escape. I won't spoil the how as it's fun to learn as you play.
When I first started playing VLR, I wasn't sure if I would like it because of the noticible differences between it and 999. VLR has 3-D modeled characters which looked kinda creepy at first sight, and the character you play as (Sigma) doesn't have voice-over. He is the only character that lacks voice acting, which was disappointing.
But as I played, I began to like it a lot - possibly just as much or even more than 999. I started to connect with the characters quickly, and the story was intriguing to me. Also I can't help but love the voice of Zero Jr, a AI rabbit that speaks to the characters and tells them their tasks. All of these elements makes this an excellent sequel to the original game I loved.
While I haven't finished all of the possible routes in VLR, I can say that this game is an incredible experience and a sastifying mystery, and I can't wait to finish all the routes and learn more of the mystery.

I hate reading, but the story is sooooooooo engaging and amazing, I've stayed up late at night just to find out more and more. If you love single player games and an amazing story, this is definitely for you!

As a fanatic of intricate mystery plots, both 999 and Virtue's Last Reward are masterpieces of interactive storytelling in my mind. 

999 is a non-stop thrill ride with insane twists and turns that amount to a complete mindfuck that really takes a while to absorb and warrants a second playthrough. Characters are a major strength. The voice acting ranges from good to fantastic and the art is pretty good for this type of game. The puzzles are decent, but not that great.

VLR tones down some of the tension and takes a bit longer to develop, but manages to tell a grand tale that encompasses so many elements it's unbeliavable how well it all comes together. It takes the mindscrew of 999 and multiplies it by threefold. The voice acting is good, but the character models and animations are slightly underwhelming. Still doesn't detract from the stellar writing and fantastic puzzles though.

DUUH.

Ok, as you might or might not know this is actually two games for a price of one. Both games are quite old and one of them was released in 2009 which makes it ancient by modern standards. So it is a remake, and in case of 999 it is actually a remake of a remake which fixed a lot of stuff compared to the DS.

I was never a fan of VN genre and my attempts to play some of the games that are considered as 'the best' (like Saya no uta or Ever 17) never succeeded mostly due to how fucling mindbogglingly BORING the whole process was. In case of Ever 17, as I recall, in first 10 hours game did not even manage to introduce all of the characters. What is this I don't even.

Now I know the games are amazing and you spend sleepless nights playing them, yada yada, nobody fucling cares, this is review from VN hater for VN haters who are wondering if the game would be right for them. Well, yes and no.

--- 999 ---

I used to play 999 on DS because everybody around me could not shut up how OH MY GOD FUCLING GREAT AND AMAZING this game was, and it was a mixed experience. As I understand it was one of the first developer attempts into VN.

999 is a part VN, part adventure game. VN part is not very long, it has maybe 2 or 3 forks and three endings. Every ending would take you about a hour, maybe two. I love how short it is. A proper VN should never be more than 10 hours long, top. 

What is really good is that it has so called "Adventure Mode" that cuts all of the useless SHIT. Adventure mode is a blast. Some fanboys would scream that you should not play this mode because it does not have a proper CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT and STORY DETAILS, and you know what, I played original 999 and I can certainly say that absolutely zero value was lost.

As for the character development and story, well it certainly can impress you if you, well, have never watched a single movie or read a book, I dunno. The only good thing I can say about the story is that it does not suck. I guess the bar was really set low if this achievement can really impress anyone.

Some of the complains I have are mostly related to pacing, I don't like how puzzle sequences go after one another, I would prefer them to be splited by story sequence. Also all bad endings are waaay rushed. You barely started to follow story and BAM you are dead, game over.

--- VLR ---

Just when the things are starting to look good, VLR comes.
I hate every second of VLR. First of all, it is way to long. 30 hour is an overkill. Especially given that the game has like 20 minute of actual content and the rest is filled with usual VN fillers and shit. You can literally cut off 99% of the game and it would be THE SAME FUCLING STORY.

The puzzles are really bad compared to 999. They are so boring and unimaginative that at some point I just gave up and went to gamefaqs only to not waste my time on 100500th number puzzle. The characters were a joke. There were maybe a couple of barely developed characters and the rest of the cast was a cardboard fest. The funniest part is that two of 999 characters were completely OOC, especially Clover.  I found that characters that had the least info and dialog actually turned to be the most interesting just because authors have no clue how to write a proper character background.

Writing was awful. If you want a good writing go play Planescape Tornment. VLR writing felt like a bad Sonic fanfic written by 7 y old.

Apparently this game has a sequel called ZTD that is generally considered to be worse than VLR. Seriously. Worse.
VLR was so bad that I refunded ZTD just to avoid 30 more hours of this holocaust of wasted time.

So, no, this is not a good game to introduce you to the VN genre. This is not a good game, well 999 kinda is, but I don't think bundled VLR will  justify the purchase.

You should play this game if you want...
...A choose-your-own-adventure mystery visual novel
...An exceptionally well-architected game where every little thing has HUGE significance in the overarching story
...Escape the room puzzles
...A game that is relaxing and thought-provoking, and doesn't require a lot of mechanical skill

You should NOT play this game if you want...

...Something innocent (there are some pretty hardcore innuendos, and mild gore)

As of now, I've played about 80% of the way through 999, which is one of the two games in this bundle. I started with Zero Time Dilemma, which is possibly even better, but it's a sequel, so I'd suggest starting with these.

amazing story, bogged down by escape puzzles that kill the pacing, there was also almost no graphical upgrade from the DS version, so some of the textures are bad, and I'm not a fan of the art design.

EDIT: I started playing VLR, and it is much better than 999. I'd still wait for a 50% sale though.

EDIT 2: It's been a few years, and I've completely changed my mind on it. I now think it's one of the best games of all time. The story is still amazing, with some of the best twists, reveals, and concepts I've ever seen in a video game. The graphics are a bit cringe in places, especially with the ROUGH 3d models of VLR, but it has a unique style and AMAZING sense of atmosphere that masterfully toes the line between a thriller and horror. I redid the puzzles, and my problem was that I was approaching it in a bad mindset of trying to rush through them to get to the next section. If you slow yourself down and really appreciate it, you'll find some really fun and creative puzzles. It's all in all one of the best VNs/puzzle games of all time and I highly recommend it.
999 is pretty good, VLR is great.

Let me just say this is one of the best games I've ever played. It's incredibly story-rich, with many incredible plot twists and well developed, complex characters. The puzzles are fun, engaging and challenging. Being a fan of the original 999, this port with added voice acting was pretty great in my opinion. Of course, it depends on the person wether you like the voice acting or not, or if you feel like it will break the immersion. For me, though, it was super amazing hearing all my favorite characters in 999 get fully voiced and it helped add something new to the experience. The fact that this game is essentially TWO games in one is also nothing to complain about, because let me tell you - after finishing the first one you'll immediatley want to start the next.
Overall would definitley reccomend!

First things first. This is actually two games: 999 and its sequel "Virtue's Last Reward". It does not include the third game "Zero Time Dilemma". Also keep in mind that atm this is only a review of 999 as I haven't started the sequel yet.

REVIEW OF 999
___________
The characters are fairly well written and no two are really same. The game entertains in two ways. The first is puzzle solving, and the second is mystery. Solving puzzles give you little hints that slowly start to add up. However you cannot solve the mystery in the game with a single playthrough. The game has a total of 6 endings, and each are important to see if you want to get a full idea of what is really going on.

All that said though, if you are not a fan of visual novels with some puzzle solving and mystery inbetween, then you will probably not like these games.

REVIEW OF VIRTUE'S LAST REWARD
________________________

An amazing continuation of the original games story. I've been a hardcore gamer for as long as I can remember, and can say with confidence that these games are the best I have ever played. Even for visual novels, very few games go into the level of depth and mystery that this series offers. 

VLR takes everything from the first game and improves upon it. It does however, have one problem. Unlike 999, which is in 2D, VLR is in 3D. And since the game was originally meant for the DS... it's 3D is ugly and off putting, at least at first. Once you get past the animation though and get a few hours into it, the story will have you so wrapped up that it won't even matter.

This has one of my favorite science-fiction stories in any medium period. The first two games in this series are absolute masterpieces and the third and final entry was only not as good in comparison to the hype that surrounded it. I love the way that the puzzles and the story integrate with the whole experience. Some of the puzzles even requiered me to get out a pen and pencil which I haven't had to do in a long time. And yet, each puzzle was contained to the room you found it, so you always knew the answer was right around the corner. The flow chart added to 999 fixes the biggest problem with the original game which was having to replay it from the beginning. VLR looks great and plays great and has the same story as before. All around a fantastic package with great puzzles and a great story. Would highly recommend.

Görsel romanlarla içli dışlı olan herkesin bildiği bir yapım/seri diyebilirim. Yıllar önce de oynamıştım ki şimdi de nostalji olsun diye oynuyorum. MUH-TE-ŞEM!

Sizi ters köşe yapacak bir ton senaryoyla dolu bu iki oyun aynı zamanda çok ilginç karakterleri de içeriyor. Görsel romanların en güçlü tarafları hikaye ve karakterleridir ki Zero Escape serisi bu iki noktada çok güçlü diyebilirim. Üstüne iki oyun da sizi o kapana kısılmışlık atmosferine öyle bir sokuyor ki bazı arkadaşlarımın 3-4. defa oynadıklarında dahi aynı duyguları hissettiğini biliyorum.

Fazla bir şey yazarsam spoiler olacak ki spoiler vermemeliyim. Harika karakterler, harika hikayeler, bazen gerçek olduğunu düşüneceğiniz harika sözdebilim kullanımı ve saatlerce eğlence. Flow sistemi ise harika olmuş. Oyunu tekrar tekrar oynamanız gerek zira ve sizin en büyük yardımcınız o olacak. Yalnız İngilizce'ye hakim değilseniz almayın. Dil şart.

Ve kısa bir not olarak lütfen oyunlar sırasında her şeyi akışına bırakmak yerine teoriler üretip bazı şeyler hakkında düşünmeye çalışın. Hakkı verilmesi gereken bir seri.

Memento mori if the nineth lion ate the sun.

Morphogenetic field theory----形态形成场理论，该理论是由一个叫谢尔德雷克的人提出来的。整个极限脱出三部曲都建立在这个理论基础之上，可以说没有这个理论，就没有极限脱出这个游戏。
       但是，该理论貌似在现实生活中并不被看好，网上关于该理论的资料很少，还有人说其是伪科学。
       出于兴趣，我开始想要具体了解该理论的原理，于是我搜素了关于该理论提出者谢尔德雷克的相关资料，结果发现他还专门写了一本关于该理论的书，而且于2004年在中国出版（虽然现在已经绝版了）。书名叫《生命新科学：形态发生场假说》，我几番查找，最终找到了该书的PDF电子版。虽然书里面有大量生物化学知识，对我来说真是艰涩难懂，但我要坚持读完，这也算对作者的尊重吧。
       最后，说一下我的想法吧。就算这个理论是伪科学，就算这个理论跟我们主流的科学理论不符，但这不能成为我们否定它的理由。任何一个理论，从被提出到被证明，都是一个漫长的过程，谁也不能保证形态形成场理论就是错的，也许只是还没有有效的证明方法，毕竟这个世界还有很多很多我们无法用现有的科学理论解释的现象。就算这个理论是错的也没关系，起码它给了游戏制作人一丝灵感，让我们玩到了那么精彩的游戏；它也给了我们一丝遐想的空间，让我们能够感受到这个世界是多么的神奇、美妙和浪漫。
       顺便附上该书的电子版百度云链接，感兴趣的话可以下载下来观看:
       http://pan.baidu.com/s/1o8I1Q5O，提取码：dqtq
说实话，当年入DS版就是为了测试神游DSi锁不锁区，没想到竟被这游戏吸引了。

I was a little hesitant to pick this up when I saw the price, but I do not regret it at all. It is absolutely worth the full price.

I had already previously played 999 on the DS before, but replaying it was great. They added a new voice acting that's actually good and the timeline feature present in the two sequels which makes it a lot easier to see all the endings. There was quite a bit of content I had not realized I skipped over in my original playthrough. My one complaint is the "novel" and "adventure" modes. The novel mode is all the dialogue and narration in text form that covers up the character's faces. It's not pretty. The adventure mode is better laid out with the text box at the bottom, but then you miss out on the excellent narration and inner dialogue of the main character. For that reason alone, I recommend playing through with the ugly novel mode. It's still an excellent game regardless.

As for Virtue's Last Reward, I had actually never played it before. I don't own a 3DS or Vita so I couldn't get my hands on it. For this reason, I skipped over it and played Zero Time Dilemma, the third in the series, when it released on PC. Unfortunately for me, that spoiled a lot of major plot points in VLR. However, I'm about 23 hours into VLR and still not nearly finished. It has left a great impression on me so far and I can definitely see now why most fans claim it to be the best in the series and why VLR felt a little lackluster in comparison. Personally, I prefer ZTD's presentation more despite its stiff animation simply because it doesn't use the typical visual novel layout with characters overlaid in front of a background and went more with a Telltale-style presentation. VLR definitely has a better story though and is a much longer game. The puzzles are very mind-bending, almost as much as the story itself. If you like escape the room games, you'll love the gameplay that is present in the entire series.

Don't let the visual novel presentation stop you from enjoying one of the best sci-fi stories ever written. This isn't a cringey dating sim like you see flooding the Steam marketplace. This is an extremely engaging story from start to finish that will always leave you on the edge of your seat wanting more.

This is actually two games: 999 and Virtue's Last Reward. Both are visual novels punctuated with escape-the-room sequences.

The story in both of these games is absolutely incredible. They are easily among the best visual novels ever made.

999 has recieved English and Japanese voice acting, making this quite possibly the best version of the game. VLR already had it, but it's here too. 999 has also recieved some quality of life updates from future titles as well.

A truly amazing game. Buy it. Play it. Contemplate what mistakes you made in your life that led you to waiting this long to play them.
Wonderful port, wonderful games.

They're pretty good visual novel/puzzle games. First game looks a bit strange brought to a high resolution (It was originally on the DS) and the lip synching doesn't look great, but the flowchart is a welcome addition. The new voice acting is of roughly the same quality of ZE3, which is good for the most part. The story of the first is stronger then the one in the second, but the second has better puzzles and a more sensibly organized flow chart.

A very memorable set of games that are worth the money if you're into visual novels.

Premetto che è il mio videogioco preferito sin dal 2012 (e probabilmente potrei dire che è anche il mio romanzo preferito). Ho atteso con ansia il porting per Steam e mi ci sono fiondato subito. Be', che dire, ottima l'aggiunta del doppiaggio (le voci giapponesi sono buone, per alcuni personaggi mi sarei aspettato timbri un po' diversi ma la qualità va benissimo). Vedere le schermate a questa risoluzione è una gioia per gli occhi, l'aggiunta della flowchart anche in 999 ci voleva.

C'è stato un cambiamento rispetto all'originale che francamente non ho capito e che mi ha fatto abbastanza storcere il naso. Si tratta del [spoiler]puzzle finale. Non è più un Sudoku, che ci stava perfettamente nel contesto, ma di una roba strana e insipida che non ha a che fare col numero 9 e non è neanche interessante di per sé, per cui proprio non capisco.[/spoiler].

Per tutta la durata del primo non ho sperimentato crash o altri problemi. Il secondo capitolo mi ha procurato un crash a un paio di minuti dall'inizio, riprovando è andato tutto bene, spero non si ripeterà.

Per chi non ha mai giocato a 999 né i seguiti, cosa si può dire di questo gioco? È difficile parlarne senza fare spoiler ma rendendo giustizia ai temi del gioco. L'incipit è già interessante di per sé: nove persone in una nave che sembra in tutto e per tutto il Titanic, un misterioso gioco mortale a cui partecipare, il concetto delle radici digitali e dei braccialetti e le porte numerate... ma poi la storia diventa esponenzialmente più intricata, fino a scoprire perché ogni singola persona è lì a partecipare a quel gioco, chi è Zero, e via dicendo.

Se siete persone molto cerebrali e amate le storie con una grossa dose di "mindfuck" sapientemente costruite (e non vi dà fastidio il fatto che il gioco consista quasi esclusivamente di testo), allora la saga Zero Escape fa per voi. Ci sono una serie di temi lungo i tre capitoli, ben sviluppati, che possono catturare l'attenzione. Purtroppo a seconda della sensibilità di ciascuno potrebbero essere considerati spoiler, perché il fatto stesso che siano temi rilevanti è una scoperta che viene fatta in gioco e che sorprende e cambia le carte in tavola. Per chi non avesse problemi a riguardo, provo a scriverne alcuni, a "basso" e poi ad "alto" livello di spoiler, secondo la mia sensibilità personale. Leggete a vostro rischio e pericolo. Mescolo indifferentemente i tre capitoli della saga.

TEMI A BASSO CONTENUTO DI SPOILER:

[spoiler]Paradosso di Teseo, parapsicologia, teorie sul rapporto corpo-mente, dilemma del prigioniero, problema di monty hall, paradosso della bella addormentata, teoria dei giochi, intelligenza artificiale, leggi della robotica di Asimov.[/spoiler]

TEMI AD ALTO CONTENUTO DI SPOILER:

[spoiler]Interpretazione a molti mondi e di Copenhagen della meccanica quantistica, gatto di Schroedinger, paradossi temporali, teoria dei campi morfogenetici.[/spoiler]

Complessivamente il primo capitolo (999) è più breve e compatto. Ha 6 finali e volendo non ha bisogno dei seguiti, si può considerare una storia che si chiude lì, in cui ogni elemento è sapientemente incastrato senza sbavature per raccontare una vicenda parecchio intrigante. Rigiocandolo mi sono reso conto di una serie di dettagli per cui il lavoro che c'è dietro per far combaciare una notevole serie di dettagli matematici (relativamente al numero di ciascun braccialetto dei personaggi) è impressionante. È tutto al suo posto, ogni "ingranaggio" contribuisce al disegno generale.

Il secondo capitolo (Virtue's Last Reward) è più lungo, ha 24 finali anche se molti di questi sono dei semplici bad ending senza particolari risvolti di trama. Qui la qualità della colonna sonora e del doppiaggio secondo me schizzano alle stelle, oltre ad esserci molte scene toccanti (e a tutt'oggi ogni volta che ascolto il brano "Blue Bird Lamentation" mi viene la pelle d'oca). Col 3D dei poveri anziché il 2D invece credo si sia fatto un passo indietro, non c'era bisogno di cambiare se doveva essere fatto così. Se vi piace la teoria dei giochi vi farà impazzire, credo sia l'unico esempio nel panorama videoludico a implementare il dilemma del prigioniero nel gameplay stesso e in modo così coinvolgente. La storia è molto più cervellotica e contorta rispetto al primo capitolo, e anche alla fine quando tutto viene svelato si deve fare un certo sforzo mentale per seguire i passaggi (comunque ineccepibili).

Il terzo capitolo (Zero Time Dilemma) non è incluso in questo pacchetto. Ci tenevo a citarlo giusto per dire che credo perda un po' rispetto ai primi due, oltre ad avere un colpo di scena così grottesco e sbagliato da diventare quasi geniale. Comunque rimane una buona chiusura della trilogia, pur lasciando più questioni aperte di quante ne chiuda introduce altri temi cervellotici fighissimi uno dietro l'altro.

i've followed this series for a long time and have played every adaption of this game thus far-- for DS, iOS, and now steam. in its original format, this game was already a 10/10 in my book-- the storyline, characters, pacing, twists, and ending are near flawless! there's a lot i could say about that, but i'll leave it at that-- those aspects remain the same in steam. this story is riveting and told perfectly.

the steam adaption is another story. it was very good in most regards-- the voice actors were chosen appropriately, performed well, and some of the voice actors that fell flat in the sequel games fared much better in 999. most of the game translates very well to this format.

however... the adventure/novel mode isn't a perfect adaption of the twist from the DS version, and can be rather clunky at times. you often have to choose between seeing all of the screen and seeing all of the narration. most of the time, this isn't that big of an issue, but more of a nuisance. the flowchart is kind of confusing and attempting to use it properly led to me getting the same ending 7 times in a row despite trying to choose the correct doors. again, minor annoyance, but annoyance nonetheless.

the biggest failure is how the final puzzle is adapted, in my opinion-- it's confusing, not thematically appropriate, rather obscure, and it completely removes one of the most iconic parts of the original game. rather than sitting down for a pleasant, completely nerve-wracking game of sudoku, i pressed "hint" about twenty times without knowing what it was talking about until it basically gave me the answer-- one that was rather gimmicky, and relied more on that gimmick than on the puzzle rules it was attempting to explain. i then did the exact same thing on the next screen-- more frustrated guessing.

the puzzle is really the only huge drawback, and for new fans, it may not even be a bother. but it was pretty much the only major issue i had with an otherwise impressive steam adaption.

I have played through both 999 and Virtues Last Reward which are contained in this Remastered Edition on their original platforms the Nintendo DS and 3DS respectively and I have tested the remastered version thoroughly to see if the ports are good. And I can confirm they are, the remastering, added voice acting and the improvements to the graphics and gameplay are all excellent.

I recommend this game to you if you enjoyed Danganronpa, Ace Attorney, Steins;Gate or any other visual novel, as well as if you're a fan of complex intricate sci-fi mystery movies about supernatural phenomena or into trhillers about people being locked up and forced to play a game (Saw movies for example).

Other than that I wholly recommend these games to two groups of people:
1. People who enjoy adventure games with difficult puzzles and/or fans of room escape games (real or virtual) since the main gameplay portion of these games consists of a large variety of creative and engangingly complex room escape puzzles which piece by piece also reveal pieces of the narrative.
2. Fans of dark science fiction mystery stories. Not only limitied to anime fans or to visual novel fans but everyone who can see themselves enjoying a celebral emotional and dark experience. The story is amazing in these games and since it makes up more than 50% of the time playing the game it better be. This is one of the most fascinating gamestories I have ever witnessed. 

But if you are neither one of the two groups, I still would dare you to at least look into it a bit, since it can not be overstated how great these games are. They are hidden gems. 

These games are much more than it seems on surface level. While playing you continuosly switch between novel sections and escape room section. While the novel sections consist of voice acted dialogue with the memorable cast and progresses the main chunk of the story the escape rooms are fully controlled by yourself wile you find clues and items and try to find the exit out of the room which mostly involves intricate puzzle solving and whole bunch of flexing your brain muscles. Sometimes you will find interesting information or items that relate to the main story during these escape room sessions.

One of the main appeals of the game is deciding where to go or what to do which will significantly impact your story. The game has multiple endings and in order to get the full story you need to try to get them all and sooner or later you will uncover the truth. Helping with this is the addition of a timeline-tree on which you can jump around between the different decisions, this was added in this remastered version for 999 (and has always been there for VLR). 

This game will be one of the most engaging, emotional and suspenseful experiences you can hope for in a story, as you struggle together with the amazing other characters that are trapped alongside you and try to escape the nonary games.
I don't know what else to say, this game is just great.

Was ensnared in a death trap with two other people, and if we didn't escape soon we would die an awful death.

Spent twenty minutes listening to an interesting story about the history of chemistry instead.

9/9 would risk life for trivia again.

Well, what can I say that has not been said yet? Pretty much nothing. It's 999 9 Hours 9 Persons 9 Doors + Virtue's Last Reward ported over to Steam \ PC at a decent resolution and with flowchart for both, english and japanese voice acting with really good quality in both compartments, and overall a faithful recreation of old assets where needed.
As a big fan of the series I wholeheartedly encourage newcomers to try it and see for themselves why this is one of the best stories told in videogames and easily a contender for one of the most underrated series of all time.

The only negatives I could think about are 2:

1 - Resolution of the sprites in 999. Really, no excuses there. They have to patch them in some way, at 1920x1080 the scaled edges are unbearable to look at sometimes.

2 - 999's final puzzle. Again, there was no excuse to not include the original in some form. I was pretty disappointed by that choice, but ultimately I can live with that.

The rest is top quality. Buy without fear.

A cualquiera que le gusten las aventuras, novelas visuales, puzzles o el misterio no debería dejar de probarlas.

Definitely pleased with the quality of this port. 999 and VLR are two of my all time favorite games.

On your first playthrough, go through it blind. Then I recommend looking up a flowchart that tells you the path to the end. Other than that, do NOT look anything to do with the game up. Don't spoil anything as they have some of the best stories I've ever seen in a game.

They've fixed 999 up greatly, giving it a flowchart and allowing you to jump between segments fixes 99% of the problems in the original.

Voices seem good enough, if maybe a bit different than I always imagined them.

The adventure mode seems to speed things up a bit text wise if you go with adventure mode over novel mode. Definitely nice for a second playthrough, however I think it loses a bit of power for new players who don't go with novel mode and don't get some of the descriptions of whats happening.

All in all definitely worth a buy!

999 and VLR has finally been ported here on Steam.

[b][u]About 999:[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]English & japanese voices can now be heard.
[*]The background is indeed been remade in 3D.
[*]Answers can somethimes be funny based on your decision.
[*]It'll get somethimes boring to read when characters are talking too long about [i]certain[/i] topics.
[/list]

[b][u]About VLR:[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]English voices can now be heard in Europe.
[*]New characters and old characters are meeting each other.
[*]New mastermind.
[*]Puzzles are interesting and it really requires you to think a lot in a logical way like 999.
[*]It got a [b]'new feature'[/b] called [spoiler]AB (Ambidex) Game[/spoiler].
[*]New bracelet design.
[*]Characters will react based on your decision.
[*]Soundtracks are making this game even more exciting.
[/list]

[b][u]Conclusion:[/u][/b]
It's an awesome mystery visual novel which requires a player to decide a lot. 
What I dislike a bit is in the puzzle mode is that the camera is only [i]panning[/i] around if player wants to move in 999. 
The price is reasonable since it's been combined into [b]a[/b] game.
I also have that feeling that the developers haven't give us all the OSTs but wether it was done on purpose is in my opinion unknown.

This game plays as a visual novel and an "escape the room" puzzle and has a very interesting plot (Go into this game without knowing anything about it).

While it has multiple endings, getting them doesn't take as long as the first playthrough since you can freely choose where to start from via the Flow menu.

Good port, though the game was originally made for handhelds so the graphics are definitely lacking (especially in Virtue's Last Reward which used somewhat below-average 3d models instead of pixel art).

999 is one of the best experiences in Visual Novels out there and Virtue's Last Reward is really damn close to that (arguably even better).
This pack is a perfect entry point to newcomers of the Visual Novel genre and the games are amongst the best titles available on PC (in this genre). 
I won't go into details about the story, because you're really supposed to go in blind. Just be aware that this is something special.
Also, the value for roughly 60 hours (999 + VLR) of gameplay is actually great. You should be picking this up.

[h1] 如果拯救自己的代价是牺牲另一个平行世界的你，这就算是真的是拯救了“你”了吗	[/h1]

[h1]  这不是单纯的密室逃脱，这是买小说送密室逃脱小游戏 x2	[/h1]

游戏一发售就好不犹豫补车票了，这个价格真的不贵[strike] 虽然本质上是冷饭 [/strike]

从重制上的素质来说，诚意一般般吧。善死虽然不再是马赛克，但建模的水平还是和零时差不多[strike] 不过零时的人物拳师脸瘫，善死不是[/strike]。999当时第一次玩的时候是惊艳的，美工太棒，优美的2D贴图弥补了当时nds机能上的缺陷。但移植到PC版后还是有缺点，镜头模式还是没有改动，其实把镜头模式改成零时的在密室中会更灵活。999镜头转动还是像以前一样只是单纯的一格一格的移动。说实话在PC上这个操作确实挺糟心的，给人感觉不够自由。

给没有听说过这款游戏的萌新解释一下
999 = 九人九小时九扇门
善死 = 善人死亡
零时 = 零时困境

游玩顺序：999→善死→零时
时间线顺序：999→零时→善死

[b] 在强调一点虽然剧情才是主体！密室逃脱部分只是锦上添花。[/b]

Okay, now that I finished VLR, let's totally update the review.

[h1]  TL;DR : [/h1] 

Lacking as a portage, for 42€ you'd expect nearly a remake. But the games are lenghty ( ~50h in total ) and these stories are ones of the best I have ever played, if not the best ( And trust me, I played a lot of games in my life, I got 253 other games in my steam library alone. ), so if you like great scenarios, it's worth the full price.

[b]Cons[/b] :
- VLR doesn't looks improved, you can see a lot of low-res texture in the environment.
- Expensive, the games are becoming old. You'd expect more improvements for 42€, nearly a remake.

[b]Pros[/b] :
+ 999 and VLR on PC, finally !
+++ Added voice acting for both 999 and VLR, which is a big thing, this stuff requires a looot of work. The quality of the acting may sounds inequal depending on the characters though.
+ New interface for 999, improved sprites, a flowchart.
+++ Greath Length ( 50h+ )
+++++ AMAZING. STORY. It has everything, it's complex, well-written, has plottwists, is a thriller... 
This is the point and quality of this game. 

--> [b]If you like excellent stories, jump on it. Otherwise, you should probably looks for something else than a Visual Novel.[/b] <--

[h1]  Full review : [/h1] 

As a portage, the game is lacking, while playing VLR, you really feel that it's a game imported from 3DS, blurry/low res textures, the environement may seems a bit empty ( but it fit the atmosphere though ), overall, it may even feel ugly. 
The nice points are that both 999 and VLR are finally available on Steam, thay they both have English/Japanese voice acting, and 999 has several improvement on its interfaces and sprites. It's decent, but it definitively feels too expensive for 42€ for games released 5 and 8 years ago, at this price, you would nearly expect a remake !

But, because there is a but, this is a blue review after all, and now that I finished VLR, I can say that this is was worth every cent.
The two games are visual novels. Expect a lot of text, a lot of reading, so, the games are quite lengthy. Took me 30 hours to finish VLR, and if I remember well 999 took around 20/25h. So, for this price, you get quite a lot of content.
And then, the story, the fucking story. This is the only thing you should care about if you plan to buy it, because when get into the story, the graphics doesn't matter at all anymore.
I played 999 on emulator quite a while ago, and waited for this portage to finally play VLR. Back then, 999 already blew my mind, because the scenario was so incredible, and excellent. The premise may looks like Saw for some ( People trapped in a weird place forced to play a sick game ), but it's not a horror game at all. See it as a tense thriller. I can't really talk much about the story, because I believe that the less you know about it, the more you enjoy it. 
VLR is the sequel of 999, so avoid as much as you can to play it before finishing 999, to avoid any spoiler. I just finished the game and in term of story-telling, it's a masterpiece. It tooks everything that 999 did, and pushed it a step further. The story is written in such way that you couldn't correctly tale it if it wasn't a video game ! They really did an amazing work.

I'd like to tale you why this is so good, why you might like or not the scenario, but it would require me to spoil, so, if you like complex and well-written stories, thriller and plottwist, being mindblowed, amazing scenarios... Go for it.

Oh, I forgot to mention puzzles, there is a lot of puzzles in these games, some kind of Point'n'click escape room. It's nice, the difficulty is not too hard so don't worry about being stuck. I'm not really talking about it because there isn't much to say and I got only eyes for the story right now.

[h1]极限脱出：9个人9小时9扇门[/h1]
无需多言，堪称NDS平台密室逃脱神作，相信有NDS的即使没玩过999应该也听说过。
PC版相对原版的改动：[b]除解谜流程外全程语音（声优阵容强大）[/b]、人物有了动画、优化了操作方式、添加了2代引入的剧情Flow系统（可以清楚看到剧情分支，并可以直接跳转到相应剧情阶段，为了打出所有结局不用一遍遍的重开了）。
唯一的缺点估计是因为不是双屏了，所以很重要的那个梗不知道最后打算怎么体现……

[h1]极限脱出ADV：善人死亡[/h1]
由于仅限3DS平台所以玩过的可能要少一些，基本上PC版就是3DS的移植而已，没有太大的改动。很可惜没裸眼3D了 XD

结合第三部《极限脱出：零时困境》(Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma)，密室逃脱脑洞三部曲在PC端完美结束，系列死忠（尤其是用烧录卡或者模拟器玩1/2的……）请考虑原价买票上车。

喜欢VN和密室逃脱的可以等等打折，目前一起买有点小贵。
Welcome to the game that will f*ck your head harder than a tank

针对移植：

[h1]999：[/h1]
增加了flowchart，好评，刷结局的时候用不着再把之前的部分全部重玩一遍了。且flowchart对不同结局的达成方式有所提示，妈妈再也不用担心我一直被刀了！

增加了ADV模式与小说模式切换，微妙。小说模式与DS版一致，使用第三人称叙述，包括对不同人物表情动作及周边环境的描述。ADV模式只是单纯把人物对话提取了出来，删掉了大量描述性信息，导致有些地方转接非常生硬，且某些无法删除描述性信息的段落会强制切换到小说模式。我觉得既然你要做ADV模式也上心一点好吧……

谜题及演出方式的变化，因为原版利用了DS的双屏机能，有些演出方式非常特别，移植到PC之后必然无法实现，所以改变某些演出也是没办法的事情，这也间接影响了演出效果。且最终谜题从数独改成了一个非常奇怪的东西，打完之后一脸懵逼，完全评价不能……

立绘，分辨率比DS版高不少，但是不如iOS版精细，据说是为了照顾Vita版所以素材使用了Vita的分辨率。♥♥♥♥ Vita

新结局，并没有什么新结局。iOS版还有新结局呢，虽然是个不怎么样的BE，所以也没所谓吧……而且真要加新结局感觉也不就只能加BE了嘛 233

So... The Nonary Games. 

Aksys and Spike have done a fine job getting these to us, in one of the best port-jobs I've ever seen. The critter with the biggest changes, of course, is 9 hours, 9 Persons, 9 Doors. Not as much for Virtue's Last Reward, but there have been some updates there as well. 

First, 999: Gone is the split-screen interface that nearly no one paid attention to except for the last puzzle. 999 has been re-engineered for VLR's interface with 999's artwork, and it looks fantastic. More to the point, we now see little bits of animation here and there where it simply wasn't possible in the alloted space on the NDS cartridge. Same of the single save slot, which has been expanded by the Power of Proper Computers to 30, and the inclusion of voice acting during Novel sections. They also cleaned up the script to make it flow better, and so a solid re-entry all the way around. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cm2LrwkpumQ

Then, Virtue's Last Reward... What can I say here? Seeing Zero Jr. in all his rabbit-y glory on a screen that's not 5.5" was a treat all by itself. The same 30 slots for saves, and again cleanup, some limited remodeling and re-animating of characters makes this port of the Vita edition a thing of great beauty. The controls didn't transfer as well, but that's what I get for being a mousey-keyboard semi-purist. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=owUpakFpd7w

Finally, some other bits before I go. Spike did us a solid bringing these games back in this fashion, so if you like the games, then show your support. They even added the much-needed timeline into 999, which I'm sure was no small feat. I'm  giving this a recommend, not because fanboy (although I am guilty as charged), but because Spike Chunsoft delivered on two games that would have been much cheaper consigned to the rubbish bin of video game history. 

Is it worth $45 US? I think so, but then I tend to go looking for games like this. If you're a hardcore CoD/Battlefield/Sports gamer, then this might not your cuppa tea. Your mileage may vary. 

What will come of this series after this? Likely nothing, as there are no more games planned. That said, I can maybe see where there might be space for some demented puzzle game down the "good" line traipsing away from Zero Time Dilemma...

我已经不想再用重复的语言来描述这两部作品的剧情设计有多么强大了。

如果你对于科幻、悬疑、惊悚等作品有兴趣，那么这部作品是你绝对不可错过的（贴吧可以找到汉化补丁）。
如果你偏爱解谜游戏，那么需要提醒你一句，这部游戏的解密部分占据时间其实不算多，大部分时间是和电子小说一样过剧情，请事先考虑你是否能接受这种形式（何况第二部的人物建模实在是……），不过我还是相信你会喜欢这个系列的剧情的。
如果你在此之前玩过打越钢太郎的成名作Infinite三部曲（其实ever17就够了），那么你可能会有点失望，因为这个系列挪用了不少Infinite系列（主要是ever17）的设定，当然本作类似于《电锯惊魂》的游戏形式和氛围还是然这两个系列有着明显区分的。

最后，因为刚刚通关《善人死亡》，忍不住想再说说其中我比较喜欢的一个角色Luna。（涉及剧透）


[spoiler] 我想对于多数人来说，Luna这一机器人的经历和结局相比较于其他角色结局，是最让人唏嘘不已的。不知道打越在塑造这个角色时，是否参考了当年的茜崎空。当然让我印象深刻的除此以外，还有两个细节：
一是Luna结局对应的Steam成就名称：Tears in the rain，一个大家都听说过的名句。
二是Luna所遵守的原则，我个人倾向于打越在这里处理得不算太严谨。按照阿西莫夫《我，机器人》的诠释，第一原则是凌驾于另外两个原则之上的。这样一来，Luna当初面对茜“放任其他人死亡”的命令时，她的第一反应应当是断然拒绝。然而，游戏的SECRET中提及了第零原则，如果我们结合第零原则所出现的《机器人与帝国》剧情来看的话，那么剧情就解释通了。在这本书的结尾，机器人吉斯卡在最终时刻自发地觉醒了第零原则，选择放任地球的毁灭，从而让地球人能够更快地进入太空殖民时代。从而诠释出第零原则的含义：为了全人类的存亡，有时不得不违背第一原则，牺牲少数人的生命。然而领悟这一原则的代价却是吉斯卡自己的生命，最终只能让丹尼尔继承自己的能力与遗志。这么一看，Luna的行为应当是参考了《机器人与帝国》的吉斯卡，也就不难理解“016完美地遵循了第零原则”这句话了。 [/spoiler]

Very slick port and worth the wait, full 1080p, full voiceacting with quality Jap dub available (999 used to have no dubs at all), controls very well with mouse and keyboard (well just mouse mostly, like any PC native VN).

And of course, the underlying story, gripping and thrilling throughout.
I've played 999 a long time ago with an emulator, so I had no interest in revisiting it after knowing some key spoilers.
However, even just playing VLR for a few hours was worth the money. I must say this game truly truly does the 'choice and consequence' concept justice, by a simple application of the prisoner dilemma, this game presents the most painful choices I have ever faced in a video game before. There were some times where it physically hurted to click a button, because of how well written the characters and story was.

第一时间就入手了，打越钢太郎的名字就是质量的保证，还用多说什么？
另外，任何在评论里（已经或将要）剧透的人，都给我死妈。

Pros
+High Quality Port
+3 great Story if you get this  Zero Escape Trilogy
+Adventure and Novel Mode option available
+Variety Of Choices that add depth to the story progression
+Great voice acting for 999
+3 great mysteries with plenty of clever twists(zero escape trilogy)
+Story is just as mind-blowing and well-written 
+Decent 3D sprites and intricate levels
+Great puzzles
+Great plot twists, puzzling story, interesting characters

Cons
-Voice acting in 999 is hit-or-miss.
-animations don’t hold up that well on 999 side of story
-odd sounding voices
- choices have no effect and random puzzle difficulty
-Dated Graphic(might not meet everyone expectation,
-small touch up on 999 which is a port from nintendo DS

Conclusion
Zero Escape Trilogy is a really solid compilation that do offer  great visual novel experience on PC . although the animation look a bit dated in 999, and upping the resolution on PC certainly didn’t reduce the roughness of their looks on the Background.999 is an  an old game, however, so that’s probably to be expected. Sprite and Artwork are all gorgeous and crisp although the only downside that i can find on pc version is it is not even a FULL HD remake on the background and some part of animation.
I was a huge fan of the Nintendo DS title 9 Hours, 9 Persons, 9 Doors, so I naturally picked this Zero Escape Trilogy(pc) when I was able to(for collection purpose). Virtue's Last Reward delivers more of the same escape the room-based gameplay that was so awesome in the previous installment, and definitely delivers on that part. However, I couldn't help but feel that the plot that was tied into these puzzles was weaker this time around. Perhaps it was the author's desire to create a trilogy out of the series that led to Virtue's Last Reward being a less impactful installment.
While Virtue's Last Reward is an interesting, mind bending game that will keep you guessing until the very end, it suffers from issues with the setting and writing that make most of the game very slow paced. 
the series still boasts one of the most engaging and well-written stories in visual novel genre and for and newcomers who didn’t get a chance to play them on the 3DS or Vita would be remiss to pass it up now.

Verdict: 4.5/5 
[ 999 and Virtue’s Last Reward aren’t the most graphically impressive games around, but the series still boasts one of the most engaging and well-written stories.The Nonary Games does provide dual audio tracks though, so you could always swap to Japanese voices if you’d like. The Flowchart could potentially spoil the experience by revealing the game’s flow and how many possible outcomes you can get from a decision, especially for newcomers.

The Only problem i can found in this game is the choices mainly becomes an issue when you keep switching branches and are forced to play through nearly the same things over and over again.

The soundtrack was composed of Shinji Hosoe and consists of ambient electronic music. It does a good job of setting a tense scene, though there are no standout or truly memorable tracks.]

(note:I have already play both game on new 3DS/DS so this review is just for reference purpose)

Play 999 on an actual DS because this 'port' does not do it any justice, in fact it ruins what is one of the greatst uses of hardware for story telling in video games. I cant believe how badly handled this was. I cant say more with out spoiling a truly great piece of story telling, if you know what im talking about you have no reason to play this, if you dont know what im talking about go grab the game on DS and experience it properly.

[h1] 毫无疑问，《极限脱出》系列是打越钢太郎自《Ever17》后的又一巅峰。[/h1]

相比《Ever17》冗长的日常描写和大量的铺垫，《极限脱出999》的故事更加紧凑，情节更加扣人心弦，仿佛一部悬疑大片。

这次STEAM高清重制版可以说是诚意满满，不仅画面高清化，而且还为一代角色追加了人物配音，代入感更为强烈，不仅适合新人入坑，也为老玩家重温游戏增添了动力。价格并不高（这可是一代二代合集但是只卖一部的价钱！），还附赠原声带（超赞！推荐曲目见附录），喜欢密室逃脱类AVG和日式文字冒险游戏的朋友不用犹豫，买买买就对了。

《极限脱出》系列是主打剧情的密室逃脱类AVG作品，对于此类游戏，剧透是大忌。因此，对于剧情，在此不多做赘述。一句话:[h1] 打越的剧本，不会让你失望。[/h1]

值得一提的是，此合集只包含一代和二代，三代之前已经在STEAM发售，传送门：[url=store.steampowered.com/app/311240] 《极限脱出3:零时困境》[/url]（如果决定游玩此作品，强烈建议同时购入3代）

关于文字冒险类游戏的正确打开方式：很多人认为看一段文字和静止的画面，鼠标左键点一点，这也能算游戏？但是，单论游戏游玩后给人的震撼，以及恍然大悟的感觉，往往只有文字冒险游戏能够做到，这也是由其视觉小说的本身所决定的。完美的叙诡（即叙述性诡计）单凭小说就能实现，但是只有配上场景和人物画面，才能给读者（即玩家）最强烈的代入感和最大的冲击，也就成为了一种游戏形式，即文字冒险。因此，在游玩此类游戏时，将自己代入游戏角色并去尝试理解剧情，你将会获得最完整和最深刻的游戏体验（[spoiler]而且“荧屏前的‘你’”有可能真的是游戏里的一员[/spoiler]）

关于汉化：由于该系列原一代二代作品都没有在PC平台发售，所以现在只能在NDS和3DS平台上玩到汉化版（NDS版可用PC模拟），不过NDS版和3DS版的汉化也均为民间汉化组制作，因此PC版的汉化应该会很快推出，坐等就好XD（其实英文版也能啃）

推荐人群：打越粉丝，喜欢文字冒险游戏的玩家，喜欢深究悬疑剧情的玩家以及[spoiler]关注人类和宇宙命运的玩家（滑稽）[/spoiler]

附录：
[h1]由资深玩家“闰土炮（忧虑）”特别推荐原声带曲目：《Blue Bird Lamentation》[/h1]
笔者喜欢的曲目：《9years》《9hours 9persons 9doors》
Totally worth the full price, just buy it !

This is a difficult review to write because I'm absolutely in love with these two games and have been ever since I first played them many years ago.

The problem is not that the games are bad, but that the ports are very shoddy, making the high asking price hard to justify. There has been very little polish put in here. The most notable addition, the new voice track in 999, has such terrible voice acting that you'll soon be searching for the option to mute it. The options themselves are oddly divided between a very primitive launcher and a game menu that is only accessible during the starting screen. 

999 has been somewhat rewritten to accommodate the lack of a 2nd screen, where you used to have a more traditional narrative taking place. It has been replaced by "adventure mode", where characters now speak their largely expositional thoughts out loud, giving way to clunky, unnatural dialogue (which is then made worse by the poor voice acting). There is a "novel mode" more closely resembling the VN format of the original, but the game likes to change between it and the adventure mode randomly, with seemingly no way to set it permanently on novel. Novel mode is also not a perfect carbon copy of the original, with much of the new clunky dialogue carrying over from adventure mode. The background CG has notably been reworked (or higher quality assets were retained) giving the game a nice visual facelift, but that is the only thing there is to gain here. They are still prerendered and the quality is less than native 1080p renderings, so it will not look good the higher you set your resolution.

As for VLR, while the dialogue and narrative stay very true to the original, this also applies to the visuals. Most of UI elements appear to be ripped directly from the 3DS game, with a mix of very low resolution pixelated menu items. Textures and animations remain completely untouched, and while this level of detail worked wonderfully on a 240p screen, at higher resolutions it resembles an N64 emulator being run at 4K. No one ever intended these assets to be viewed at such high resolutions, and much of the immersion is broken by having such a clear view of how simple everything is.

If you're a fan of the series, there is absolutely nothing to see here. You already have the definitive versions of the games to play somewhere else.

If on the other hand, you have yet to experience these games and just can't find a 3DS to borrow, then this is a low quality port of an unforgettable journey. Please don't miss it, but you might want to wait for a sale. And run it in a small window.

Сия игра является переизданием 999 и VLR ,а если быть точнее, то просто портом с 3DS и PSV соответственно. Ролики в 999 идут в 360p, спрайты страшноватые, но завезли сглаживание, в обоих играх есть выбор озвучки (японская и английская на выбор), чем PSV версия VLR похвастать не могла . Из неприятных моментов стоит отметить, что при полноэкранном режиме игра при сворачивании отказывается разворачиваться обратно. Что же касается самих игр, то они представляют из себя визуальные новеллы с квест румами и псевдонелинейным сюжетом, на первый взгляд мы вольны влиять на развитие сюжета, но рано или поздно мы наткнёмся на сюжетный замок, открыть который можно лишь пройдя другую сюжетную ветвь. И если в 999 это работатет так себе, то в VLR подобная работа с сюжетным древом раскрывается на все 100 и дарит просто невероятные впечатления, игра затягивает в себя и не отпускает до самого финала.
the arts are quite bad really. Maybe they should have increased the price a bit and polish it further.

Preliminar review (Spoilers free):

I have only played 1 hour of 999 and the port seems pretty good, it has enough options to select the display format and it looks really good. The updated graphics are nice and the keyboard and mouse controls are ok (the only thing I dont like about it is that when you hover over an option it is not recognized until you click on it, but is only a little nuisance and doesnt affect anything). The two reading modes are great, so you can select the format of visual novel you prefer, just to note that if you use ADV mode you miss some narrative texts, like descriptions of places and things like that, so consider it when deciding which one to use.

About the game

I have only played 999 on the DS and it is a great game. The story seems simple at first but gets very interesting quickly. The puzzles are fun and not frustating, and the voices added in the game seems to be pretty nice (only have heard the japanese dub, I cant talk about the english one)

About the price

The price may seem excesive to some people, but if you take into account the new voice dub, the rework of the engine and that they are two games that together sum approximately 60 hours then its not a bad price. So consider picking it up, especially if you havent played them before because they are great.

About the developer

Spike Chunsoft is awesome and the port is pretty good as expected of them. I hope they bring more games to PC of this quality.

As far as I have played there have not been big bugs. The only thing I have encountered is that sometimes displaying inmediately(clicking) the text when a character is speaking makes them to stop, but I expect them to resolve it quickly because it doesnt seem to be nothing big.


As far as I have played: Totally recommended

On a side note, if you enjoy this game make sure to check Danganronpa because it is more or less the same style and its pretty good too.

[h1]First Impressions[/h1]

A lot of people who review now will have played it on the handheld, so I thought it may be useful for someone who had not had any experience with the game give their initial impressions of the game.

[h1]What I think after 2 hours?[/h1]

If I had to use a phrase it would be [b]"Believe the hype"[/b], I was told this was one of the best if not THE best VN there is and boy were they not wrong. After the short space of time I have had with the game I had high expectations, I was worried it wouldn't stand up alongside say Danganronpa or Steins;Gate. What struck me straight away was this is NOT just a VN, this is an old school point and click adventure game as well as a VN. The puzzles are challenging and were a welcome surprise to someone who knew nothing about the gameplay. The characters are interesting almost immediately and well introduced, a couple seem bland at the minute and typical VN trope characters but there is plenty of time for them to develop. There appears to be multiple routes to get to multiple endings, which is great, I love that I can see what route I am on currently and I'm sure that will develop into some form of gameplay mechanic as it is unusual to show you exactly the kind of path you are on. The voice acting is good without excelling, I'm sure I'll grow to love it but at the minute the protagonist is sort of "meh". A BIG surprise as well as the gameplay was the characters being animated during dialogues, I am SO used to the small movements or just the mouth movements, I loved it when the characters started moving.

The story seems like it is going to be stellar, lots of initial mysteries straight off the bat, decent pacing straight away. I'm hoping they can keep it up!

One crash in two hours, it did not like me alt + tab out of the game to go and browse the internet, so be mindful of that, no auto-save so I lost a bit of gameplay, but no biggie, plenty of games hate that and its as much an issue with my set up as the game.

[h1]Future of this review[/h1]

I'll edit this review when I've finished the game and give it a full proper run down, just thought I'd throw this up before the myriad of "I love this game" one liners got tossed up or the typical day 1 griefers who purposefully break the game and then decry the bugs they've found.

Awesome game, finally on steam. Crashed after 15 minutes though.

Quick Port Overview for those looking to buy:

[*] Playable with Keyboard and Mouse, seems responsive

[*] Detailed resolution options only in fullscreen, more limited in Windowed (544p, 720p, 1080p on my 1080p-Monitor). But you can change to a custom resolution via the launcher.ini at
My Documents/My Games/Zero Escape The Nonary Games

[*] Borderless Windowed Option

[*] Simple graphic options menu, includes AA up to 16x and AF

[*] Audio output seems bugged, my headset is the output, which is connected to a PCIe-Soundcard, deactivitating via Windows doesn't work. Workaround is to plug the speakers to the sound card, could be fixed in a patch as far as I can see

[*] On my RX 480/i5 6600k Desktop 999 runs perfectly smooth and fine without dips. It was the same at first on my i5 2520M T420s, but for some reason it started to dip to 17 - 22 FPS within the second riddle. I turned off AA and AF and it's running without the severe frame tanking. Also, I can't see any difference in graphic fidelity with having those turned off. So I guess it's a must-have option to turn off AA and AF if you have a lower end system.

[*] The UI does not scale at all as it seems, the Save Screen is huge and is convoluted, will update when getting further into the game

[*] Menu options don't scroll with mouse wheel or with the movement of your mouse, only a click or using the arrow keys will change the highlighted menu button

[*] There are keyboard shortcuts for the various interactions in the game, but are not rebindable. It's also completely playable only using the mouse so far.

[*] It has only 30 save files, though that is more than enough for someone like me.

[*] The game has native Steam Controller and Dualshock 4 support with the default profiles (thanks to Moskeeto)

[*] 999 and VLR don't have a "Close"-button, but you can quit out of the game via Right Click in the Main Menu or via the B-Button on XBOX (or equivalent) controller

[*] I forgot to note that both Virtues Last Reward and 999 have a options menu, where you can adjust seperate audio sliders like BGM, SFX and Voices. You also have a sensitivity choice for the cursor (if using a Gamepad is something you'd want to do), as well as a option to enable skip text and a choice between Japanese and English voices. I am using the Japanese voiceover and so far, besides the puzzle bits, it seems to be fully voiced with animations.

[*] You can change between GamePad and Keyboard/Mouse on the fly, the only thing that the launcher option for the input device changes seems to be the shown input button ingame

[*] Game speed seems to be tied to framerate, so thats unfortunate.

It seems alright besides the Audio issue. Might want to wait for one or two patches.
